loans.name: Fuatino

texts.en: Fuatino is 30 years old and unmarried with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for three years. Fuatino needs a loan to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, a sack of onions and potatoes. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, a sack of onions and potatoes

loans.name: Veivei

texts.en: Veivei is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Veivei needs a loan to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, bait, flippers, bags of ice and new goggles. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Veivei has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, bait, flippers, bags of ice and new goggles

loans.name: Seiloga

texts.en: Seiloga is an 18-year-old single woman with no children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Seiloga needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast. She plans to save her profits to help expand her business in the future. Seiloga has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is thankful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan that she used for her small store. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business needs. Aside from her mini-store, she also has a tricycle for transport service and is a dealer of personal direct-selling products.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Part of the loan is to pay for personal products which she sells for additional income. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial aid that will be given to her.

Nena dreams of being able to be successful in all her businesses and to send all her children to college. She only wishes for a better life and to lead a quiet and victorious life with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising pigs. Marilou is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Verginia works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed culture business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing. Verginia is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like plastic rope, plastic containers, etc., for her seaweed culture business.

Verginia has been sustaining her business activities through 4 past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her seaweed culture business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 44 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. Vilma works very hard to provide for them. She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. Vilma has been in this business for four years. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mecedita

texts.en:
Mecedita is 54 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy charcoal to sell for her business.

Mecedita has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal for 20 years and also earns an income from buy and sell coconut meat. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Molina

texts.en:
Molina works hard to support her family. Molina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Molina has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Molina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en: Estelita works hard to support her family. Estelita is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Estelita has been in this business for six years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Maricel works hard to support her family. She has a dried-fishmaking business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Maricel is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her dried-fishmaking business.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Mamadi

texts.ru:
Мамади добродушный и жизнерадостный парень в возрасте 24 лет. Он женат и имеет одного ребенка. Всю свою душу он вкладывает в свою работу. Мамади живёт со своей семьёй в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Чтобы прокормить свою семью он занимается своим бизнесом. Мамади занимается деканством и животноводством. 
Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Мамади хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Для этого он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Мамади заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Mamadi, age 24, is a good-natured young man with a positive attitude.  He is married and has one child.  He is entirely devoted to his work.  He lives with his family in a small house in the countryside.  He runs his own farming and animal husbandry business in order to support his family.  

Mamadi's animal husbandry business brings a good income and, for this reason, he would like to expand it by increasing the size of his herd.  Mamadi has therefore contacted MDO Arvand to receive a loan to buy more livestock.  He thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock.

loans.name: Maile

texts.en: Maile is 47 years old and married with 6 children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for seven years. Maile needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, weed killers, sprayers, a watering hose, boots, a wheelbarrow and a tiller. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Maile will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, weed killers, sprayers, a watering hose, boots, a wheelbarrow and a tiller

loans.name: Imakulata

texts.en: Imakulata is 22 years old and single with no children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for one year. Imakulata needs a loan to buy frozen goods, snacks, cordials, canned items, bags of sugar and rice, plastic bags and a scale. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy frozen goods, snacks, cordials, canned items, bags of sugar and rice, plastic bags and a scale

loans.name: La

texts.en: La is a 55-year-old woman who is married with six children. She has a taxi business to earn an income. She has been in this business for four years. La needs a loan to buy new tyres, a new gear box, a taxi sign indicator, engine oil and pay the engineer's bill. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. La joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tyres, a new gear box, a taxi sign indicator, engine oil and pay the engineer's bill

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 33-year-old married woman with no children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Jane needs a loan to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and also help with the refurbishment of her house. Jane has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler and soft drinks

loans.name: Dúo Fortaleza Group

texts.es: Dúo fortaleza,Don José Daniel de 49 años de edad empezó su negocio hace 17 años Empezó vendiendo refacciones y luego decidió entregar almuerzos En una fábrica, vendiendo diez almuerzos  al día hasta ahora vende Treinta y cinco a cincuenta almuerzos, le agradece a Dios por las Oportunidades que le ha dado desde que era un joven,en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito pára la compra de productos comestibles para la elavoracion de refacciones.
texts.en: The Fortaleza Duo: José Daniel, age 49, began his business 17 years ago.  He began selling snacks, and later he decided to deliver lunches to a factory, selling ten lunches per day.  Now, he sells thirty-five to fifty lunches.  He thanks God for the opportunities he has given him since he was young.  On this occasion, he is requesting this loan for the purchase of edible products for snack production.

loans.use: to buy edible products for snack production.

loans.name: Va

texts.en: Va is 44 years old and married with 4 children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. Va needs a loan to buy a rake, a wheelbarrow, a pitchfork, a tiller, gloves, chemicals, seeds and new boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2015. Va will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a rake, a wheelbarrow, a pitchfork, a tiller, gloves, chemicals, seeds and new boots

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is grateful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan that she used for repairs and maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business needs. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. It is important that her tricycle is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service and steady income. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be extended to her.

Nenita aims to sustain her business and prays for the safety of her passengers. She desires to have a deeper relationship with God and lead a victorious life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of a tricycle for transportation service.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell root crops business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of root crops to sell for her buy and sell root crops business. Edna has been in this business for one year. Edna earns more income from food vending.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of root crops to sell

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 38 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Liza has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buy and sell rice and vegetables.

Liza aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 59 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy charcoal to sell for her business.

Perlita has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal for 18 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Brendalyn

texts.en:
As a  parent of one child, Brendalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a dried-fish-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Brendalyn is borrowing PHP 12,500 through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to make dried fish for her dried-fish-making business.

Brendalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Godilla

texts.en:
Godilla is 59 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Godilla has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel, 33, is single with two children who are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Anabel has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future, Anabel would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru:
Малохат трудолюбивая женщина 60 лет. Она замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Она занимается куплей и продажей хозяйственных товаров. Она сотрудничает с МДО Арванд  с 2006 года. 
В данное время она хочет получить кредит для расширения своей деятельности. Она обратилась в Арванд 
 и заранее благодарит и говорит «Спасибо за поддержку и доверие!»
texts.en: Malohat is a 60-year-old hardworking woman.  She is married and has had five children.  She makes a living buying and selling household goods.  She has been a client of MDO Arvand since 2006.  At the moment, she wants to receive a loan to increase her activity.  She has therefore turned to Arvand and she thanks them in advance, saying "Thank you for your support and trust!"

loans.use: to buy household goods for resale.

loans.name: Mahmudjon

texts.ru:
Махмудджон жизнерадостный, трудолюбивый парень 28 лет. Махмудджон  пока  ещё не женат. Он занимается ремонтом домов и квартир.  Махмудджон украшает  их разными рисунками и оттенками. Он мастер по этой профессии. Этим он научился у своего отца. 
Скоро у него намечается свадьба. Он женится. Но чтобы провести красивую свадьбу требуются большие средства. Его собственный доход этого не позволяет и для этого ему необходимо  небольшое количество денежных средств. Для этого он обратился в Арванд для получения кредита. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку!!!
texts.en:
Mahmudjon, age 28, is a hardworking, cheerful young man.  He is not married yet.  For a living, he renovates houses and apartments and decorates them with various designs and colors.  He is a very skilled worker who learned his trade from his father.

Mahmudjon is getting married very soon.  However, a nice wedding requires a lot of money, and Mahmudjon's income is definitely not sufficient.  He needs a bit more money and has therefore turned to MDO Arvand to take a loan.  He thanks Arvand in advance for all their support!!!

loans.use: to pay for his own weddings expenses.

loans.name: Ziyagul

texts.ru: Зиягул, 38 лет, не замужем, есть дочь школьница. У Зиягул - средне-специальное образование, работает учителем истории, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 7 лет назад. Благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию Зиягул, на сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 20 овец.  Этот бизнес приносит Зиягул и ее семье хорошую прибыль в размере до 22,000 сом (KGS). Зиягул одна растит свою дочь и этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зиягул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку теленка. Таким образом она сможет получать большую прибыль от бизнеса и позволит улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en: Ziyagul, age 38, is not married, but she has a daughter who is in elementary school.  Ziyagul herself has a specialized secondary education and she works as a history teacher.  In order to bring an additional source of income home, she has been involved in animal husbandry for the past seven years.  Thanks to her determination and very hard work, she currently owns four cows and 20 sheep.  This business brings her and her family a good income of about 22,000 som (KGS).  However, Ziyagul raises her daughter alone, and the money she makes is not enough for a decent life.  For this reason, and in order to increase her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy a calf.  Thanks to this loan, she will be able to increase her profits, which will help her to improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase one calf to help bolster her income.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily, 53, is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Renato, a tricycle driver and they have five children.  She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet her family's daily personal and household needs.
 
Emily operates a small variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food.  She earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of 1,000 PHP a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as canned goods, sacks of rice, charcoal, noodles, soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are their source to meet their daily expenses and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Emily hopes to maintain and grow her business so they can have a better quality of life. She prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell at her small store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy peanut sprouts, pots, a tiller, plastic bags, chemicals, gloves, and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Poto

texts.en: Poto is 43 years old and married with three children. She owns and operates a store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for three years. Poto needs a loan to buy a refrigerator, canned items, soft drinks, frozen goods, a new scale, snacks and bags of rice and sugar. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, canned items, soft drinks, frozen goods, a new scale, snacks and bags of rice and sugar

loans.name: Edwin Antonio

texts.es:
Edwin, de 27 años de edad, está acompañado, tiene un hijo de dos años de edad.- Actualmente, se dedica al trabajo agrícola, solo estudio hasta bachillerato, su pareja trabaja vendiendo periódico.

Edwin, empezó a trabajar el cultivo de yuca, esta actividad fue enseñada por su tío, actualmente trabaja una hectárea de yuca y también se dedica a la crianza de ganado; él compra ganado pequeño y después de seis meses aproximadamente los vende.

El dinero de este crédito será para comprar insumos agrícolas: como abono, fertilizante, insecticidas y para el pago de preparación de tierras. 

El sueño que tiene es, poder llegar a tener una excelente cosecha y con las ganancias empezar a construir su vivienda que tanto ha deseado.
texts.en:
Edwin, age 27, is in a common-law marriage and has a two-year-old son.  Currently, he works in agriculture.  He only went to school through secondary school.  His partner works selling newspapers.

Edwin started working in the cultivation of cassava.  His uncle taught him this activity.  Currently, he works a hectare of cassava, and he also works raising cattle.  He buys small cattle, and after about six months he sells them.

The money from this loan will be used to buy agricultural supplies, such as manure, fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay for the preparation of the land.

His dream is to be able to have an excellent harvest and, with the profits, begin to build the house that he has wanted so much.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, such as manure, fertilizer, and insecticide, and to pay for the preparation of the land.

loans.name: Felauai

texts.en:
Felauai is a 59-year-old widow with three children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for three years. 

Felauai has requested a loan to buy brushes, fabric paint, materials, stencils and wooden carved designs. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy brushes, fabric paint, materials, stencils and wooden carved designs

loans.name: Tapaau

texts.en:
Tapaau is a 33-year-old married woman with two children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Tapaau needs a loan to buy foam cups, cordials, a bag of sugar, a large jug, a large spoon, Chinese candy and rubber gloves. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tapaau has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy foam cups, cordials, a bag of sugar, a large jug, a large spoon, Chinese candy and rubber gloves

loans.name: Vadim

texts.en:
Vadim has been selling cell phone accessories for three years. Since his last loan from Kiva, he opened another outlet. Now he has three shopping outlets. Vadim is a hardworking and open person. He is planning to buy an apartment for his family. 

Vadim is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAH to expand the range of cell phone accessories. The loan will help to get new clients.

loans.use: to expand the range of cell phone accessories

loans.name: Lynne

texts.en:
Lynne engages in a food vending business.  She sells snack food like puto (rice cake) and coconut candy roll. She is a 39-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 16 and the youngest is 1 year old. She lives in Loon, Bohol. She has been engaged in this kind of business for five years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients like flour, cooking oil, baking powder and sugar. These ingredients will be used in producing more rice cake to sell. It will cause to improve her earnings and start to manage her income. With this, she can now prepare nutritious diets for the whole family.

She hopes to expand her business to become more sustainable in order to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like flour, cooking oil, baking powder and sugar

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Forty-five-year-old Bernadeth engages in a hog-raising business. She raises and sells hogs. She has three children aged 15, 14 and 10 years old. She resides in Loon, Bohol. She has been raising hogs for more than 10 years now.

She has requested a loan to buy additional piglets, pig feed and supplements.  These will help improve her hog-raising business. She will be able to raise healthy hogs.  With this, her income will improve and she can continue to send her children to school. She is hoping that she could venture into another business to have other sources of income.

In the future, she dreams of expanding her hog-raising business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, pig feed and supplements

loans.name: Adulfa

texts.en:
Adulfa earns a living by selling fish. She is a 65-year-old married woman with four grown children from Loon, Bohol. She has been engaged in fish vending for more than 20 years now. 
 
She is asking for a loan to buy an icebox, fish and cellophane. These will be used to sell more fish to augment her income. She could now improve her livelihood. She could now set aside some of the profit for possible business ventures. She could now prepare nutritious food which is essential in her day-to-day activity.

In the future, Adulfa dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy an icebox, fish and cellophane

loans.name: Imron

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Imron.  Imron lives in East Serang, located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Imron owns a small stall where he sells snacks, drinks, groceries, and mobile phone accessories and provides mobile payment service for his community. He joined Ruma in 2013 and this is the second time he is applying for a loan from Kiva. He feels that since he joined Ruma, he learned a lot about how to improve his business, as well as contribute to his community. 

As the business keep growing, Imron is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Imron improve his business and accordingly, his community that needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Imron is the one who is standing. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic household commodities ranging from cooking oil, noodles, coffee and sugar to canned goods and toiletries. She is a 44-year-old woman with three children from Loon, Bohol. Her youngest child is 10 years old. She has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store for two years already. 

Helen has requested a loan to buy supplies like various canned goods and soft drinks.  These will help fill her store and cause it to attract more buyers to shop and purchase. With these, her earnings will improve and start to balance her finances. She could now start to venture into any possible business opportunities.

Helen dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and sustainable for her to continue to support the welfare of her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies like various canned goods and soft drinks

loans.name: Supriyanti

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Supriyanti. Supriyanti lives in East Serang, located about two hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her three daughters. Supriyanti owns a small stall where she sells daily consumer products and provides mobile payment services for her community. She joined Ruma in 2013. As a woman, she wanted to join Ruma because she wants to help her husband to improve their life and learn about how to manage another business opportunity, as well as make more contributions to her community. 

As the business grows, Supriyanti is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Supriyanti improve her business and accordingly, her community which needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Supriyanti is the one who is standing in her own small stall. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community

loans.name: Matrasul

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Matrasul. Matrasul lives in East Serang, located about two hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and his only child. Matrasul owns a stall where he sells daily consumer products and also provides mobile payment service for his community. He joined Ruma in 2013 and this is the second time he is applying for a loan from Kiva. He feels that since he joined Ruma, he learned a lot about how to improve his business and how to manage another business opportunity, as well as making more contributions to his community. 

As the business keeps growing, Matrasul is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Matrasul improve his business and accordingly, his community which needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Matrasul is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community

loans.name: Aiden

texts.en: Aiden is a fearless, married, honest, hardworking and shrewd brick-laying gentleman from Kyamuhunga Igara, a renown tea growing area west Bushenyi district.  He is married to one wife with three children. This is his second loan from UGAFODE microfinance ltd (MDI) and he is also a security guard where he earns extra income as a salary earner. He started the brick-laying business to earn money from it and to meet the demand of the larger number of people building permanent houses. So he would be assured of income. He is borrowing UGX 1,000,000 to buy firewood to use while burning bricks to sell. Most of his clients are builders and construction companies in and around Bushenyi District. He hopes to build his own house since he is still living with his mother in the same house family house. He faces a main challenge of bad weather, especially the rainy season where the bricks don’t dry in time and break or get destroyed by the rain and he encourages the Ugafode institution to keep in the service of helping local people to move out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy wood for burning bricks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara is a 45-year-old woman who is married with five children. She has a small taxi business to earn an income. She has been in this business for six years. Sara needs a loan to buy a new engine, a gear box, four new shocks, tyres, refill air-con and new headlights. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Sara joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new engine, a gear box, four new shocks, tyres, refill air-con and new headlights

loans.name: Simativa

texts.en:
Simativa is a 45-year-old separated woman with six children. She makes and sells Samoan fried chips in her community to earn a living. She has six years of experience with this business. 

Simativa needs a loan to buy a large pot, a barrel of cooking oil, taro, bananas, a strainer and a gas burner. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Simativa has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy a large pot, a barrel of cooking oil, taro, bananas, a strainer and a gas burner

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is a 20-year-old single woman with no children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Ivy needs a loan to buy a chest freezer, foam cups, Chinese candy, a bag of sugar, rubber gloves and a cooler. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Ivy has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy a chest freezer, foam cups, Chinese candy, a bag of sugar, rubber gloves and a cooler

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir has been selling women's shoes for 19 years at the market. Otherwise, Vladimir often travels with the shoes to nearby villages, offering his merchandise to those who live there. Due to Kiva loans, Vladimir has a good business. He is a hardworking, sociable and active person.

Vladimir is asking for a loan of 20,000 UAH in order to increase the assortment of spring shoes, especially for village customers. The sales are especially good in villages.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of spring shoes, especially for village customers

loans.name: Elenoa

texts.en: Elenoa is a 45-year-old married woman with 7 children. She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has 11 years of experience with this business. Elenoa needs a loan to buy a new fishing canoe, a spear, goggles, flippers, hooks, fishing line and bait. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Elenoa has been a member of SPBD since 2003.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing canoe, a spear, goggles, flippers, hooks, fishing line and bait

loans.name: Sharlene

texts.en: Sharlene is a 44-year-old unmarried woman with four children. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Sharlene needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large stove. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Sharlene has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large stove

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida, 42 years old, is married and a resident of Lao Proper, Plaridel, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold to the fish market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already.  Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. 

On May 10, 2011, both Nida and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to request a loan because they wanted to buy fishing nets. But aside from the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.  She has now applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy her fish for resale. She is wishing that with Paglaum’s help, and with patience and diligence of her husband, she is looking forward to being successful vendor someday and to owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Guisselle

texts.en: Guisselle, 36, is married with three children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for seven years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children and their health needs. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already requested loans previously to purchase additional stock and now she is reapplying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza, age 35, is from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with four children. Analiza joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. The co-op supported her by providing the capital to start her snack-vending business. Helping the family survive, she gives her best ability to make delicious food snacks in order to sell all of them. 

Analiza is now trying to expand her resources, so she decided to engage in a pig-raising business. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 8,000 to pay for construction materials to build her pig pen.  She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wanted her business to be well known and to build good business management for her loyal customers.  With her extra income, she wishes to live a happy and comfy life.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials to build her pig pen

loans.name: Sigui Kadi Group

texts.fr: Sigui Kadi est formé de 8 femmes battantes qui exercent dans plusieurs domaines d'activité. Ce groupe est à son 13 prêt avec ACFIME et jusque là, les remboursements se font sans problème. Aoua, membre représentatif et veuve et mère de 6 enfants dont 1 continue d'aller à l’école. Les autres enfants de Aoua sont majeurs et parmi eux, certains travaillent et d'autres sont mariés. Aoua est commerçante et elle vend des tubercules (patate,igname, pomme de terre,..). Elle a besoin du prêt pour acheter plus de tubercule pour vendre à sa clientèle. A l'issue de ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de continuer son commerce, de s'occuper de ses enfants(nourrir, habiller, soigner en cas de maladie,...).
texts.en:
The 'Sigui Kadi' Group is made up of eight spirited women who run various different businesses.  This will be the group's thirteenth loan with the field partner, ACFIME.  All their loans have been repaid without any problems.

Aoua is the group representative.  She is a widow and mother to six children, one of whom still attends school.  Her other children are all grown up, some work and some are married.  Aoua sells root vegetables (potatoes, yams, sweet potatoes, etc).  She needs this loan to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Aoua's sales will generate a profit which will allow her to continue her business and take care of her children (feed, clothe and provide any necessary healthcare).

loans.use: to buy root vegetables (potatoes, yams, sweet potatoes, etc) for resale.

loans.name: Femmes Dynamiques 3 Group

texts.fr: Comme son nom l'indique, ce groupe regroupe des femmes dynamiques qui exercent dans plusieurs domaines d'activité. Ce groupe est à son 5ème prêt avec ACFIME, mais jusque là, le contrat se passe bien. Fatoumata, membre représentatif est commerçante, mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont certains sont scolarisés.Cette brave dame a besoin du crédit pour acheter des produits cosmétiques et surtout des pommades pour vendre.A l'aide de son commerce, elle arrive à prendre soin de ses enfants et à soutenir son époux qui aussi commerçant à faire les dépenses de leur maison. A l'issue de ses ventes, son bénéfices lui permettra de continuer son activités et de faire des épargnes.
texts.en:
The 'Femmes Dynamiques 3' Group (Dynamic Women's Group) is made up of spirited women who run various different businesses.  This will be the group's fifth loan with the field partner, ACFIME.  All their loans have been repaid without any problems.

Fatoumata is a retailer and the group representative.  She is married and mother to seven children, some of whom still attend school.  Fatoumata needs this loan to buy cosmetic products, especially creams, to sell to her customers.

Fatoumata's sales will generate a profit which will allow her to continue her business and to save some money for the future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products, specifically creams, for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to restore a recently purchased vehicle so it can be resold.

loans.name: Yusron

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Yusron. Yusron lives in East Serang, located about a two hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Yusron owns a stall where he sells Indonesian women's traditional clothes and fabrics and now he also provides mobile payment service for his community. He joined Ruma in 2013 and this is the second time he is applying for a loan from Kiva. He feels that since he joined Ruma, he learned a lot about how to improve his business and how to find other business opportunities, as well as contribute more to his community. 

As the business keep growing, Yusron is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Yusron improve his business and accordingly, his community that needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Yusron is the one who is standing in his own stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community

loans.name: Devi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Devi. Devi lives in East Serang, located about a two hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her two children. Devi is a fulltime housewife and mother. She joined Ruma in 2013 and this is the second time she is asking for a loan from Kiva. As a woman, she wanted to join Ruma because she wanted to help her husband improve their life and learn about how to start a business, as well as contribute more to her community. 

As the business keeps growing, Devi is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Devi improve her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Devi is the one who is standing and smiling. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing, and various personal care products.

loans.name: Sané

texts.fr:
Madame Sané né en 1974, mariée et mère de famille s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle est originaire du sud du pays et achète sa marchandise de là bas pour venir la proposer ici. Son commerce consiste à vendre des balaies ; de l’huile de palme et un produit alimentaire très prisé dans la préparation du riz au poisson sénégalais appelé » nététou ». Sané vient renforcer son capital pour satisfaire les commandes de sa clientèle par l’intermédiaire de ce crédit pris à l’IMCEC. 
Elle participe à la gestion du foyer en appuyant sur la dépense quotidienne. Comme elle a tendance à se déplacer aussi, elle utilise du crédit pour communiquer avec ses fournisseurs et sa clientèle.
Si elle a le fond nécessaire, elle désire ouvrir une mini entreprise de vente de bois de chauffe et de charbon de bois en y associant des membres de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sané was born in 1974. She is married and a mother and has been running a business for over 10 years. She is originally from the south of the country and buys her merchandise there in order to resell it where she lives now. She sells brooms, palm oil and a popular ingredient used in the preparation of a Senegalese fish and rice dish called "Nètètou".

Sanè would like a loan from UIMCEC to reinforce her working capital so that she can satisfy her customers' orders. She helps with the management of the household by contributing to the daily expenses. Since she is often on the move, she uses some credit in order to communicate with her suppliers and her customers. When she has enough funds, she would like to open a small family business selling firewood and charcoal.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and brooms for resale.

loans.name: Grupo San Francisco Solo Group

texts.es:
Grupo San Francisco Solo, está ubicado en una comunidad mazahua, los habitantes son personas muy amables que aún conservan su lengua materna. Uno de los cultivos más importantes de la región es el maíz que se utiliza para hacer la tradicional tortilla mexicana que se encuentra presente en todas las comidas de los hogares del país. 

Doña Julia es una mujer muy amable y reconocida en su comunidad, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada con el señor Benito y tienen un niño  que estudia su educación primaria. Doña Julia siempre ha sido una mujer de campo, dice que quien sabe trabajar la tierra, tiene una manera de salir adelante. Orgullosa comenta que gracias a sus padres aprendió a labrar la tierra y a criar animales. Hace ocho años se aventuró a tener sus propios becerros, pollos y pavos. “De los años que llevo criando animales nunca se me ha muerto ninguno y todos se han vendido a un muy buen precio” comentó Doña Julia.

Hace dos años, Doña Julia conoció a VisionFund México y está muy agradecida con el apoyo porque el número de sus animales ha ido creciendo poco a poco, lo cual le ha permitido mejorar su vivienda y su pequeño ha podido seguir en la escuela sin problemas “Me gustaría que estudiara una carrera profesional para que pudiera mejorar su calidad de vida” comento Doña Julia. 

Hace algunos días Julia vendió tres becerros por lo que actualmente necesita de un nuevo préstamo para comparar más animales y alimento como zacate y maíz. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener un establo lleno de animales como vacas y becerros, tener crías y dejar de comprar animales. Además, le gustaría contratar a algunas personas de su comunidad para ayudarle en su actividad. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo son Olga, Profirio y Juan quienes invertirán en borregos, Ana Laura en tienda, Maria Josefina en becerros, Luis en pollos y pavos.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el centro del municipio donde viven el grupo, Doña Julia es viste un mandil morado y un collar rojo que es parte del traje mazahua que utilizan las mujeres de su comunidad*
texts.en:
Group San Francisco Solo is located in the mazahua community. The citizens are very kind people who still conserve their mother tongue. One of the most important crops of the region is maize, which is used to make traditional Mexican tortillas, which are present in every meal of the homes of the country. 
Julia is a very kind woman, and well-known in her community. She is 54 years old, she is married to Benito, and they have one son who goes to primary school. Julia has always been a woman from the countryside, she says that those who know how to work the land have a way of getting ahead. Proudly, she says that thanks to her parents she learned to cultivate the fields and to breed animals. Eight years ago she took a risk and got her own calves, chickens, and turkeys. “In all the years I’ve been breeding animals, none of them have died on me, and they have all sold at a good price,” says Julia. 
Two years ago, Julia got to know VisionFund Mexico, and she is very grateful for the support, because her number of animals has been increasing little by little, which has allowed her to improve her house, and her son has been able to stay in school without problems. “I would like him to study a professional career so he can improve his quality of life,” says Julia. 
Some days ago, Julia sold three calves, which is why she needs a new loan to purchase more animals and feed, such as fodder and maize. One of his dreams is to have a stable full of animals such as cows and calves, who can have offspring, and stop purchasing animals. She would also like to hire some people in her community to help her with her occupation. 
The other members of the group are Olga, Profirio, and Juan, who will invest in sheep, Ana Laura in a store, Maria Josefina in calves, and Luis in chickens and turkeys. 
*The photograph was taken in the center of the municipality where the group lives. Julia is wearing a purple apron and a red collar, which is part of the mazahua dress that women wear in the community.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and feed.

location.town: San Francisco Solo, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Ruth Vanessa

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 21 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales principalmente.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus clientes. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales como gallinas, patos y pavos para incrementar el stock de su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio. Ruth espera incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ruth, 21, is a single mother and lives with her son in the district of Oyotun.  It is a rural area in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Peru.  The local prople work mainly in agriculture and animal farming.

Ruth raises and sells animals such as hens, ducks, turkeys and others.  She has over three years' experience in the business and enjoys good personal and work references from her customers.  The loan she is requesting is to buy hens, ducks and turkeys to increase her inventory.  This will give her more animal variety and productivity, which will have an impact on her business.

Ruth wants to increase her stock of animals so she can satisfy customer needs in the area and generate more income in order to improver her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more animals such as hens, ducks, and turkeys to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Las Divas Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por 4 mujeres emprendedoras (Dolía Elizabeth, Merylu Magdalena, Leonor y Paulina Auxiliadora), originarias de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas, se unieron hace 8 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para poder acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana,  para tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios de: venta de ropa nueva, venta de bastimentos, frutas, verduras y comida y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Están solicitando su segundo préstamo con Kiva. Con el primer préstamo Merylu Magdalena logró comprar inventario de productos para su pulpería y surtirla con nuevos productos como embutidos.

Paulina Auxiliadora: Es nueva integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora luchadora, amable y alegre de 53 años de edad, madre soltera de 6 hijos: 4 son mayores de edad e independientes, el de 16 años de edad cursa su primer año de ingeniería en informática en una de las universidades de Bilwi y el menor de 14 años estudia su cuarto año de secundaria. Con gran esfuerzo ha sacado adelante a sus hijos, al establecer su pequeño negocio de venta de fritos y ropa usada en un tramo en uno de los mercados de Bilwi. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar en Managua una paca mixta y venderla a precios accesibles a su clientela y diversificar sus productos con la venta de calzado que comprará en Masaya y poder tener más ingresos y apoyar  a sus hijos en sus estudios. Sueña con llegar a ser una comerciante próspera y exitosa, establecer una tienda de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
The group consists of four women entrepreneurs (Dolia Elizabeth, Merylu Magdalena, Leonor and Paulina Auxiliadora) who are from the city of Bilwi in Puerto Cabezas.  The got together eight months ago to work together and request a loan through Pana Pana to improve their businesses: sale of new clothing, supplies, fruit, vegetables and food, in order to improve their families' lifestyles.  This is their second Kiva loan.  With the first one, Merylu Magdalena was able to buy inventory for her grocery store and stock new products like sausage.

Paulina Auxiliadora is a new member of the communal bank.  She is 53, kind, cheerful and hard-working.  She is a single mother of six children: 4 who are adults and independent; a 16-year-old in first year of computer engineering at one of the universities in Bilwi; and the youngest who is 14 and in his fourth year of secondary school.  With much effort Paulina has been able to support her children by establishing a small business selling fried foods and used clothing at a market in Bilwi.  She is requesting her first loan to buy a mixed pack of clothes in Managua to sell at low prices to customers.  She will diversify sales with shoes that she will buy in Masaya in order to earn more income and support her children in their education.  Her dream is to become a prosperous, successful merchant and establish a new clothing shop.

loans.use: To buy a mixed pack of clothing in Managua.

loans.name: Giringingo Group

texts.fr:
Hamalie il fait partie du groupe  Giringingo  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 39 ans et est marié à Séverin, un  cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants   dont 5 étudient.

Elle fait du commerce de  haricot, de  riz, de farine de manioc, …dans  depuis 7 ans.

Il est à son  deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (riz, haricot, farine de manioc,…) à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Hamalie is a member of the Giringingo group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 39 years old and married to Séverin, a farmer. The couple have 6 children, 5 of whom attend school. 

Hamalie has been selling food items like beans, rice and cassava flour for 7 years. This is his second loan from Turame. His Kiva-sponsored loan will increase his working capital and allow him to buy a lot of items (rice, beans, cassava flour, etc.) to resell in his shop in order to earn more money.

loans.use: to buy groceries for his shop (rice, beans, cassava flour, etc.).

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es: Mirian tiene 58 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo. Ella es pequeña comerciante de frutas y verduras desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como junto a su esposo mantiene la economía del hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea invertir en la construcción de un baño sanitario lavable y de esta forma dar a su familia condiciones más higiénicas. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, inodoro, etc.
texts.en: Mirian is 58 years old and lives in a privately owned house with her husband. Mirian has been a small trader of fruits and vegetables for a long time and this work has helped her and her husband to support their household. In order to improve her living conditions, Mirian is applying for a loan from FUSAI as she wants to build a bathroom. This will provide her family with more hygienic living conditions. In order to carry out this work, Mirian is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, a toilet, and more.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, a toilet, and more, in order to build a hygienic bathroom.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es: Doña Asuncion de 60 años se dedica hace mas de 6 años a una pequeña venta de granos basicos ( tienda) ella solicita su credito para la compra de insumos como (pasta, azucar, jabon, gaseosas, frijol sopas. Etc) y otra parte del credito ella comprara 2 vitrinas ya que su tienda necesita como mostrar sus productos, su meta para este año es poder surtir mejor su negocio ya que donde ella vive es una area un poco lejana del mercado y hay pocas tiendas y ella decea aprovechar y ofrecer un mejor servicio y variedad de productos a sus clientes ya que no cuenta con suficiente efectivo para invertir. Ella espera que la puedan apoyar.
texts.en: Asunción is 60 years old and for six years has made a living with a small shop selling staple goods. Asunción is applying for a loan in order to buy supplies such as pasta, sugar, soap, fizzy drinks, beans, soups, and more. Some of the loan will also be used to buy two display cases as Asunción needs a way to display products. Asunción’s goal for this year is to stock up her business better as she lives in an area that is quite far from the market and there are few local shops. She wants to take advantage of this and offer better service and products to her customers. Asunción does not have enough money to do this and hopes that you can support her.

loans.use: to buy staple goods to sell.

loans.name: Gardenia Nataly

texts.es:
Gardenia tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa familiar en una zona rural de Nueva Arica que se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio como actividades económicas principales.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como gallinas, patos, pavos, cuyes, entre otros, realiza esta actividad desde hace 03 años contando con experiencia en este negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, de esta manera Gardenia espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que va a generarle un mayor nivel de ventas que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gardenia is 20 years old and has a partner. She lives in her family home in a rural area in Nueva Arica, in the Cayaltí district of Chiclayo province in the Piura region. Piura is in the Lambayeque region of Peru’s northern coast. Here, the people make a living in farming, cattle-raising, and trade.

Gardenia makes a living raising and selling farm animals, such as hens, ducks, turkeys, guinea pigs, and more. She has been doing this work for three years and has good personal and professional references locally as a result of this experience. 

This loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of animals, and feed to fatten them up. In buying these animals, Gardenia hopes to offer a greater variety of animals to her customers, providing her with higher sales and allowing her to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals, and feed to fatten them up.

loans.name: Migdalia Yuliana

texts.es: La señora Migdalia Yuliana de 28 años, tiene 2 hijos y se dedica a la venta de regalos hace mas de 5 años y tambien posee un cafe internet ya que donde ella vive es un area un poco lejana del mercado central de su comunidad, ella solicita su credito  una parte ella comprara audifonos para 6 computadoras ya que no poseen audifonos y sus clientes solicitan mucho y otra parte del credito comprara  y surtira su venta de regalos ( cremas, lociones, perfumes, utencilios de cocina, ropa para dama y para niños etc) su meta es poder tener un local mas amplio y tener variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y poder tener un mejor ingresos y poder ofrecerles una mejor educacion a sus hijos.
texts.en: Migdalia Yuliana is 28 years old and has two children. She has made a living selling gifts for five years, and also owns an internet café as she lives in an area that is a little far from the central market. Migdalia is applying for this loan to buy headphones for six computers, as she does not own this much-requested item. Some of the loan will also buy used to stock up on gifts (creams, lotions, perfumes, kitchen utensils, children’s and women’s clothing, and more). Migdalia’s goal is to have a larger shop and a variety of products to offer to her customers. She wants a higher income and to be able to offer her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy equipment for an internet café.

loans.name: Nueva Generación Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Nueva Generación” está compuesto por nueve mujeres mazahuas, son muy trabajadoras y comprometidas con el bienestar de su familia. La relación entre ellas sigue creciendo ya que se conocen desde hace años. 

María Concepción es una de las fundadoras del grupo y orgullosa de sus raíces. Es mejor conocida como "Tía Concha" incluso aunque no haya parentesco, pero es una mujer mayor, que merece respeto y en su comunidad, el decirle tía a una persona es una muestra de respeto. 

Tía Concha tiene 50 años de edad, está casada con el señor Enrique y son padres de 9 hijos aunque ya sólo 3 dependen de ellos, sólo una chica se encuentra estudiando la preparatoria. Tía Concha lleva 15 años solicitando crédito a VisionFund México, con su primer préstamo inició la cría de borregos y durante 10 años esta fue su actividad principal. “Con mis borreguitos pude ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos de los niños”. Las ganancias le permitieron abrir una pequeña tienda de abarrotes hace 5 años. Al principio fue difícil ya que tenían que construir un local para guardar la mercancía, que en aquél entonces sólo podía comprar algunos productos. Poco a poco la mercancía fue incrementando así como las condiciones del luegar.

Concepción está muy agradecida con el préstamo porque ha significado una gran ayuda “Realmente sin mi préstamo no hubiera podido tener mi tiendita. Mi esposo y yo vivimos mas tranquilos porque podemos solventar nuestros gastos y los gastos de mi hija". Con la intención de seguir creciendo, Tía Concha necesita una nueva inversión para adquirir leche, pan, huevo, productos enlatados, refrescos, etc. Su mayor anhelo es que su hija pueda terminar una carrera profesional a diferencia de sus demás hermanos que no lograron continuar por falta de ingresos. 

Las demás integrantes del grupo son Leticia, Eduviges, Virginia, Maria de la Luz y Maria Guadalupe quienes invertirán en borregos; Delfina, en cerdos; Maria Dolores en pavos y Juana, en dulces.    

*La fotografía fue tomada en el municipio donde viven las integrantes, en las escaleras del quiosco. Tía Concha viste un traje mazahua típico de la región en color rojo*
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nueva Generación" consists of nine Mazahua women who are very hard workers and committed to their families' well-being.  The relationship they have continues to grow as they have known each other for many years.

Maria Concepcion is one of the founders of the group and proud of her roots.  She is better known as "Tia Concha" (Aunt Concha) even if there is no family relationship.  She is an elderly woman and deserves respect.  In her community, calling someone "aunt" is a way of showing respect.

Tia Concha is 50 years old, married to Enrique and they are the parents of nine children, although only three still live with them.  Their daughter is in high school.  Tia Concha has had access to loans through VisionFund Mexico for 15 years.  She used her first loan to raise sheep which was her main activity for ten years.  "With my little sheep I was able to help my husband with the children's expenses."  Her earnings allowed her to open a small grocery store five years ago.  At first it was difficult because they had to build a warehouse for the merchandise and then they only could buy a few products.  Little by little the stock of goods grew and conditions improved.

Concepcion is very grateful for the loan because it has been of great help.  "Truthfully, withou my loan I would not have been able to set up my store.  My husband and I live more calmly knowing we can cover our expenses and those of our daughter."  In order to continue expanding Tia Concha is in need of a new loan to buy milk, bread, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.  Her greatest desire is for her daughter to finish her degree, unlike her siblings who were unable to continue their education for lack of income.

The other members of the group are Leticia, Eduviges, Virginia, Maria de la Luz and Maria Guadalupe who will invest in sheep; Delfina, in pigs; Maria Dolores in turkeys and Juana in sweets.

*The picture was taken in the town where the members live, on the steps of the kiosk.  Tia Concha is wearing typical Mazahua dress, in red*

loans.use: To buy more grocery products such as milk, bread, eggs, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

location.town: San Miguel La Labor, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Katie

texts.en:
Katie is a 51-year-old, single woman with 2 children. 

She makes and sells sandwiches in her community to earn a living, and she has 2 years of experience with this business. She needs a loan to buy loaves of sliced bread, a jar of butter, a toaster, a gas stove, cases of eggs, mayonnaise, lettuce and cucumbers. 

Katie plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy loaves of sliced bread, a jar of butter, a toaster, a gas stove, cases of eggs, mayonnaise, lettuce and cucumbers

loans.name: Alofa

texts.en:
Alofa is a 21-year-old woman who is unmarried with no children. 

She has a small business distributing and delivering stock around Samoa, and she has 1 year's experience with this business. She needs a loan to buy boxes of pencils, ball pens, rulers, erasers, sharpeners, deodorants, playing cards and glue. 

Alofa will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy boxes of pencils, ball pens, rulers, erasers, sharpeners, deodorants, playing cards and glue

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora, estudió hasta octavo grado, está felizmente acompañada, su pareja trabaja como albañil, vive con sus tres hijos, de los cuales solo el mayor trabaja, desempeñandose en varios oficios como estructuras metálicas, carpintería, albañilería, electricidad etc.

Rosario, cuando tenía 14 años de edad, empezó a trabajar embolsando pan en una panadería de su comunidad, a los 16 años se acompañó por primera vez, pero la relación solo duró tres años, cuando cumplió 17 años de edad empezó a vender especias para otras personas y fue cuando tenía 23 años que decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de especias.- También vende ropa y sale a vender a diferentes tiendas de varios cantones de la zona oriental del país.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar materia prima para la venta de especias y también para comprar ropa para vender.

Rosario, sueña con construir su propia casita, pues donde vive es casa familiar y quiere tener su casa propia, para que les quede como patrimonio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosario, 36, is a determined woman who has an eigth grade education.  She lives happily with her partner who is a bricklayer.  They have three children and the eldest is the only child who works, in different jobs such as metal carpentry, carpentry, bricklaying, electrician, etc.

When Rosario was 14 years old she started working at a bakery in her community, bagging bread.  At age 16 she entered into her first relationship which only lasted three years.  At age 17 she started selling spices for other people and at 23 she set up her own spice business.  She also sells clothing and visits different shops in the eastern part of the country.

The loan she is requesting is to buy inventory for her spice business and also clothing to sell.

Rosario's dream is to build her own house for the family so she will have something to leave to her children.

loans.use: To buy inventory to sell spices and clothing.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora, estudió hasta tercer grado, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, vive solo con sus dos hijos.

Cecilia, desde muy pequeña aprendió a trabajar para ganarse la vida, fue cuando tenía 14 años que se fué a vivir a la capital, buscando mejores fuentes de ingreso, allá trabajó haciendo oficios domésticos en diferentes hogares, regresó a su comunidad cuando tenia 20 años de edad y con su primer hijo, a partir de ahí decidió abrir una pequeña tiendita en su casita y poco a poco el negocio fue creciendo; ahora tiene 15 años de tenerla y todo va por buen camino.

Cecilia, necesita el préstamo para reparar el techo de su casa, pues las vigas que sostienen las tejas ya están viejas y podridas, es por eso que quiere repararlas antes que venga el invierno, también quiere invertir en compra de mercadería para su tiendita y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

El sueño de Cecilia, es ver que sus hijos crezcan y lleguen a ser personas de bien, pues el mayor de ellos está estudiando comunicaciones en la Universidad y ella espera que llegue a ser un profesional ejemplar para su comunidad.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 44 years old and is a fighter. She studied until third grade and is a single mother with two children. She lives alone with her two children.

Since she was very small, Cecilia has learnt to work for a living. When she was 14 years old, she went to live in the capital to look for better sources of income and she worked there doing domestic jobs in various households. She returned to her hometown when she was 20 years old and when she had her first child she decided to open a small store in her house and bit by bit the business grew. She has now had the business for 15 years and it is going well.

Cecilia needs the loan to repair the roof of her house because the supporting beams are old and rotten, so she wants to repair them before winter comes. She also wants to invest in the purchase of merchandise for her small store in order to satisfy client demand. 

Cecilia's dream is to see her children grow up and become good people, her oldest child is studying communications at university and she hopes that this child of hers will become a model professional in the community.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a 29-year-old, married woman with 5 children. 

She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living, and she has 1 year of experience with this business. She needs a loan to buy donuts, loaves of bread, snacks, soft drinks, a boiler, foam cups, coffee, sugar and milk. 

Christina plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy donuts, loaves of bread, snacks, soft drinks, a boiler, foam cups, coffee, sugar and milk

loans.name: Punipuao

texts.en:
Punipuao is a 50-year-old mother with 12 children. 

She runs a small business selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living, and she has been doing this for more than a year. She has requested a loan to buy taro roots and banana tube, plus a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves to help her run her business. 

Punipuao hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy taro roots and banana tube, plus a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy roll materials, needles, a sewing machine and a tape measure

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y dos menores hijos en el distrito de Pimpingos, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Sus pobladores son amables y la vida se desarrolla tranquilamente, ellos se dedican al cultivo de frutales, café, maíz y hortalizas, así como a la ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica al cultivo de café hace 4 años, adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas, patos y cuyes desde hace tres años. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto Catalina espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Catalina, 39, lives with her common-law husband and two minor children in the district of Pimpingos.  It is located in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountain range of Peru.  The local people are kind and life evolves calmly.  They work in agriculture growing fruit, coffee, corn and vegetables, as well as in livestock farming and commerce.

Catalina has been growing coffee for four years.  She also raises and sells small animals such as hens, ducks and guinea pigs, which she has been doing for three years.  She has experience in the business and steady customers who provide good personal and work references for her.  The loan will be used to buy manure and fertilizers for coffee crop maintenance.  Catalina hopes to improve the quality of her coffee for her customers, which will generate more income and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizer for coffee crop maintenance.

loans.name: Lotofoa

texts.en:
Lotofoa is 45 years old and married with 13 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Lotofoa needs a loan to buy a new fridge, and more stock such as stationery, shoes and frozen goods. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new fridge, and more stock such as stationery, shoes and frozen goods

loans.name: Ilo

texts.en:
Ilo is a 24-year-old unmarried woman with three children. She makes and sells meat pies in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Ilo needs a loan to buy pork meat, bags of flour, a stove, a gas bottle, baking trays and olive oil. She plans to use her profits to help expand her business in other nearby villages. 

Ilo has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy pork meat, bags of flour, a stove, a gas bottle, baking trays and olive oil.

loans.name: Juina 1 Group

texts.fr: Amandine membre représentatif est une femme battante tout comme les autres membres du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés.Cette brave dame fait le commerce des céréales depuis 12 ans. Ses céréales se composent du maïs, du mil, du haricot, etc.  Amandine a besoin du crédit pour acheter plus de céréale pour vendre. A l'aide de son commerce, elle arrive a prendre soin de ses enfants. Après les ventes, Amandine pourrait avoir un bénéfice qui lui permettra de continuer son activité et de faire face au petites dépenses de ses enfants.
texts.en: Amandine, the group's featured member, has a fighting spirit, just like the other group members. She is married and the mother of 4 children who all attend school. This strong woman has been selling cereals, including maize, millet and beans, for 12 years. Amandine needs this loan in order to buy more cereals for resale. Thanks to her business, she is able to take care of her children. When she has sold the cereals, she should be able to make a profit which will allow her to continue her business and to cover her children's small expenses.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Evelyn Vanessa

texts.es:
