Evelyn, de 25 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, estudió hasta bachillerato, está felizmente acompañada, su pareja trabaja en una industria de azucar, como motorista de los camiones que transportan la caña, tiene dos niños pequeños, de los cuales solo uno está yendo a la escuela.

Evelyn, desde muy pequeña acompañaba a su abuela al mercado, al puesto que tenía de venta de  especias y fue asi como descubrio que le gustaba el negocio; cuando tenía catorce años de edad, emigró a los Estados Unidos buscando superación y fue ahí donde obtuvo el bachillerato.

Evelyn, regresó a su país cuando tenía 19 años de edad, aquí estudió cosmetología, posteriormente cuando nació su primer hijp, dedicidió abrir su negocio propio de venta de especias, cosméticos y medicinas naturales, en el mismo puesto que tenía su abuela, ahora su abuela esta muy anciana para mantener el puesto.- Es por eso que tiene que viajar varios kilometros en bus, para ir al mercado a vender su mercadería.

El préstamo solicitado es para ampliar su negocio, comprar materia prima para la elaboración de especias y para comprar cosméticos y medicina natural para su negocio, de esta manera logrará satisfacer la demanda de su clientela.

Evelyn, sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, para obtener mayores ingresos que le den una mejor calidad de vida a ella y su familia.- También, sueña con ver que sus hijos vayan creciendo sin que les falte lo necesario y educandolos bajo buenos principios, para que lleguen a ser personas ejemplares.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 25 years old and is a hard-working woman. She studied as far as her high school diploma and is in a happy relationship. Her partner works in a sugar plant, driving the lorries transporting the sugar cane. 

They have two small children and only one of them is at school. From a very young age, Evelyn used to accompany her grandmother to the market, to the stall where she sold spices, and that is how she found out she liked the business. When she was 14 years old she went to the United States in order to improve her prospects and that is where she got her high school diploma.

Evelyn returned to her home country when she was 19 years old and studied cosmetology. Later on when her first child was born she decided to open her own business selling spices, cosmetics and natural medicines, on the same stall which her grandmother used to have. Her grandmother is now too old to look after the stall. This is why she has to travel several kilometres by bus to get to the market to sell her merchandise. 

The loan requested is to expand her business, by buying raw materials for making spices and buying cosmetics and natural medicines for the business. This will enable her to meet her customers' needs.

Evelyn dreams of making her business grow so she can have more income which will give her and her family a better quality of life. She also hopes to make sure her children have everything they need while they are growing up and hopes to teach them sound principles so that they become model citizens.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying raw materials for making spices and to buy cosmetics and natural medicines for her business.

loans.name: Adzovi

texts.fr: Agée de 47 ans, Adzovi est une femme mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle vit à Apédokoè dans un quartier de Lomé avec sa famille mais dans des conditions qu’elle travaille vigoureusement pour améliorer. Pour arriver à ses fins, Adzovi vend des paniers et des vanneries pour gagner assez de bénéfices et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché de Tsévié. Adzovi désire ce microcrédit pour financer l’achat de ses paniers et vanneries afin d’aider ses enfants à avoir une bonne éducation scolaire.
texts.en: 47-year-old Adzovi is a married woman and the mother of 4 children. She lives in Apédokoè, a district of Lomé, with her family, but in conditions that she is working hard to improve. In order to achieve her goals, Adzovi sells baskets and wickerwork so that she can make enough profits. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market in Tsévié. Adzovi would like this microloan in order to buy baskets and wickerwork for resale, so that she can help her children get a good education.

loans.use: to buy 75 baskets and 85 items made from wicker.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.fr: Eunice est une femme mariée dynamique qui vit à Apédokoè avec son mari et ses deux enfants. Elle est âgée de 29 ans et laboure activement pour une meilleure situation financière de son foyer. Eunice est une vendeuse des charbons de bois qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois à Tovégan. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Eunice nécessite ce prêt pour disposer d’une plus grande quantité de charbons afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière considérable
texts.en: Eunice is a dynamic woman who is married and lives in Apédokoè with her husband and her two children. She is 29 years old and is working hard towards improving her household's financial situation. Eunice sells charcoal which she gets three times a month in Tovégan. Eunice needs this loan in order to meet her goals and buy a larger amount of charcoal so that she can meet her customers' demands and achieve substantial financial autonomy.

loans.use: to buy 6 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Jose Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamín, de 23 años de edad, es un joven emprendedor, estudió hasta bachillerato, está felizmente acompañado, su pareja se dedica a ayudarle en una panadería que poseen entre los dos, viven juntos en una casita que están alquilando en su comunidad.

Benjamin, desde los doce años de edad aprendió el oficio de la panadería, inició trabajando para algunas panaderías de su comunidad, embolsando pan y realizando algunas otras actividades del oficio, pero fue hasta el 2014, cuando Benjamín decidió independizarse y abrir su propia panadería; al principio horneaba en horno de barro, posteriormente ahorró y se compró un horno industrial y poco a poco junto con su pareja, han ido prosperando con el negocio.

Benjamín, necesita el dinero para comprar moldes, bandejas y una batidora para la panadería, pues los que tiene actualmente se los presto su jefe anterior, quien fue la persona que lo motivó a que abriera su propio negocio. 

Benjamín, sueña con que su negocio siga prosperando, de tal manera que pueda tener empleados y vender más producto.- También, sueña con tener su propia casita en donde puedan vivir junto con su compañera de vida y sus futuros hijos.
texts.en:
Benjamín, who is 23 years old, is a young entrepreneur. He studied as far as his high school diploma and is in a happy relationship. His partner works with him, helping in a bakery which they both own. They live together in a small house in their community which they are renting. 

From the age of twelve Benjamín learnt the bakery trade. He started working for various bakeries in his community, wrapping bread and carrying out other duties but it wasn't until 2014 that Benjamín decided to become independent and open his own bakery. At first he used a clay oven for baking but then he saved up and bought himself an industrial oven. Gradually he and his partner have been making a success of the business. 

Benjamín needs the money to buy tins, trays and a mixer for the bakery, because the ones he has currently were lent to him by his old boss, who was the one who encouraged him to set up his own business.

Benjamín's dream is for his business to continue being successful so that he can employ people and sell more produce. He also hopes to have his own little house where he can live with his life partner and the children they will have.

loans.use: to buy tins, trays and a mixer for the bakery.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 44 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en casa propia en el distrito de Zaña que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, cuenta con más de 20 años de experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos. Con esto Rosario espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ventas y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosario is 44 years old. She lives with her spouse and their two children in her own house in the the district of Zaña. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of  Peru. Life is peaceful in this district. The residents work in agriculture, livestock raising, and trade.  

She works raising and selling animals such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, and more. She has more than 20 years' experience in the business and has good personal and work references in her district. She is asking for this loan to buy a larger quantity of animals as well as balanced feed to fatten them. With this, Rosario hopes to offer a wider variety of animals to her customers, which will have a positive impact on her sales level and will allow her improve and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to ask for a loan to buy a larger quantity of animals as well as balanced feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Colectoras Group

texts.es:
Gabriela es una mujer de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 1, 4 y 6 años, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, generosa, paciente, fuerte, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en el barrio ‘urbanización el recreo’ un sitio caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas que lo realizan descendientes de las etnias ‘Ayoreas’ del lugar y descendiente de mineros relocalizados de occidente, ahora como segunda generación de los originales se dedican al comercio y la manufactura, de clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura aproximada de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Gabriela es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, ojos obscuros, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada al centro, sostiene su bebé). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con sus 3 hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela, los 2 menores aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de sándwiches, tejido de ropa de bebe, tienda de barrio, venta de materiales de construcción, venta de jugo de quinua, venta de ropa deportiva, y venta de papas fritas,  para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus actividades comerciales. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y ropa de segunda mano, los cosméticos que oferta son de las marcas; esica, ebel, Avon, y la ropa que oferta es de segunda mano y la compra por paquetes por mayor; “la ropa y los cosméticos son actividades que van de la mano, porque sino compras ropa entonces te llevas por lo menos un perfume…” comenta. Su sueño es tener su propia tienda de ropa y cosméticos para dejar de ambular, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de ropa de segunda mano y cosméticos por mayor para aumentar sus ventas y satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Gabriela solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano  y cosméticos por mayor para aumentar sus ventas y satisfacer las necesidades de sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a 24 year old woman. She lives with her spouse and has 3 children, aged 1, 4 and 6. Her business is selling cosmetics and second hand clothing. 
 
She is a good mother who is generous, patient, strong, responsible and hardworking. She carries out her business as a street vendor in the ‘Urbanización el Recreo’ neighborhood, a place characterized by commerce of all types by the descendants of the ‘Ayoreas’  ethnicity from the area, as well as the descendants of miners who relocated from the west. Now the second generation of the original people work in commerce and in manufacturing. It has a warm, tropical and humid climate with a temperature of approximately 30 degrees centigrade during the whole year.
 
Gabriela has dark skin and long black hair that she wears in a pony tail. She is of short stature and a thin frame. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks at home, and she speaks Spanish in the general culture and for business (she is sitting in the middle, holding her baby). She shares her life with her spouse, who works in construction, and with their 3 children. The oldest is in school and the two youngest are not school aged yet. They live in a rented brick house with a corrugated roof.  It has potable water, electricity and plumbing. Her wish to get ahead led to her heading a bank of people with businesses such as selling sandwiches, knitting children's clothes, a neighborhood store, selling construction materials, selling quinoa juice, selling sports clothing, and selling french fries, so that they could ask for a loan and expand their commercial activities. Her business is selling cosmetics and second hand clothing and she buys them by wholesale packages. “The clothes and the cosmetics are activities that go hand in hand, because if you don't buy clothes, then at least you take a perfume…” she says. Her dream is to have her own store for clothes and cosmetics so she can stop being a street vendor. She wants to invest in her business by buying second hand clothing and cosmetics wholesale to increase her sales and meet her children's needs. This is her first loan cycle with the institution during the 3 years that she has been doing this activity.  

These are the reasons that Gabriela is asking for a loan to buy second hand clothing and cosmetics wholesale to increase her sales and meet her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing and cosmetics wholesale to increase sales and meet the needs of her children.

loans.name: Chinata Alta Group

texts.es:
Jhony es un hombre de 25 años, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 10 años, y su negocio es el autotransporte como taxi.
El es emprendedor, buen padre, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ un área rural que se mantiene como granero de la ciudad, por la producción de cereales, verduras y frutas, maíz, trigo, cebada, hortalizas, frutilla, plátanos, papayas, naranjas, manzanas, duraznos y hasta plantas de tumbo. Las construcciones del lugar son mayormente antiguas y no cuentan con servicios básicos.
Jhony es de te morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general (sentado al centro, usa camisa celeste). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la cocina, y su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad. La necesidad de superación lo llevó a conformar una banca de personas con negocios como; comercio de cosméticos, venta de ropa de temporada, servicio técnico de equipos, venta de muebles, tejido a máquina, venta de edredones, venta de empanadas, para solicitar un préstamo y cumplir sus objetivos. Su negocio es el transporte publico como taxi. Cada mañana con los primeros rayos del sol él ya se encuentra recorriendo las calles transportando a comerciantes a sus mercados, personas a la terminal de buses para que viajen, y gente que realiza todo tipo de actividad. “he conocido a todo tipo de personas, transporto pasajeros, comerciantes, estudiantes, llevo un mundo en el asiento de atrás…” comenta. Su sueño es tener su negocio familiar, él desea refaccionar su vehículo porque este se encuentra averiado y es la herramienta que alimenta a la familia. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Jhony solicita un préstamo para la refacción de su vehículo para poder trabajar y pagar los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Jhony is a 25 year old man who lives with his wife and their 10-year-old son. His business is auto-transport; he has a taxi.

He is enterprising, a good father, independent, constant, responsible, and hard-working. His business takes place in the locality of Sacaba, a rural area that supports itself as the city's granary, producing cereals, vegetables, fruit, corn, wheat, onions, garden crops, strawberries, plantains, papayas, oranges, apples, plumbs, and other plants.

Jhony is of Indian complexion and short, with short black hair. His mother tongue is Quechua which he speaks at home; he speaks Spanish in the culture in general. He seated in the middle in a blue shirt. His life is shared with his wife who is dedicated to the kitchen, while his son studies in school. They live in a house constructed of adobe with a laminated roof, and have a water well and electricity. The need to get ahead motivated him to join this group of persons with businesses such as: selling cosmetics and seasonal clothing, servicing technical equipment, selling furniture, sewing with a machine, and selling eiderdowns, in requesting a loan and achieving his objectives.


Jhony's business is transporting the public in his taxi. Each morning with the first rays of the sun, he is already driving the streets, transporting merchants to their markets, others to bus terminals to travel, and people involved in all types of activities. “I've known all types of people, transporting passengers, merchants, students; I carry the world in the back seat,” he comments. 

Jhony's dream is to have his own family business. He wants to repair his vehicle because it's worn out and it's the tool that feeds his family. This is his second sequence of loans with this institution in the ten years he has been involved in this activity.

This is why Jhony is requesting a loan – to repair his vehicle to be able to work and cover his family's expenses.

loans.use: repair his vehicle so that he can work and cover his family's expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread and other hat-making materials to make them in bulk and pay his child's school expenses.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria es una joven mujer de 19 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo varón de 1 año, y su negocio es la confección de mantas tejidas a mano.
Ella es Buena madre, alegre, optimista, feliz, emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Pampachililaya’ situado a orillas del lago sagrado Titicaca; lugar donde se encuentra el albergue comunitario; sitio donde se puede descansar para después abordar los botes a motor rumbo a la Isla, el trayecto a la isla se realiza a través de laberintos de Totora (planta acuática típica del lago), de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-12 grados centígrados y a una altura de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar. 
Maria es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), y su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar, para el comercio también habla español. Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica a la agricultura y con su pequeño bebe, viven en una casa propia de herencia familiar construida de adobe con techo de calamina y que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la confección y trenzado de mantas para cholita elaboradas a mano con crochet; trabajo que realiza desde hace 10 años, ella se encarga del diseño de mantas, mantillas, ponchos y otros; realizando la compra de los materiales como, lana (de oveja, de alpaca, vicuña), hilo, etc., para luego encargarse de la venta en su puesto de venta fijo en inmediaciones de la misma zona. Su sueño es tener un taller de confección, ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina de coser recta para ampliar su negocio y ofertar mayor variedad de prendas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
 Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra lana de oveja, vicuña y alpaca; para ampliar su oferta y cubrir los gastos de su bebé.
texts.en:
Maria is a young woman, 19 years old, who lives with her partner, has a 1-year-old son, and her business is making woven blankets by hand.

She is a good mother, happy, optimistic, cheerful, enterprising, responsible, and hard-working. Her business is located in the "Pampachililaya" community, located on the banks of the sacred lake Titicaca, a place where the community guest house is located. This is a place where one can rest to later board the motorboats going to the island, the route to the island is through the mazes of totora (typical aquatic plant in the lake), it has a cold and dry climate and a temperature that varies during the day between 2-12 degrees centigrade and an altitude of 3800 meters above sea level. 

Maria has dark skin, long black hair she wears braided, is short, she dresses traditionally (hat, blanket and pollera [traditional Andean skirt]) and her native language is Aymará, which she speaks in that area, and for business she also speaks Spanish. She makes her life alongside her partner who works in agriculture and her small baby. They live in their own house, inherited from family, made of adobe with a roof of metal sheeting, and which has electricity and well water. Her business is making and plaiting blankets for cholitas [urban indigenous women] made by hand with crochet. She has done this work for 10 years, she is responsible for the design of blankets, shawls, ponchos, and more. She purchases the materials such as wool (sheep, alpaca, vicuña), thread, etc. to later take charge of selling them in her permanent sales stall in the vicinity of the same zone. Her dream is to have a production workshop. She wants to purchase a sewing machine to expand her business and offer a greater variety of articles. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 10 years she has been doing this work. 

For these reasons, Maria is asking for a loan to purchase sheep, vicuña and alpaca wool, to expand her offerings and cover her baby's expenses

loans.use: to purchase sheep, vicuña and alpaca wool, to expand her offering and pay for her baby's expenses.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children and three of them go to school. She has additional family members as well. She has her own house and the family have access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees. 

Hajara sells green bananas and has been in this business for eight years. She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. She earns additional income from working in rental houses. Hajara's major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cattle to take advantage of the rainy season, fatten them and sell them.

loans.name: Pacha Yllari De Huandar Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PACHA YLLARI DE HUANDAR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huandar, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Roxana, la socia continua con su  negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua criando a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y alimentos.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.
texts.en:
The members of this group belong to the communal bank Pacha Yllari De Huandar. This bank is located in the district of Huandar, in the province of Calca and department of Cusco.

This member is Roxana. She continues with her business of raising and selling animals. She is pleased with the loan that has been issued and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms. She continues raising small animals to then sell them to her customers that request them. She wants to be able to keep working so that she can keep supporting her family.

Roxana is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs and their food. The other members earn a living with businesses selling fruit, selling animals, a grocery store and a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and their food.

loans.name: El Progreso De Capilla Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL PROGRESO DE CAPILLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Rosario, la socia tiene 32 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de cultivo de frutas como naranjas, plátanos entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de venta de animales, agricultura.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “EL PROGRESO DE CAPILLA”.  This bank is located in the district of Echarate in the province of La Convencion, department of Cusco. 

Member Rosario is 32 years old, married, and has two children. In addition to her daily chores she also grows fruit such as oranges, plantains, and others. She is grateful for the loan she has received and promises to make her payments on time. She would like to be able to continue working so she can continue to support her family. She is asking for the loan so she can buy seeds and other items. 

The other members sell fruit, animals, and engage in farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other items.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Maria Elena, continúa  dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de leche, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the San Martin de Zurite communal bank. The bank is located in the Zurite district, which is in the Anta province and the department of Cusco. 

Maria Elena is continuing her business of purchasing and selling milk. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time. She has been working at her business for a while and it is going well, thanks to the effort that she puts forth every day in her business.

She sells merchandise to her customers, who are friends, family members, and other people. This way, she has been moving her family forward.

She requests a loan to purchase a cow.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a male married with five children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a shop of general merchandise alongside farming growing crops such as onions, maize, rice and others. Robert has a dream of expanding his business as a commercial farmer. However, his problems are pests and diseases plus poor climatic changes. Robert has asked for a loan to buy sugar, salt, rice, cassava and other merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, rice, cassava and other merchandise for selling

loans.name: Claudia Lisseth

texts.es:
Claudia, de 27 años de edad, es una mujer visionaria, estudió hasta bachillerato, está separada de su esposo, el cual es empleado de un banco, tiene un niño de 5 meses de nacido. Actualmente, vive con su madre y un hermano.

Claudia, cuando salió del bachillerato consiguió trabajo en una institución financiera como secretaria, posteriormente trabajó para una foto-estudio en donde estuvo por 4 años, hasta que la empresa cerró.- A los 24 años se casó y decidió abrir una venta de pupusas en el patio de la casa, donde vivía junto a su esposo y fue por circunstancias de la vida que el año pasado se separó de él y fue a vivir junto con su madre.

Claudia, necesita el dinero para iniciar con el negocio de venta de ropa, pues necesita generar ingresos para mantener a su bebe y darle una mejor calidad de vida. 

Claudia, sueña con adquirir un empleo que le genere estabilidad económica para ella y su hijo.- También, sueña con llegar a tener su casa propia, en donde pueda ver crecer a su hijo y que llegue a ser un hombre de bien y sea ejemplo en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Claudia,is 27 years old and is a visionary woman. She completed High school. She is separated from her husband who works as a bank employee. She has a 5 month old baby and lives with her mother and a brother.

Claudia on finishing High school got work in a financial institution as a secretary. Before that she worked in a photo studio where she worked for 4 years until the business closed. She got married at 24 years old and decided to open a pupusa stand in the patio of her house where she lived with her husband.

But due to the circumstances of life she separated from her husband last year and went to live with her mother. Claudia needs the money to start in the business of selling clothing as she needs to generate income to support her baby and give it a better quality of living. Claudia dreams of obtaining employment that gives her and her child economic stability. She also dreams of having her own house where she can watch her son grow and that he grows up to be a good person and an example for his community.

loans.use: to start a business selling clothing.

loans.name: Siona

texts.en:
Siona is 28 years old and married with 3 children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Siona has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, paint, brushes, a cutter, stencils, gloves, and a pair of scissors. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy painting supplies.

loans.name: Faiupu

texts.en:
Faiupu is 47 years old, married, and has six children. 

She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Faiupu needs a loan to buy chemicals, gloves, a tiller, a pitch fork, a crowbar, seeds and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2015. Faiupu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, gloves, a tiller, a pitch fork, a crowbar, seeds and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a 45-year-old mother with eight children. 

She runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years. 

Christina has requested a loan to buy taro roots, banana tube, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. Christina became a member of SPBD in 2005.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tube, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies to fill a new contract

loans.name: Jay Sawaminarayan Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
Radhaben, featured at center in the picture, is a hardworking micro-entrepreneur from the Dahod district of Gujarat, in western India. She lost her husband a few years ago and supports her family of four by selling artificial jewelry and accessories like bangles, elastic bands, necklaces, and earrings to local women. Her monthly income of INR 6,000 contributes over 60% of her family’s income. The remaining amount is earned by her older children, and Radhaben saves most of it, setting aside INR 4,000 each month.

She has a young pre-school aged child, and she wants to ensure a complete education for the young one. Radhaben realizes she must earn and save more for this. So every step she has taken so far is to ensure the financial stability of her family. 

She plans to grow her business and needs to buy more inventory so she can sell a better variety of products and serve more customers. The capital she needs to invest in this growth, however, is too small an amount for local banks to finance. She does not want to raise this microfinance from local private lenders, as their steep interest rates could push her into deep debt. 

So Radhaben has rallied four more women entrepreneurs, who also seek economic stability for their families. Sumitraben sells fruits, Naynaben runs a scrap business, Tejalben runs a small petty shop, and Shardaben, like Radhaben, sells accessories. Together, they seek a loan of INR 58,000, which they will invest in buying more inventory for the growth of their small businesses. Your loan will provide these five mothers a much needed timely boost for their microenterprises. With this investment, Radhaben, for instance, will be able to net an extra INR 7,000 each month. She plans on re-investing most of this into her business and towards repaying this loan. The remaining INR 1,000, she will add to her monthly savings.

Radhaben and her group are grateful for this opportunity and your support in building a better future for their families.

loans.use: To buy bangles, elastic bands, necklaces, and earrings to grow her artificial jewelry and accessories microenterprise.

loans.name: Haneya

texts.en:
Haneya is a 39-year-old single lady who lives in southern Ghour with her family.

She is working hard to help her family and her brothers with their education expenses. She wanted to start looking for a job but not having specific qualifications prevented her from finding employment; therefore, she thought to open a small store to increase her income. 

She opened a household items shop two years ago, which has helped her to improve their standard of living.
 
Haneya wanted to expand her work so she applied for a loan to buy new items to sell, such as accessories, cosmetics and baby dolls. Now she will get more income so she can help her family more.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell, such as accessories, cosmetics and baby dolls.

loans.name: Pisila

texts.en:
Pisila is a 39-year-old mother with four children. 

She had a small business of sewing clothes and selling them in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years.

Pisila has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine, and a tape measure to help her with the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. Pisila became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine, and a tape measure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank and a toilet

loans.name: Faiilefa

texts.en:
Faiilefa is a 40-year-old married woman with four children. 

She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has seven years of experience with this business. 

Faiilefa needs a loan to buy a large boiler, boxes of noodles, a kettle, loaves of bread, a stove, bags of flour and paper plates. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education and also help with her family's weekly expenses. Faiilefa has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy a large boiler, boxes of noodles, a kettle, loaves of bread, a stove, bags of flour and paper plates.

loans.name: Kwin Village Group 1

texts.en:
This community is located in Kwin Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, five CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 30 village customers. This loan will help some group members purchase ducks or ducklings that will increase their income. The other group members will use the funds to purchase high-quality feed. 
 
Most of the villagers are farmers who also plant seasonal food such as coconuts and bananas. For additional income, 196 Kwin villagers also raise pigs and chickens as livestock.

The picture above are the CBO members of Kwin Group 1, named U Ye, U Zin, U Kyaw, U Hte and U Myint. U Ye ( farthest right in photo) is 41 years old and married with four children. U Ye farms the family crop farm while his wife looks after their ducks. U Ye will use the Proximity's loans to purchase more ducks, increasing duck egg production and ultimately boosting his family's income.

loans.use: To purchase ducks and high-quality feed.

loans.name: Boe Toke Village Group

texts.en:
Located in Boe Toke Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region, this community consists of five CBO members overseeing a group of 16 village customers. Proximity's loan will help group members to purchase the duck feed as well as repair duck farms. After the rainy season the duck farms' roofs are destroyed and the villagers need to renovate them once a year.  This costs nearly $100 per roof.  

In addition to ducks, residents of Boe Toke Village also raise pigs and chickens. Aside from livestock, villagers farm rice paddies. Some also plant vegetables and flowers, which they sell in the town market at harvest.
 
The picture above shows four CBO members, named U Zaw, U Kyaw, U Sein and Daw Pyone. U Zaw (top right of photo) is 38 years old and married with two children. In addition to raising 120 ducks, U Zaw and his family farm seasonal crops, and U Zaw offers barber services to fellow villagers. 

The price of feed is lower than average right now, so using Proximity's loan to purchase feed will enable him to buy higher-quality feed, boosting income from more egg production and better nourished ducks. Well-nourished ducks means less disease and a higher price when they are sold.

loans.use: To purchase high quality feeds as well as to repair duck farms.

loans.name: Dina Yanin

texts.es: Ayudar a los demás es una actitud que se debe admirar. Dina es una joven de 22 años, quien cursa el último año la carrera de Tecnología Médica. Ella estudia esta profesión debido a que desea apoyar científica y tecnológicamente al diagnóstico y tratamiento médico de las afectaciones que padecen las personas. Dina solicita el crédito debido  a que lo desea para pagar su título universitario y así poder encontrar oportunidades laborales. Sus metas y planes futuros son trabajar en un hospital de su comunidad para mejorar su calidad de vida y estudiar una maestría para seguir profesionalizándose.
texts.en:
Helping others is an activity to admire.  Dina, age 22, is in her last year of her studies for her medical technology degree.  She is studying for this profession because she wishes to support scientific and technological diagnosis and medical treatment of the ills that people suffer from.

Dina is requesting a loan because she wishes to pay for her university degree.  This way she will be able to find work opportunities.  Her goals and future plans are to work in her community hospital in order to improve her quality of life and to study for a masters in order to continue  growing as a professional.

loans.use: to pay for her university degree.

loans.name: Yae Kyaw (Boe) Village Group

texts.en:
In this community, located in Yae Kyaw Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region, 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 18 village customers. This loan will help some group members to purchase both ducks and ducklings. The remaining group members will use the funds to purchase high quality feed, costing $20 to feed 100 ducks for 5 days.  Each of these uses will boost villager income through more duck eggs and more revenue from duck sales.

In addition to ducks, many Yae Kyaw villagers raise pigs, chickens, and water buffalo.  Pigs are mainly a source of savings, water buffalo are used to cultivate the land, while chickens are used in a similar way to ducks. Those with arable land cultivate rice paddies and plant seasonal vegetables and fruits such as bananas and coconuts. 

Pictured above are CBO members from the Yae Kyaw Village Group, named U Shwe, U Kyaw, U Pu and Daw Sein. U Shwe (second from left in the photo) is 61 years old and living with his sons and grandson. While his sons farm their land, U Shwe looks after their ducks. Like other group members, U Shwe will use the Proximity's loan to purchase more ducklings. More duck eggs will boost his income and a larger payoff will be generated when the ducks are fully grown and sold.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high quality feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a biogas system to have clean cooking fuel for his family

loans.name: Kwin Village Group 2

texts.en:
This community is located in Kwin Village 2, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, five CBO (community based organization) members oversee a group of 24 village customers. This loan will help some group members buy ducks or ducklings that will increase their income. The other group members will use the funds to purchase high-quality feeds.  

Most of the villagers are farmers who plant seasonal food such as coconuts and bananas. For additional income, Kwin villagers raise pigs and chickens as livestock.

The picture above shows the CBO members of Kwin Village Group 2, named U Khine, U Tun, U Myint, Daw So and U Nyunt. U Khine (first person standing from right) is 32 years old and married with two children. U Khine and his wife look after 120 ducks, and for additional income plant seasonal fruits such as betels and bananas. 

As the price of the duck feed rises in the later part of the season, Proximity's loan will allow U Khine to purchase a larger amount of feed initially and store some for later use. Otherwise, U Khine would have to purchase lower-quality feed later in the season. As a result of this advantage, U Khine will raise better nourished ducks with greater egg production, boosting his family's income.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high-quality feed.

loans.name: Ana Ride

texts.es:
Ana, de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado de educación básica, está felizmente acompañada, su pareja trabaja en una hacienda ganadera como corralero, actualmente viven en una casa de lámina en un terreno que el gobierno les dio a orillas de la linea férrea, tiene dos niños pequeños que están estudiando.

Actualmente Ana, se dedica a vender tamales, empanadas, yucas fritas y otros productos, que ella elabora en su casa, para luego salir a venderlos en los alrededores de su comunidad.

Ana, proviene de una familia que se dedicaba al destace de animales, principalmente cerdos, es por eso que el préstamo solicitado es para comprar cerdos, para destazarlos y venderlos, ya que tiene mucha experiencia en ello.

El sueño que Ana, es poder reparar su casita, para quitar la lámina y hacer las paredes de ladrillo o cemento.- Además, le gustaría prosperar en el negocio del destace, para que en un futuro pueda destazar animales más grandes como la res.
texts.en:
Ana is 27 years old and studied up to Grade 5 of basic education. She is happily in a relationship her partner works on a cattle ranch as a cowhand. They live in a house made of metal sheeting on a piece of land the government gave them beside a railroad line. They have 2 small children who study.

Ana currently works selling tamales, empanadas, fried yucca and other products that she makes in her house and then goes out to sell them around her community. Ana comes from a family that works butchering animals, mainly pigs. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy pigs to butcher them and sell them as she has a lot of experience doing this.

Ana's dream is to be able to repair her little house, to remove the metal sheeting and build brick or cement walls. She would also like her butchering business to grow so that in the future she can butcher larger animals like cattle.

loans.use: to buy pigs to butcher and sell.

loans.name: Thae Kone Gyi Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located Thae Kone Gyi Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, six CBO (community based organization)
members oversee a group of 33 (25 men, eight women) village customers. This loan will help some group members purchase both ducks and ducklings that will increase their income from duck eggs. The remaining group members will use the funds to purchase high-quality feed (costing $20 for five days' feed for 100 ducks).

In Thae Kone Gyi village, most households farm either owned or rented land. The populations in the rural areas have begun to decrease due to urban or international migration, raising labor costs. For this reason, livestock such as ducks have become critically important to increase income to offset these costs.  

The picture above shows six CBO members from Thae Kone Gyi Village, known as U Aye, U Thet, U Thaung, U Tin, U Myo and U Aung. U Aye (middle of the photo) is 56 years old and married with three children, all in secondary school. In addition to raising his ducks, U Aye plans weddings for the nearby villages. He and his wife look after 110 ducks and chickens. Proximity's loan will enable U Aye's family to purchase high quality feed that will increase his income from more duck egg production and larger, better nourished ducks.

loans.use: To purchase ducks as well as high-quality feed.

loans.name: Hpa Yar Chaung Village Group

texts.en:
In this community, located in Hpa Yar Chaung Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region, five CBO (community based organization) members oversee a group of 21 village customers. This loan will help some group members purchase more ducks. Other group members will use the funds to purchase high-quality feeds. Both uses will increase villagers' incomes from more duck eggs and sale of full-grown ducks.

Most of the villagers are farmers who plant rice paddies and seasonal food such as coconuts and bananas. Those without arable land raise livestock such as ducks, pigs and chickens, for additional income. Some farmers also raise livestock for savings or additional income.

Pictured above are CBO members from the Hpa Yar Chaung Village Group, named Daw San, Daw Aye, Daw Hnin and Daw Myo. Daw San (seated far left in the photo) is 40 years old, married, and has two children. Both children are students in secondary school. Daw San's husband offers daily labor to farmers in the village, while Daw San is responsible for taking care of their 120 ducks. Daw San also sells traditional sweets around the village in the afternoon. 

Proximity's loan is crucial to Daw and her family, as they will use the loan to purchase ducks, boosting income through more egg production. This additional income will be used to pay for their children's education, as higher level education is more costly.

loans.use: To help Hpa Yar Chaung Village Group, purchase ducks and high-quality feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a biogas system for his mother and wife to cook over clean fuel

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn Trung Sơn Xã Công Liêm Group

texts.en:
Mrs Minh, 33 years old, is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 thôn Trung sơn xã Công liêm solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. She is married and has 2 children. Minh has provided tailoring services for the past 4 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to do tailoring and clothing repair services. 

Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2013 to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital. With her business profit, Minh hopes for her business to do well, to buy a motorbike, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase machines to do tailoring and clothing repair services

loans.name: Nhóm 05 Thôn Tân Kỳ  Xã Công Liêm Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hoa, 22 years old, is the group leader of the Nhóm 05 thôn Tân Kỳ  xã Công liêm solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She is married and has one child. Hoa has worked in agriculture for the past 5 years, raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2013, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital. With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: Fidel de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija quien trabaja y le ayuda económicamente,  el posee un taller de carpintería en el cual fabrica y vende variedad de hermosos y finos muebles. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse al negocio y muchas personas lo prefieren ya que él ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus muebles, Fidel esta solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Fidel, 47, lives in his own house with his daughter, who works and helps him financially.

He has a carpentry shop where he makes and sells a variety of beautiful fine furniture.  He has earned a living in this business for many years, and a lot of people choose him because he offers quality furniture at good prices.

Fidel's asking Integral for a loan to invest in his business with a purchase of wood, nails, glue, varnish, reeds, and other materials to attract more customers.  That way he'll be able to achieve his goal of improving his quality of life and his family's.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, reeds, and other supplies

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson tiene 29 años de edad, vive en casa familiar de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, contando con servicios de agua y luz, y esta ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

La actividad que realiza Wilson es la brindar servicios como maestro de obra en construccion civil, realiza trabajos de tarrajeo, acentado de ladrillos, cerámica, entre otros, él cuenta con 13 años de experiencia en el rubro. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de herramientas para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, con ello podrá captar un número mayor de clientes, generándole mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilson is 29 years old. He lives with his wife and their two minor children, ages 7 and 4, in the family home, which is made of rustic materials.  Wilson lives in the rural part of the Pucará district and has water and electrical service. This district is located in the province of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region of the northern mountains of Peru.  The inhabitants of this district work in agriculture and raising animals.

Wilson's business is offering services as a master builder in civil construction. He does plastering and brick and ceramic work, among other tasks. He has 13 years of experience in this area. 

The purpose of the loan will be to invest in the purchase of tools in order to be able to offer a better service to his customers. With this, he will be able to capture a greater number of customers, generating better income and greater earnings, and thus being able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy tools in order to be able to offer a better service to his customers.

loans.name: 03.04.08 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs Dung, 38 years old, is the group leader of the 03.04.08 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She is married and has 3 children. Dung has worked in agriculture for more than 10 years, farming rice. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa, a city in Thanh Hoa province. Dung is requesting a loan to purchase seeds to grow to sell in the future.

In 2006, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 6 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dung's main business hardship is lack of capital. With her business profit, Dung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to grow to sell in the future

loans.name: 03.07.05 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hồng, 33 years old, is the group leader of the 03.07.05 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She is married and has 3 children. Hồng has worked in agriculture for 6 years, raising poultry. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Hồng is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2013, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hồng's main business hardship is lack of capital. With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Concepcion Elizabeth

texts.es:
Concepción, de 46 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos, ambos están estudiando, con ella vive su hermana.

Concepción, es costurera, tiene 20 años de dedicarse a este oficio; lo aprendió gracias a una de sus tías.- El taller lo tiene en su casa y trabaja de 8:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m.

El crédito lo utilizará para comprar una máquina de coser. 

Sus sueños son, que su pequeño taller crezca y que pueda tener gente trabajando para ella.
texts.en: Concepción is 46 years old and is the single mother of 2 children both of whom study. One of her sisters lives with them. Concepción is a dressmaker. She has been practicing this trade for 20 years. She learned it from one of her aunts. She has her workshop in her house and she works from 8 am until 2 pm. She will use the loan to buy a sewing machine. Her dream is to expand her small workshop and be able to have people work for her.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is a 45-year-old married male. He describes himself to be honest and God fearing. He operates a  retail shop where he sells fish. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy ready market and his primary customers are daily customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low working capital. He will use the KES 75,000 loan to purchase more fish for resale. His business goal is to have a large business that realizes lots of profits within 5 years. He hopes in the future to have a stable and healthy family. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Cristina Maricela

texts.es: Cristina es madre soltera, tiene 20 años de edad y su hija 3 meses, Cristina se dedica desde hace 2 años atrás a la crianza de animales menores y comenta que empezó desde que nuestra institución le otorgo el primer crédito, también se dedica al jornal desde hace 5 años atrás, el crédito lo  necesita para comprar chanchos, y de este negocio espera darle un bienestar a su hija ya que el padre de la niña no le apoya en nada.
texts.en:
Cristina is a single mom, 20 years of age with a 3 month old daughter.  Cristina has ben working raising small animals for the last 2 years when  Kiva provided her with the first loan.  She has also been working for hourly wages for the past 5 years.  
She needs the loan to buy pigs.  She hopes to give her daughter a good quality of life thanks to this business since the father doesn't support them with anything.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Twizigire Group

texts.fr:
Appolinaire fait partie du groupe Twizigire  et  habite à Gitega. C’est un veuf de 53 ans et  a 2 enfants  l’un a 7 ans et l’autre 21 ans dont 1 étudie.

Il fait le commerce des habits  depuis 15 ans. 

Il  est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits à  revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Appolinaire is part of the Twizigire  group and lives in Gitega. He is a 53-year-old widower and has two children, one of whom is 7, and the other 21; one of them attends school.

He has been selling clothing for 15 years.

He is on his fifth Turame loan. With the Kiva loan that he gets, he is going to augment his capital and buy a lot of clothes to resell in order to earn more.

loans.use: to augment his capital to buy a lot of clothes to resell to earn more

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo año de bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja vende tamales y atol, tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 están estudiando. 

Julio, se dedica a la albañilería, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a este oficio y lo aprendió por medio de su papá, el lugar en donde trabaja está lejos de su casa y viaja en pick up.

Julio, necesita el crédito para comprar un molino, para colocarlo en su casa y brindar ese servicio, con esto mejorará sus ingresos.

Sus sueños, son comprar un automóvil nuevo y también establecer una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Julio, age 38, went to school through the second year of high school.  He is in a relationship, and his life partner sells tamales and ‘atol’ [corn based drink].  He has three children, and two of them go to school.

Julio works as a bricklayer.  He has ten years of experience in this trade, which he learned from his father.  The place where he works is far from his house, and he gets there in a pick-up.

Julio needs the loan to buy a mill to place at his house in order to provide milling services.  His income will improve with this.

His dreams are to get a new automobile and to also establish a store at his house.

loans.use: to buy a mill to place at his house in order to provide milling services.

loans.name: Agus

texts.en: Hello, lenders! Meet Agus, a Ruma agent who lives in Depok. Depok is a city located at the south of Jakarta. Agus is happily married, and his wife is a full time housewife. Agus and his wife have been blessed with 3 children.  As a main source of income, Agus owns and manages a small stall that sells daily consumer products, snacks and drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and provides utility bill payment services to his community. Agus joined Ruma about 4 months ago because he wanted to improve his business and he felt excited to learn more about mobile technology from Ruma mobile application. As the business runs, Agus is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payment transactions, especially on the weekends. In the near future, Agus also plans to improve his selling with a new product from Ruma, which is an e-commerce for remote communities called 'Mapan'. By serving Mapan to his customers, Agus will be able to receive orders from customers who want to buy products that have been listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Agus will simply send an SMS to an SMS center; the customer will pay him, and a Ruma agent will come to his stall to collect the money. Within 3-5 days, the product will be delivered right to the customer's door. With Mapan, Agus believes that his community will be able to have access to high quality products with better prices and, of course, his stall will improve. In the photo, Agus is sitting in his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in his community

loans.name: Nhóm 05- Thôn 3 - Thọ Vực - Triệu Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Vạn has a stall selling meat. She is applying for a loan to purchase meat to resell.

Vạn is 44 years old, married, and has two children. Vạn is the group leader of the Nhóm 05- Thôn 3 - Thọ Vực - Triệu Sơn solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2015, Vạn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Vạn has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for nine years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Vạn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase meat to resell

loans.name: 03.05.04 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs Minh has a retail business selling ceramic products (bowls, plates, cups, etc.). She is requesting a loan to purchase more ceramic products to resell.

Minh is 41 years old and she is married with three children. She is the group leader of the 03.05.04 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Minh has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Minh has been involved in this business for eight years.

The main hardship that Minh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Minh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more ceramic products to resell

loans.name: 031807040001.yên Thọ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Long works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Long is 64 years old and she is married with one child. She is the leader of a three-member group, the 031807040001.Yên Thọ solidarity group. 
Long lives with no dependents in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Long joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Long has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Long has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Long faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Long hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Nhóm 04-Thôn Trung-Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan has a retail business selling medicine. She is requesting a loan to purchase medicine to resell.

Loan is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm Nhóm 04-Thôn Trung-Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of four members. Loan lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Loan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Loan has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Loan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Loan hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase medicine to resell

loans.name: Chung

texts.en:
Mrs Chung works in agriculture farming food.

Chung is 45 years old and she is married with three children. She lives with three dependents in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Chung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Chung has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Chung faces in her life is not having a biogas system. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a biogas system.

With her business profit, Chung hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a biogas system.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es: Jaqueline tiene 43 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica al cultivo de frutas que crecen en la zona que radica y a la vez a su bodega que implemento en su vivienda. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizante para mejorar la calidad  de su cultivo. Ella cumple la función de tesorera en el grupo “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA”. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Jaqueline es la segunda persona parada del lado derecho viste chompa de color jade.
texts.en: Jaqueline is 43 years and is married with 2 young children. She works cultivating fruits that grow in the nearby area and also works at her bodega that she has in her home. She will invest this loan in the purchase of fertilizer to improve the quality of her crops. Jaqueline serves in the role of treasurer in the "Santa Rosa de Lima" group. The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the credit that they provide. Jaqueline is the second person from the right side visible in a jade colored sweatshirt.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Nhóm 13 Thôn Thạch Bắc Quảng Thạch Group

texts.en:
Tần has a retail business selling fish. Tần has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. 

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is applying for a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Tần is 54 years old and she is married with four children. Tần lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Tần joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tần has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the leader of a six-member group, the Nhóm 13 - Thôn Thạch Bắc - Quảng Thạch solidarity group. 

In the future, Tần hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: 032004030001.yên Phong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. Hiền has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Stefany Mariela

texts.es:
Stefany es una joven mujer de 20 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos de primera necesidad en una tienda de barrio.
Ella inteligente, emprendedora, alegre, independiente, optimista, feliz, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad, una zona caracterizada por el comercio de buen gusto, de clima templado, con una temperatura aproximada de 21 grados centígrados durante el verano.
Stefany es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, ojos obscuros, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que casi no utiliza porque estudia en la universidad y trabaja para ayudarse con sus gastos. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que trabajan, tiene 2 hermanos menores que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Al terminar el colegio su madre le regalo una cierta cantidad de dinero con lo que inicio; Su negocio es la atención de una tienda propia con alimentos de primera necesidad, como; pan, azúcar, refrescos, gas licuado, etc., labor que realiza durante las horas del día, durante la noche asiste a la universidad y estudia la carrera de derecho. Su negocio lo atiende los 7 dias de la semana durante las horas del día, esto le dificulta un poco la asistencia a clases pero a la vez es independiente y paga sus estudios. “mi tienda la administro de día, por las noches estudio la carrera de derecho, este año me toca el 4 año y mi materia favorita es sociología jurídica…” comenta. Su sueño es terminar su carrera profesional para especializarse en derecho civil o penal y contratar un empleado que atienda su negocio. Ella desea realizar la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad para ofertar en su negocio y así pagar sus estudios. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Stefany solicita un préstamo para la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad para ofertar en su tienda y con los beneficios pagar sus gastos universitarios.
texts.en: Stefany a 20 year old young women. She is single and without children. Her business is selling basic foodstuffs at a neighborhood store. Stefany is intelligent, entrepreneurial, happy, independent, optimistic, joyful, responsible and a hard worker. She conducts her business in the south part of the city, an area characterized by tasteful commerce, and a temperate climate with a temperature of approximately 21 degrees C during the summer. Stefany has brown skin, she is short with long black hair that she keeps in a pony tail, she has dark eyes, a skinny physique and her native language is Aymara which she rarely uses because  she studies at the university and works to help herself with her expenses. She lives in the home of her parents who work. She has 2 younger brothers who study at school. They live in their own home constructed of brick which has potable water, electricity and plumbing. Upon completing high school, her mother gave her a certain amount of money which she started out with. Her business is running her own store with basic foodstuffs such as bread, sugar, drinks, natural gas, etc. She works during the daytime and during the evenings she attends the university studying for a law degree. She attends to her business 7 days a week during the daytime and this makes it a bit challenging to attend her classes, but at the same time she is independent and pays for her studies. "I run my store during the day. At night I study for the law degree. This year I am in my 4th year and my favorite topic is judicial sociology" she told us. Her dream is to complete her professional degree so she can specialize in civil or criminal law and hire an employee who will care for her store. She desires to complete the purchase of basic foodstuffs to offer in her business in order to pay for her studies. This is her first loan with the institution after the 4 years she has spent developing this business. It is because of these motivations that Stefany is seeking a loan to purchase basic foodstuffs to offer in her store and to pay for her university fees with the profits.

loans.use: to purchase basic foodstuffs to offer in her store so she can use the profits to pay for her university fees.

loans.name: Kun Pa Laing

texts.en:
This community is located Kun Pa Laing Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, five CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 15 village customers. 

This loan will help some group members purchase ducks and the remaining group members will use the funds to purchase high quality feed, costing $28 for six days feeding 100 ducks. These uses will boost the villagers' income from more duck eggs. 

Kun Pa Laing Village has a population of over 1,200 and many of them are farmers. Those with arable land cultivate rice paddies and plant seasonal vegetables and fruits such as bananas and coconuts. Besides duck raising and farming, the villagers also raise pigs for additional income.

The picture above shows CBO members from Kun Pa Laing Village, named U Min, U Hla and U Min A.  U Min (farthest right in photo) is 37 years old and is married with two children. He farms his crop farm while his wife is responsible for looking after the ducks. Like the other fellow members, U Min will use his loan to purchase ducks. This will boost his income from more duck eggs, and will generate a larger payoff when the ducks are fully grown and sold.  This additional income is critical for U Min's family, as prices for rice were especially low in the past harvest season.

loans.use: Village Group to purchase ducks as well as high quality feed

texts.en:

She will invest the loan in the purchase of more groceries, drinks, candies, eggs. 

The group is thankful to the KIVA investors for the loan provided. Susana is the one found standing in the middle.

loans.name: Malim

texts.ru: Малим 51 год, замужем, дети взрослые и самостоятельные. У Малим - среднее образование. В поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Малим, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы с телятами и 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Малим обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Малим планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Malim is 51 years old and married. Her children are all grown-up and self-sufficient. Malim has a secondary education. In the search for an additional source of income for her family, she has been practicing livestock breeding and crop farming for many years already. Thanks to Malim's hard work, she currently has 2 cows with calves and 15 sheep on her farm. Her average monthly income is 30,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her farm, Malim turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 150,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock to increase the size of her herd. Malim plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Delmy

Delmy, tiene 15 años de dedicarse al negocio de venta de frutas, lo aprendió por medio de su madre. Ella viaja en bus urbano a vender frutas al mercado. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar frutas y verduras para que su negocio crezca y tener más ingresos. 

Ella desea que su hijo estudie y que termine sus estudios profesionales.- Además, sueña con ir a USA.
texts.en:
Delmy, 58 years old, studied until second grade. She is a single mother of 3 children, two of whom are in the USA and the other is in school.

Delmy, has made a living for 15 years in the business of selling fruits, she learned because of her mother. She travels on the city bus to sell fruits at the market.

She needs the loan to purchase fruits and vegetables so that her business can grow and she can have more income. 

She wants her son to study and finish his professional studies. Also, she dreams of going to the USA.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for her business.
