loans.name: Inn Du Village Group 2

texts.en:
Located in Inn Du Village at Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region, this community includes 27 (18 male, 9 female) village customers overseen by five community based organisation (CBO) members. This loan will help some of the group purchase both ducks and ducklings that will boost their income due to having more duck's eggs. The remaining group members will use the funds to buy high-quality feed costing $100 for a month of feed. 

Inn Du Village has over 270 households and a population of 1262; most of the villagers focus on crop farming. They also plant seasonal vegetables and fruits such as coconuts and banana. On the other hand for additional income, the households also raise livestock, pigs and ducks.

In the picture above are the CBO members from Inn Du Village Group 2, named U Than, U Hla, U Naing, U Zaw and Daw Nu. U Than (first from left) is 43 years old and farms his seven-acre crop farm. He is married with four children who are secondary and higher students. His wife is a housewife and is also responsible for looking after the livestock, pigs and ducks. 

With this Proximity loan, he will mostly purchase high quality feeds and also ducks.This will boost U Than's family income as he will be able to sell more duck eggs.

loans.use: To purchase ducks and high quality feeds for both ducks and ducklings.

loans.name: Nyaung Pin Tan Village Group

texts.en:
This community based organisation (CBO) is located in Nyaung Pin Tan Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. It consists of 34 village customers, overseen by 5 CBO members. 

This loan will help some group members to purchase high quality feed (it costs $30 a week to buy feed for 100 ducks) that will help them increase their income due to having more duck's eggs. Other members will use the funds to purchase both ducks and ducklings. 

Most of the men from Nyaung Pin Tan Village are farmers and some households also plant seasonal vegetables and fruits. In addition to ducks, many Nyaung Pin Tan villagers raise pigs, chickens, and water buffalo. Pigs are mainly a source of savings, water buffalo are used to cultivate the land, while chickens are used in a similar way as ducks.

Pictured above are CBO members from Nyaung Pin Tan Village, named U Tin, U Htin and Daw Khin. Included in the picture, (first from left) U Tin is 54 years old and married. He farms on his two-acres-crop farm and also looks after the livestock and ducks. He has a son who is a secondary student. 

Proximity's loan will help him to purchase high quality feeds that will make the ducks lay well-nourished eggs. The eggs will boost U Tin’s family's income.

loans.use: to purchase ducks as well as high quality feed.

loans.name: Side Nooma Group

texts.fr: Fanta est la présidente de ce groupe de 7 femmes battantes qui font toutes le commerce. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 3 sont scolarisés. Elle vend des pagnes de diverses qualité et elle besoin de ce crédit pour renforcer son commerce. Au Burkina Faso, les femmes aiment bien les pagnes dont le commerce de Fanta est rentable. Le groupe Side Nooma est toujours à jours de leurs remboursement. Après les ventes, le bénéfice de Fanta lui permettra de s'occuper de ses enfants et de continuer son commerce.
texts.en:
Fanta is the president of Side Nooma, a group of seven strong women who all practice commercial activities. She is married with four children; three of them attend school. 

Fanta sells various grades of pagnes, and she needs a loan to bolster her activity. Because the women of Burkina Faso like pagnes, Fanta’s business is profitable. 

The profits earned through her sales will allow Fanta to provide for her children and to keep her activity going.

The Side Nooma group is always on time with repayments.

loans.use: to buy pagnes to sell.

loans.name: 03 Thôn Bùi Tiến Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hợp has a manufacturing business, making iron furniture. She is requesting a loan to purchase more metal, to make metal funiture to sell.

Hợp is 44 years old and she is married, with one child. She is the group leader of the 03 Thôn Bùi Tiến Lộc solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

This is Hợp's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Hợp faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hợp hopes to make enough money to provide for her child, for her child to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more metal, to make metal funiture to sell.

loans.name: Jordy Marlon

texts.es: Jordy es un joven de 21 años de edad es soltero. El se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo de la carrera de administración de empresas y a la vez trabaja como teleoperador en facturación. El eligió dicha carrera por tener la capacidad de liderazgo y al culminar sus estudios le gustaría trabajar en el área de bancas y finanzas y lograr una especialización en ello. El crédito lo invertirá en el pago de las pensiones y matrícula universitaria. Su mayor deseo es lograr la estabilidad económica de su familia y Culminar sus estudios que es una de las metas más importante de su logro personal. El agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
Jordy is a young man, 21 years old and single. He is currently in the fourth cycle of the business administration degree and at the same time working as a telemarketing phone operator in billing.

He chose this degree in order to have leadership capacity, and when he finishes his studies he would like to work in the area of banks and finances, and get a specialization in that.

He will invest the loan in paying for university pensions and enrollment.

His greatest wish is to attain economic stability for his family and finishing his studies is one of the most important goals for his personal success. He is thankful to the KIVA investors for the loans provided.

loans.use: to pay for university pensions and enrollment

loans.name: 11 Đa Phạn Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Cung works in agriculture raising marine aquaculture. Cung has been involved in this business for 4 years. The main hardship that Cung faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tools to raise scallops to sell in the future.

Cung is 40 years old and she is married with 2 children. Cung is the group leader of the 11 Đa Phạn Hải Lộc solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

In 2012, Cung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Cung has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Cung hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to raise scallops to sell in the future.

loans.name: 06 Đa Phạn Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Viện works in agriculture raising pigs. Viện has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in future.

Viện is 50 years old and she is married with 4 children. Viện is the group leader of the 06 Đa Phạn Hải Lộc solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. 

In 2012, Viện joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Viện has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Viện hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Nhóm 07 Phú Nhi Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Chung works in agriculture raising livestock. Chung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

Chung is 52 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the Nhóm 07 Phú Nhi Hưng Lộc solidarity group. 

In 2012, Chung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Chung has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profits, Chung hopes for her business to do well, to buy a motorbike, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: 02 Thôn Bùi Tiến Lộc Group

texts.en:
Loan works in agriculture raising poultry. Loan has been involved in this business for 1 year. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Loan is 30 years old and she is married with 1 child. She is the group leader of the 02 Thôn Bùi Tiến Lộc solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 

This is Loan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profits, Loan hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Nhóm 12-Thôn Đông- Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lan operates a food stall where she sells fish. Lan has been involved in this business for 4 years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

Lan is 39 years old and married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 12-Thôn Đông- Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. 

In 2014, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lan has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profits, Lan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Muñecas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 4 mujeres emprendedoras (Rosaura, Linda Lenita, Secilia y Delfina), viven en  la comunidad de Lamlaya, que en lengua  miskita significa agua mansa, se localiza a 15 kilómetros de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Hace 5 meses se organizaron en grupo solidario con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios de: ventas de mariscos y pulpería, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Están solicitando su segundo préstamo con Kiva. Con el primer préstamo lograron diversificar sus productos, Rosaura ahora vende frijoles cocidos en su casa y compro inventario de mariscos y pescados.

Delfina: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora alegre de 44 años de edad, casada con 8 hijos: 4 son mayores de edad, el de 15 años estudia su primer año de secundaria, el de 13 años cursa su cuarto grado de primaria, la niña de 9 años no estudia, debido a que tiene problemas psicomotores y no puede caminar y una menor de edad de 2 años. Su esposo trabaja como buzo en el mar. Ella desde hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de pescado y mariscos que los vende de manera ambulante en las paradas de buses de Bilwi en un termo con hielo, también vende en su vivienda de tambo de madera frijoles cocidos, bastimentos de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar más mariscos y pescados para vender más, incrementar sus ingresos y tener más clientes que demandan este producto que constituye uno de los alimentos básicos en Bilwi. Su sueño es llegar a ser una comerciante dueña de una distribuidora.
texts.en:
This solidarity group consists of 4 enterprising women; Rosaura, Linda Lenita, Secilia y Delfina.  They live in the community of Lamlaya, which in the miskita language means 'calm water'.  It is located 15 kilometers from the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. 

Five months ago they organized to form the solidarity group for the purpose of accessing a loan from Pana Pana to have the opportunity to improve their small business in fish sales and a corner store, and improve their earnings and therefore the quality of life of their families.  They are requesting their second loan with Kiva. With their first loan, they were able to diversity their products.  Rosaura now sells cooked beans in her home, and bought her inventory of shellfish and fish. 

Delfina is an integral part of the solidarity group.  She is a happy 44-year-old woman, married, with eight children.  Four children are now adults, the 15 year old is studying his first year of secondary school, and the 13 year old is in fourth grade.  The 9 year old is not studying, as she has psychomotor problems and cannot walk, and the youngest child is 2 years old.  

Her husband works as a diver in the sea.  For 9 years, she has worked in fish and shellfish sales.  She is a mobile vendor, selling them from a cooler at the bus stops in Bilwi.  She also sells cooked beans and supplies from her home, through which she generates her own income and contributes to the costs of the home and the education of her children.  

She is requesting financing to buy more fish and shellfish to sell more, increase her income and have more clients demanding this product as it constitutes one of the basic foods in Bilwi.  Her dream is to become a businesswoman and owner of a bulk goods shop.

loans.use: to buy more shellfish and fish

loans.name: Tazhibarhon

texts.ru: Тажибархон, 47 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Образование у Тажибархон среднее, много лет она занимается сельским хозяйством, а именно полеводством и животноводством. По характеру она очень трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. В хозяйстве есть корова. Также Тажибархон выращивает на 0,36 ГА собственной земли картофель, который реализует оптовым покупателям. Совокупный доход семьи составляет около 15,000 (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития бизнеса, она решила обратиться в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и на полеводство. Тажибархон является лидером группы "Отабек", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое. На прибыль от кредита Тажибархон планирует построить большой сарай для скота.
texts.en: Tazhibarhon is 47 years old, married and a mother to three children. Tazhibarhon has a secondary education. For many years, she has been practicing agriculture, specifically crop farming and livestock breeding. She is a very hardworking and goal-driven woman by nature. She has one cow on her farm. Tazhibarhon also has a 0.36 hectare plot of land on which she grows potatoes that sells to wholesale buyers. Her family's cumulative income is about 15,000 (KGS) per month. For the further development of her business, she decided to turn to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 60,000 som (KGS) to buy bull calves to fatten up and also for crop farming expenses. Tazhibarhon is the leader of the lending group "Otabek." There are two other members other than her in the group - three members altogether. Tazhibarhon plans to use the profits from the loan to build a large barn for her cattle.

loans.use: to purchase bull calves and cover crop farming expenses.

loans.name: 02060102 _ Thôn Quang Trung Xã Hoằng Châu Group

texts.en:
Luận works in agriculture raising poultry. Luận has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Luận faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Luận is 58 years old and married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 02060102 Thôn Quang Trung xã Hoằng Châu solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Luận lives  in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Luận's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

In the future, Luận hopes for her children to find a good job and  to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Kyun Chaung Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Kyun Chaung Village in the middle of Myanmar's Delta region. The group consists of 15 village customers, overseen by five Community Based Organization (CBO) members. 

The village has over 1000 villagers and most are livestock raisers and/or farmers. As the steam is nearby, they do fishing as a second business. Besides ducks, villagers sometimes raise pigs and chickens. 

With the Proximity loan, some group members will purchase ducks which will boost their income from duck's eggs. For the remaining members, the loan will help to purchase high-quality feeds. 

Pictured above are the CBO members from Kyun Chaung Village, known as U Bo, U Kan, U Maung, Daw Sandar and Daw Khin. U Bo (in the middle of the picture) is 28 years old and takes care of his livestock, pigs and ducks. He has just married a couple of months ago and they are handling the businesses by themselves. The Proximity loan will help U Bo purchase high quality feeds for his ducks.

loans.use: To purchase both ducks and ducklings.

loans.name: 020201140004 Thôn 3 _ Hoằng Đông Group

texts.en:
Thúy works in agriculture raising poultry and farming rice. Thúy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice to farm and baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Thúy is 39 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 020201140004 Thôn 3 _ Hoằng Đông solidarity group.  She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2006, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thúy has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profits, Thúy hopes for her children to do well in school, to build a new house, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Ah Kei Gyi Village Group 1

texts.en:
Located in Ah Kei Gyi Village in Myanmar's Ayeyarwaddy Delta region, this community is comprised of 22 village customers who are overseen by five Community Based Organisation (CBO) members. This loan will help some of the group to purchase both ducks and ducklings that will boost their income as they will get more duck eggs. Some group members will use the funds to buy high-quality feeds costing $100 for a month of feed and will repair the duck farms.  

Ah Kei Gyi Village has over 140 households and a population of 340; most of the villagers focus on crop farming. They also plant seasonal vegetables and fruits such as coconuts and banana. For additional income, the households also raise livestock, pigs and ducks.

Pictured above are the CBO members of Ah Kei Gyi  Village Group 1, named U Kyaw, U Naing, U Tun, U Yan and Daw Aye. Included in the picture, U Kyaw ( Second from Right) is 28 years old and farms on his 10-acre-crop farm. He is married and just had a baby girl who is nine months. His wife's duties are to look after the livestock, 104 ducks and four pigs. U Kyaw will use the Proximity loan to repair his duck farm and also purchase high-quality feeds.

loans.use: to repair duck farms and purchase high quality feeds.

loans.name: Hmaw Bi Village Group 2

texts.en:
This community is located in Hmaw Bi Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 18 village customers. This loan will help some group members purchase ducks and the remaining group members will use the funds to purchase high-quality feed, costing $28 for 6 days feed for 100 ducks. 

This will boost the villagers' income as they will have more duck eggs. Hmaw Bi village has a population of over 1300 and many of them are farmers. Those with arable land cultivate rice paddy and plant seasonal vegetables and fruits such as bananas and coconuts. Besides duck raising and farming, the villagers also raise pigs for additional income. Some households have small grocery or dry food stores in their houses.

Pictured above are the CBO members from Hmaw Bi Village Group 2, named Daw Mya, Daw San, Daw Soe, Daw Zin and U Chit.  

Daw Mya (sitting in the picture) is 39 years old and married with three children. Her husband farms on his friend's farm as a daily farmer but the couple plant summer crops by renting the farm in summer. Daw Mya is responsible for taking care of the livestock, ducks and pigs. Proximity's loan will help the family to purchase 25 more ducks and high-quality feed for them. The good quality of feed will boost Daw Mya's family income as they will get more duck eggs.

loans.use: to purchase ducks as well as high-quality feeds.

loans.name: Inn Du Village Group 1

texts.en:
Located in Inn Du Village in Myanmar's Ayeyarwaddy Delta region, this community is composed of 16 village customers overseen by five community based organisation (CBO) members. This loan will help some of the group purchase both ducks and ducklings that will boost their income as they will have more duck eggs. Some group members will use the funds to buy high quality feeds costing $100 for a month-worth of feed. 

Inn Du Village has over 270 households and a population of 1262; most of the villagers focus on crop farming. They also plant seasonal vegetables and fruits such as coconuts and banana. For additional income, the households also raise livestock, pigs and ducks.

Pictured above are the CBO members from Inn Du Village Group 1, named U Nyunt, U Thein, U Sein, U Nyunt O and Daw Mya. Included in the picture, U Nyunt (second from left) is 50 years old and is a farmer. He is married with three children who are all students. His wife does both house chores and looks after the livestock, ducks and pigs. The Proximity loan will help U Nyunt to purchase high quality feeds for his ducks and then he will receive more revenue from sale of duck eggs.

loans.use: To purchase ducks and high quality feeds for both ducks and ducklings.

loans.name: Honorable Rosa Group

texts.es: Diana tiene 27 años de edad es soltera con 02 hijos educando. Ella realiza decoraciones para todo tipo de eventos y a la vez expende ropa para damas a través de catálogos  vía internet.  El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más materiales globos tecnopor  siliconas y más ropa de estación de verano. Ella es socia del grupo “HONORABLE ROSA”. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Y de la misma manera se encuentra adjuntada la foto de  Rosa  En  la parte superior derecho. Ella no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos laborales. Diana es la segunda del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Diana is 27 years old, single, and has two children in school.  She makes decorations for all types of events as well sells clothing to women through an internet catalog.  She will invest the loan in purchasing more silicone balloons and clothing for the summer season.   

She is a member of the "Honorable Rosa" group.  The group thanks Kiva's lenders for the loans they have provided.  Above on the right is a photo of Rosa, who could not be at the meeting because of work.  Diana is the second on the left.

loans.use: to buy more decorating materials

loans.name: Nhóm 01-Chợ Điện Biên-P. Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lợi has a retail business selling shoes. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Lợi has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lợi faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes to resell.

Lợi is 44 years old and she is married with 2 children. Lợi is the group leader of the Nhóm 01-chợ Điện Biên-P. Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

In 2012, Lợi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lợi has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Lợi hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to resell.

Lan is 37 years old and she is married with 4 children. Lan is the group leader of the 05 Đa Phạn Hải Lộc solidarity group, which consists of 7 members.

loans.name: Huyền

texts.en:
Mrs Huyền works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Huyền has been involved in this business for 5 years. Huyền is 30 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

The main hardship that Huyền faces in her life is not having hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet. This is Huyền first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Huyền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nhóm 07- Thôn Hải- Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Gái operates a food stall, selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to sell.

Gái is 60 years old and she is married, with eight children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 07- Thôn Hải- Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

In 2014, Gái joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Gái has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Gái hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

texts.en:
Thông is 30 years old and married with two children. For the last five years, she has worked raising livestock. Thông is the group leader of the Nhóm 07 thôn 4 Quảng Hải Solidarity Group, which consists of four members. She joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2014 to improve her business. Thông has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of her most critical business difficulties is the lack of capital.

Thông is requesting a loan to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in future. With her business profit, she hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

texts.en:
Mrs Phương works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Phương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Phương is 39 years old and she is married with 2 children. Phương lives  in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

The main hardship that Phương faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet. This is Phương first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Phương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy for her business to do well, and to maintain a successful business.

Mrs Dịu works in agriculture farming food. Dịu has been involved in this business for 5 years. Dịu is 29 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

The main hardship that Dịu faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet. This is Dịu first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

texts.en:
Phương operates a food stall selling fish. Phương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Phương faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

Phương is 45 years old and she is married with 4 children. She is the leader of a 8-member group, the Nhóm 13- Thôn Đông- Quảng Nham solidarity group. 

In 2007, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Phương has successfully repaid 8 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Phương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

Mrs Doan works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Doan has been involved in this business for 5 years. Doan is 30 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

The main hardship that Doan faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet. This is Doan first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

loans.name: 02060318 _ Thôn Đại Giang _ Xã Hoằng Châu Group

texts.en:
Lan is 24 years old and married with a child. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. For the past five years, Lan has worked raising poultry. She is the group leader of the 02060318 Thôn Đại Giang xã Hoằng Châu Solidarity Group, which consists of five members. Lan’s main business hardship is the lack of capital.

Lan will use her portion of her group loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell. This will be her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profit, Lan hopes to maintain a successful business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell

The main hardship that Tuyển faces in her life is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom. This is Tuyển's first loan with Kiva's partner, Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.name: Kyar Kone Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region and there are five CBO (Community Based Organization) members overseeing a group of 36 village customers. The loan will help some group members to purchase ducks and high quality feed such as dry prawns and other duck food. Each of the usages will boost the group member's income by selling duck's eggs.

Kyar Kone Village has over 170 households; many villagers focus on crop farming. The villagers also plant seasonal fruit and raise livestock such as pigs and ducks. 

Pictured above are the CBO members from Kyar Kone group, named U Hla, U Aye, U Tun, U Myint Z and U Myint. Included in the picture, U Hla (first from the left )is 51 years old and married with six children. One of the six children is a student and others are married, handling their own businesses. The family does crop farming, plantation of seasonal food and raises livestock.

Proximity's loan will help U Hla purchase ducks and high quality feed. The good quality foods will let the ducks have well-nourished eggs that will boost U Hla's family income when selling the eggs.

loans.use: to purchase more ducks and high quality feed for ducks

loans.name: Bleoume

texts.fr: Etant mariée et agée de 43 ans, Bleoume est une mère de deux enfants et vivent ensemble à Sanguéra. Bleoume a comme activité la vente des condiments et des produits d’alimentations générales afin de couvrir les charges régulières de la famille. Elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché d’Adidogomé. Bleoume s’est vue dans le besoin d’approvisionner son étalage et elle a donc sollicité ce crédit pour acquérir plus de marchandises et aider son mari dans les besoins du foyer
texts.en:
Bleoume is a 43-year-old married mother of two. She and her family live together in Sanguéra. 

To help cover the family’s regular expenses, Bleoume sells condiments and grocery items. She buys merchandise once a month at the Adidogomé market. 

Bleoume needs to restock her stall. She is seeking this loan to stock up and to help her husband handle the needs of their household.

loans.use: to buy 3 jugs of oil and 4 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Gwa Ka Lay Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Gwa Ka Lay Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region and includes 20 village customers, five of whom are CBO (Community Based Organization) members helping to lead the loan program in the area. This loan will help some group members to purchase high quality feeds (costing $80 for 100 ducks fed) that will boost their income from more duck's eggs. The other members will use the funds to repair the duck farm (costing $40-$50 for a 100-duck farm), which needs to be exchanged every year.

Gwa Ka Lay Village mainly does farming and plantation of seasonal vegetables and nipa palms. They also raise pigs, ducks, and chickens as livestock and for additional income. While in the home the entire day, some housewives both sort out the house chores and open small grocery shops in front of their house.

Pictured above are the CBO members from Gwa Ka Lay Village, known as U Aye, U Kyi, and Daw Aye T. First from left in the picture, U Aye is 65 years old and married with six children: three daughters and three sons. Among his six children, some are married and handling their own businesses. Like the fellow members, U Aye will use the funds from Kiva to purchase high-quality feeds and repair the duck farm. Good and comfortable living is one of the most important factors in raising the ducks. It will make them happy and lay more, which will boost U Aye's income.

loans.use: to repair duck farms and purchase high-quality feed.

loans.name: Myat Lay Yone Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Myat Lay Yone Village, Myanmar, in the Ayeyarwaddy Delta region and includes 13 village customers, of whom five are CBO (Community Based Organization) members helping to lead the loan program in the area. This loan will help some group members to purchase high quality feeds (costing $80 for 100 ducks feed) that will boost their income from more duck's eggs. The other members will use the funds to purchase both ducks and ducklings (costing $450 for 100 ducks and $75 for 100 ducklings). 

The village has over 1000 villagers and most of them are farmers. There are streams along the village and so, men in Myat Lay Yone do fishing as a second business. Women mostly do either house chores or plantation of vegetables in the village.

Pictured above are the CBO members from Myat Lay Yone Village, named Daw Aye, U Than, U Kyaw and Daw Than. Second from left in the picture is Daw Aye who is thirty years old. She is married and blessed with two children; one of them is a student. Her husband farms in their nine acres crop farm and Daw Aye sometimes helps, too. Proximity's loan will help Daw Aye's small family purchase high quality feed that will boost their income from more duck's eggs.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high quality feed.

Quang is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, and milk to sell. This will be her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profit, Quang hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Banco Mujer Emprendedoras
Fray Casiano, Puntarenas
	Banco Mujer Emprendedoras presenta la solicitud de crédito, por cuarta oportunidad, está conformado por 4 mujeres,  quienes han trabajado desde hace 8 años como grupo organizado en Fray Casiano, zona  de alta pobreza en Puntarenas, Región del Pacífico Central de Costa Rica. Han  demostrado buen manejo de los conceptos de trabajo grupal (solidaridad, ahorro; además de coordinan actividades generando fondos para ellas),  tiene reglas claras de trabajo. Han solicitado préstamos y conocen la modalidad de trabajo grupal.  Se forma la Junta Directiva y se levanta el acta No.4 para la solicitud de este préstamo.
 Su trabajo y  esfuerzo les ha permitido tener la actividad de comercio ambulante  mejor consolidada, situación que se corrobora en la visita realizada a cada una de las solicitantes. 

Ericka, integrante del grupo, invertirán su crédito  en la compra de sandalias, ropa, artículos de belleza y mercadería en general, incrementando su inventario  y cubriendo pedidos para la época de verano en la zona de Puntarenas, que es una de las mejores temporadas del año para el comercio,  siendo una gran oportunidad para las ventas; es una  mujer muy luchadora y gracias a la organización interna del grupo logra realizar  la recuperación de la cuota en forma semanal,  lo que les permite tener un margen más amplio para la obtención del dinero para el pago. 

Además el grupo realiza actividades  ofreciendo comida y rifas que les permiten incrementar su ahorro y apoyar a sus familia en los gastos del hogar y estudio de los hijos, ya que la mayoría de las integrantes son madres solteras y jefas de hogar y su aporte económico es muy importante para la calidad de vida de ellas y la de sus hijos e hijas. 

	Son mujeres luchadoras, que por medio de la organización han logrado superarse y mejorar los ingresos de sus familias, apoyando  el estudio a sus hijos y a sus parejas contribuyendo  en la economía familiar, ellas han logrado hacerse sentir en la zona donde residen, son conocidas por sus actividades de fin de semana, donde vende comidas en la comunidad dando trabajo a otras personas (familiares principalmente)para la elaboración de estos platillos, típicos de la zona costera costarricense, como vigoron, frito, ceviche y los tamales comida típica costarricense.
texts.en:
Banco Mujer Emprendedoras

Fray Casiano, Puntarenas

Banco Mujer Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurial Women's Bank) presents its fourth loan request. The group consists of 4 women, who have worked for the past 8 years as an organized group in Fray Casiano, a zone of high poverty in Puntarenas, a region of the Central Pacific in Costa Rica. They have demonstrated good use of the concepts of group work (solidarity, saving; also of the coordination of activities generating funds for them), the group has clear rules of work. They have requested loans and they know the method of group work. The board of directors meets and brings about the 4th agreement for the request of this loan.

Their work and effort has permitted them to have better-consolidated mobile business activity, a situation that is confirmed by the visit carried out to each one of the applicants.

Ericka, a group member, will invest her loan in the purchase of sandals, clothing, beauty items, and general merchandise, increasing her inventory and covering orders for the summer period in the Puntarenas area, which is one of the best seasons of the year for business, being a great opportunity for sales; she is a very determined woman and thanks to the internal organization of the group she manages to recover her weekly dues, that which permits them to have a wider margin for obtaining money for payment.

In addition the group carries out activities offering food and lottery tickets that allow them to increase their savings and support their families in household expenses and children' studies, since the majority of the members are single mothers and heads of their households and their economic contribution is very important for the quality of life of the women and their sons and daughters.

They are determined women, who, through the organization have managed to exceed and improve the incomes of their families, supporting the studies of their children and their partners, contributing to the family economy, they have managed to make themselves felt in the zone where they reside, they are known for their weekend activities, where they sell food in the community giving work to other people (principally family members) for the production of those dishes, typical of the coastal zone of Costa Rica, such as vigoron, frito, ceviche and tamales which are typical Costa Rican foods.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, women's and men's clothing, perfumes, shoes, costume jewelry

loans.name: Sidwata 02 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr RASMANE représente le groupe SIDWATA 02 SAPONE. Marié, il est père de 01 enfant qui est âgé de 04ans et ne va pas à l’école. Il a 03personnes en charge.
Mr fait l’élevage depuis 07ans. Il s’approvisionne dans son quartier.
Il veut s’acheter 04moutons.
Mr veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour s’acheter d’autres moutons. Il ambitionne assurer l’avenir des enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. RASMANE represents the group SIDWATA 02 SAPONE. He is the married father of a 4-year-old child who does not yet go to school. He supports three people. 

Mr. Rasmane has been raising animals for seven years. He buys them in his district. He is planning to buy four sheep. 

Mr. Rasmane will use his profits to buy more sheep. His goal is to provide for his children’s future.

loans.use: to buy 4 sheep.

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.ru: Мавлюда 37 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. Мавлюда, в качестве основного дохода уже 5 лет занимается торговлей женской одеждой на местном рынке. На сегодняшний день у нее есть товар в обороте на сумму около 1 млн. сомов (KGS). Ее ежемесячный доход до 35,000 сом (KGS). Мавлюда обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товара. Доходы от кредита позволят Мавлюде улучшить благосостояние и жилищные условия ее семьи.
texts.en: Mavlyuda is 37, married, and the mother of four children. She has been selling women's clothing at the local market as the main source of income for her family for five years already. She earns 35,000 som (KGS) per month. Mavlyuda applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to expand her assortment of goods. She plans to use her profits to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing in order to provide a larger assortment of items in her shop

loans.name: Chifaou

texts.fr: Agée de 36 ans, Chifaou est une femme mariée avec ses trois enfants. Elle vit seule à Sanguéra et cherche vigoureusement à améliorer sa condition de vie par son petit commerce de produits cosmétiques. Chifaou vend les produits de beauté dans son quartier et se déplace à la demande de ses clients. Elle s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé et trouve une bonne rentabilité. Chifaou demande ce crédit pour acheter des mèches et des produits de qualités répondant aux goûts de ses clients.
texts.en: Chifaou is a 36-year-old married mother to three children. She lives alone in Sanguéra and is putting in a lot of effort to improve her standard of living through the sale of cosmetic products. Chifaou sells her beauty products in her local area and delivers to her customers. She gets her supplies three times a month from the main market in Lomé and makes a decent profit. Chifaou is requesting this loan in order to purchase weaves and quality products which meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase six weaves and nine bottles of shampoo

This funding will help other group members purchase ducks or ducklings from which they will earn more from selling duck's eggs. Ku Lar Kone Tan Village group focuses on crop farming and livestock raising of ducks and pigs.

Pictured above are the CBO members from Ku Lar Kone Tan Village, named U Aye, U Thein, U San, U Aung, and U Maung. Included in the picture, U Aye (second from right) is fifty-six years old and married. Two of his children help him in the farm and the youngest daughter is a high school student. borrowers.first_name: Ku Lar Kone Tan Village Group

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana lives in Shashiani in Eastern Georgia. There she cultivates a fruit orchard with her husband. Growing and selling kakis (Asian persimmons) and peaches is the only source of income for the family of six. In springtime there will be plenty of work to do so that the kaki trees produce a good harvest. The trees must be cut, the soil must be ploughed, and the irrigation must be improved. This means she will build a new water canal and buy pipes and sprinklers. Manana will use the loan to pay for these provisions.

The repayments for this credit are scheduled in a way that allows Manana first to sell her fruit and then repay with the revenues.

loans.use: to build a water canal and buy pipes and sprinklers to irrigate her orchard

loans.name: Seik Gyi Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Seik Gyi Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region, and includes 27 village customers, of whom five are CBO (Community Based Organization) members helping to lead the loan program in the area. This loan will help some group members to purchase high quality feed(costing $80 for 100 ducks' feed) that will boost their income from more duck's eggs. The other members will use the funds to purchase both ducks and ducklings (costing $450 for 100 ducks and $75 for 100 ducklings). 

The village has over 1000 villagers and some are farmers. As the stream is nearby, they do fishing as a second business and also raise livestock, pigs and ducks. Some households also plant seasonal fruit or vegetables that they sell in other villages or towns.
 
Pictured above are the CBO members from Seik Gyi Village, known as, U Soe, U Ohm, U Kyaw, U Win and U Myint. First from left (standing) in the picture, is U Soe, forty years old and married with two children. He farms in his six acres crop farm and does plantation of betel and seasonal vegetables. His wife does both household chores and looks after their 120 ducks. The couple are so proud to see that their twenty-year-old son helps U Soe in the farm and handling the business. 

Proximity's loan will help U Soe to purchase high quality feed that will boost the family's income by more well nourished duck's eggs.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high quality feed

loans.name: Lazos Unidos Y Rumbos Distintos Group

texts.es: Janet tiene 42 años de edad es casada con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica al cultivo de frutas que crecen en la zona que radica para luego expenderlo. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de su producción. Ella es socia del grupo “LAZOS UNIDOS Y RUMBOS DISTINTOS”. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Janet es la que viste blusa blanca a rayas
texts.en:
Janet is 42 years old and marries with 3 dependent children. She makes a living growing fruits that grow in the area where she lives to sell later. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of fertilizers to improve the quality of her production.

She is a member in the group" LAZOS UNIDOS Y RUMBOS DISTINTOS" (UNITED TIES AND DIFFERENT PATHS). The group is thankful to the KIVA investors for the loans provided.

Janet is the one wearing a white blouse with stripes.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Ndèye Coura

texts.fr:
Mlle Ndèye Coura âgée de 27 ans, s’active dans le petit commerce. Elle vient solliciter pour la première fois, un crédit à l’IMCEC pour acheter des produits cosmétiques, vu que c’est dans  cela qu’elle s’active. Elle a démarré il y a plus de trois ans. Elle compte sa clientèle parmi son voisinage, ses amies… Avec le crédit, Ndèye Coura va acheter des parfums et de l’encens.
Elle vit avec ses parents, et elle participe à la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et cela grâce aux bénéfices de l’activité.
Elle veut augmenter petit à petit son capital afin de diversifier ses produits et services et fidéliser sa clientèle. Elle pense même chercher une cantine et vendre aussi des variétés de tissus.
texts.en:
Ndèye Coura is 27 years old and works in small-scale retail. She is requesting her first-ever loan from UIMCEC so she can purchase cosmetic products, as this is the sector she specializes in. She has been doing this for over three years. Her clients include her neighbours, her friends... With this loan, Ndèye Coura will purchase perfumes and incense.

She lives with her parents and contributes towards her family's daily expenses. She is able to do so thanks to her business.

She wants to slowly increase her working capital in order to diversify the range of products and services she offers and to build up a loyal customer base. She is even considering purchasing a stall, in addition to selling different varieties of fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes and incense for resale

loans.name: Banco Mujer Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Banco Mujer Emprendedoras
Fray Casiano, Puntarenas
	Banco Mujer Emprendedoras presenta la solicitud de crédito, por cuarta oportunidad, está conformado por 3 mujeres,  quienes han trabajado desde hace 8 años como grupo organizado en Fray Casiano, zona  de alta pobreza en Puntarenas, Región del Pacífico Central de Costa Rica. Han  demostrado buen manejo de los conceptos de trabajo grupal (solidaridad, ahorro; además de coordinan actividades generando fondos para ellas),  tiene reglas claras de trabajo. Han solicitado préstamos y conocen la modalidad de trabajo grupal.  Se forma la Junta Directiva y se levanta el acta No.4 para la solicitud de este préstamo.
 Su trabajo y  esfuerzo les ha permitido tener la actividad de comercio ambulante  mejor consolidada, situación que se corrobora en la visita realizada a cada una de las solicitantes. 

Maria , integrante del grupo, invertirán su crédito  en la compra de, ropa, artículos de belleza y mercadería en general, incrementando su inventario  y cubriendo pedidos para la época de verano en la zona de Puntarenas, que es una de las mejores temporadas del año para el comercio,  siendo una gran oportunidad para las ventas; es una  mujer muy luchadora y gracias a la organización interna del grupo logra realizar  la recuperación de la cuota en forma semanal,  lo que les permite tener un margen más amplio para la obtención del dinero para el pago. Ella es la secretaria y   espera contar con esté préstamo para seguir creciendo cada día.
Además el grupo realiza actividades  ofreciendo comida y rifas que les permiten incrementar su ahorro y apoyar a sus familia en los gastos del hogar y estudio de los hijos, ya que la mayoría de las integrantes son madres solteras y jefas de hogar y su aporte económico es muy importante para la calidad de vida de ellas y la de sus hijos e hijas. 
	Son mujeres luchadoras, que por medio de la organización han logrado superarse y mejorar los ingresos de sus familias, apoyando  el estudio a sus hijos y a sus parejas contribuyendo  en la economía familiar, ellas han logrado hacerse sentir en la zona donde residen, son conocidas por sus actividades de fin de semana, donde vende comidas en la comunidad dando trabajo a otras personas (familiares principalmente)para la elaboración de estos platillos, típicos de la zona costera costarricense, como vigoron, frito, ceviche y los tamales comida típica costarricense.
texts.en:
Banco Mujer Emprendedoras
Fray Casiano, Puntarenas
	
Banco Mujer Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurial Women's Bank) presents their fourth loan request, it is made up of 3 women, who have worked for the last 8 years as an organized group in the Fray Casiano area, a high poverty zone in Puntarenas, a Region of the Central Pacific in Cosa Rica. They have demonstrated good use of the concepts of group work (solidarity, savings; in addition the coordination of activities generating funds for the women), they have clear rules of work. They have requested loans and they know the method of group work. They have a Board of Directors meets and the documents were prepared to request this fourth loan.

Their work and effort has permitted them to have stronger mobile business activities, a situation which is confirmed by visiting each one of the applicants. 

Maria, a member of the group, will invest her loan in the purchase of clothing, beauty products, and general merchandise, increasing her inventory and covering orders for the summer season in the Puntarenas area, which is one of the best seasons of the year for the business, being a great opportunity for sales; she is a very determined woman and thanks to the internal organization of the group she manages to recover her weekly dues, which allows them to have a wider margin to  obtain the money for the payment. She is the secretary and hopes to count on this loan to continue growing each day. 

In addition the group carries out activities offering food and lottery tickets that allow them to increase their savings and support their families in household expenses and their children' studies, since the majority of the members are single mothers and heads of the household and their economic contribution is very important for their quality of life and that of their sons and daughters. 

They are determined women, who, through the organization have managed to exceed and increase the income of their families, supporting the studies of their children and their partners contributing to the familial economy, they have managed to make themselves felt in the area where they lives, they are known for their weekend activities, where they sell food in the community giving work to other people (primarily family members) to make typical Costa Rican dishes such as vigoron, frito, ceviche, and tamales.

loans.use: to purchase merchandies, shoes, clothing, sandals, and beauty products

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Afiwa est une jeune femme célibataire de 27 ans qui vit à Gblinkomé. Elle s’évertue activement pour gagner sa vie et subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens. Pour parvenir à ses fins, Afiwa vend des produits de beauté qu’elle expose à ses clients qui lui procurent une bonne rentabilité dans son activité. Elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois au grand  marché de Lomé. Grâce  à son dynamisme, Afiwa sollicite ce crédit pour avoir de bonnes collections à présenter à ses clients pour susciter leurs goûts et gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en: Afiwa is 27 years old and lives in Gblinkomé. She strives to earn a living and meet the costs of her daily needs. In order to reach her goals, Afiwa sells beauty products to her customers, which brings in a good profit. She gets her supplies once per month from the main market in Lomé. Thanks to her dynamic character, Afiwa is requesting this loan to purchase beauty products which meet her customer's desires, thereby developing a solid profit margin.

loans.use: to purchase four dozen weaves

loans.name: Sidwata 03 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr KIRSI représente le groupe SIDWATA 03 SAPONE. Marié, il est père de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 23ans et le moins âgé a 16ans. 04 vont à l’école. Il a 05personnes en charge.
Mr fait l’élevage depuis 13ans. Il s’approvisionne dans son quartier.
Il veut s’acheter 04 porcs.
Mr veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour construire une maison d’habitation dans sa parcelle. Il ambitionne assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Kirsi represents the Sidwata 03 Sapone group. He is married and has four children: the eldest is 23 years old and the youngest is 16 years old. All four children are students. He has five dependents.

Mr. Kirsi has been raising livestock for 13 years. He stocks up in his neighborhood. He would like to buy four pigs. He plans to use his revenues to buy a house to live in on his land plot. His goal is to provide for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy four pigs.

loans.name: Herald Leonidas

texts.es:
Aportar a la mejoría de la calidad de vida de las personas en diferentes comunidades, es un trabajo arduo. Herald es un joven de 29 años que actualmente cursa el último año de la carrera de Ingeniería civil. Él estudió esta profesión debido a su pasión por las matemáticas y por sus deseos de aportar en la construcción de mejores obras civiles. Su único apoyo son sus padres. 
Herald solicita el crédito porque desea pagar los gastos de su titulación y graduación y así poder acreditarse como ingeniero civil para tener mejores opciones de empleo y desarrollarse profesionalmente. Sus metas son obtener pronto su título, encontrar un empleo y construir su casa propia para formar un hogar.
texts.en:
Contributing to improving the quality of life of people in different communities is arduous work.  Herald is a 29 year old who is currently in his final year of studies in civil engineering.   He studied this career because of his passion for mathematics and his desire to contribute to better civil projects.  His parents are his only support.  

Herald is requesting a loan because he wants to pay the costs of his degree and graduation and be able to become an accredited civil engineer to have better employment options and professional development.   His goals are to soon obtain his degree, find a job, and build his own house to start a home.

loans.use: Pagar los gastos de su titulación y graduación.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bed sheets, perfumes and incense, which will be resold

loans.name: Sidwata 01 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr BERNARD représente le groupe SIDWATA 01 SAPONE. Marié, il est père de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 06ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 01 va à l’école. Il a 03personnes en charge.
Mr fait l’élevage depuis 06ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants.
Il veut s’acheter 02 porcs.
Mr veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour acheter d’autres bétail. Il ambitionne assurer l’avenir des enfants.
texts.en:
Bernard represents the Sidwata 01 Sapone Group. He is a married father to two children. His eldest is six years old, and currently receiving an education, and his youngest is three years old. He has three people living under his care.

Bernard has been raising livestock for six years. He gets his supplies from the surrounding villages. He currently wishes to purchase two pigs.

Bernard wants to use the profits from these pigs to purchase other livestock. His dream is to be able to provide for his children's future.

loans.use: to purchase two pigs

loans.name: Htaung Mhu Chaung Village Group 1

texts.en:
This community is located in Htaung Mhu Chaung Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region and consists of 19 village customers of which five are CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members helping lead the loan program in the area. This loan will help some group members purchase high-quality feed (costing $30 a week to feed 100 ducks) that will boost their income from more duck eggs. The other members will use the funds to repair their duck farms (costing $40-$50 for a 100-duck farm). 
Htaung Mhu Chaung Village has over 700 households.  Besides duck raising, many villagers grow rice and seasonal vegetables and raise other livestock such as pigs and chickens.
Pictured above are the CBO members from Htaung Mhu Chaung Group 1 Village, named U Than, U Bar, U Pyae, U Kyaw and U Zaw. Included in the picture, U Than (second from right) is 49 years old and married with three children. His wife raises their 160 ducks. U Than's two eldest children are working in the city and the youngest is a student living in their house. He also helps raise the family's pigs, a source of savings. U Than has been raising ducks for over 20 years and like other members, he will use the Proximity loan to purchase high-quality feed for his ducks that will boost his income.  This boost is critical in enabling U Than and his family to continue supporting his youngest child's ongoing education.

loans.use: To help the Htaung Mhu Chaung Group 1 Village customers purchase high quality feeds for duck farms.

loans.name: Wendy Tatiana

texts.es:
Wendy, de 26 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña, con ella viven sus abuelos. 

Wendy, tiene un local de venta de ropa, tiene 2 años de tener el negocio y lo aprendió por medio de una amiga.-Su negocio está a 5 minutos de su casa y viaja a pie. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar ropa y para la remodelación del local. 

Su sueño es, que su local de ropa crezca y que sea reconocido por todos y también, darle buenas condiciones de vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Wendy is a 26-year-old single mother to a little girl.  Her grandparents live with her.  

Wendy has a clothing store and has two years in the business, which she learned from a friend.  Her business is 5 minutes form her house and she walks to work.  She needs the loan to buy clothing and for the store's renovations.  

Her dream is that her clothing store will grow and be well known by all, and that she will also be able to give her daughter good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothing and remodel her store

loans.name: Htaung Mhu Chaung Village Group 2

texts.en:
This community is located in Htaung Mhu Chaung Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region, and consists of 19 village customers, of whom five are CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members helping lead the loan program in the area. This loan will help some group members to purchase high quality feed (costing $80 for 100 ducks' feed) that will boost their income from more duck eggs. The other members will use the funds to repair their duck farms (costing $40 or $50 for a farm for 100 ducks) that need to be exchanged every year.  

Htaung Mhu Chaung Village has over 700 households and many of them are focused on planting winter crops. Besides crops, they also do plantation of seasonal vegetables and raise livestock such as pigs, ducks and chickens.

Pictured above are the CBO members from Htaung Mhu Chaung Group 2 Village, named U Maung, U Thaung, U Wai, Daw Sandar and U Hla. U Maung (second from right) is 72 years old and currently living together with his son's family. He and his son farm in their five acres of crop farm and look after the livestock, ducks and pigs. It has been over forty years that U Maung has been in this duck-raising business. With the Proximity loan he will repair his duck farm and purchase 30 or 40 ducks. More ducks will boost U Maung's family income from selling more duck eggs.

loans.use: to purchase high quality feed and materials for duck farms.

loans.name: Kyauk Ye Village Group

texts.en:
This community is in Kyauk Ye Village, Myanmar in the Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, five CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 27 (15 males, 12 females) village customers. This loan will help them purchase high quality feed to feed 100 ducks for a week, which costs $30. Villagers' income will be increased through more duck eggs. In addition to ducks, Kyauk Ye villagers also sometimes raise pigs and chickens. Pigs are mainly a source of savings, while chickens are used to generate income through eggs, similar to ducks. However, villagers prefer ducks because they require fewer inputs and have lower mortality rates due to disease.
  
In addition to ducks, Kyauk Ye Villagers focus on crop farming of rice and seasonal vegetables and fruits. Some households have grocery or coconut shops that they operate our of their houses.

Pictured above are the CBO members from the Kyauk Ye Village Group, named U Kyaw, U Soe, U That, U Myint and Daw Hnin. U Kyaw (first on right in the photo) is 39 years old, married, and has two children. He sells coconuts and betel in the market, and his wife takes care of the ducks and pigs. U Kyaw will use Proximity's loan to purchase high quality feed for both ducks and ducklings that will increase his income from duck's eggs.

loans.use: to purchase high quality feed for both ducks and ducklings

loans.name: Lay Eain Kone Village Group

texts.en:
Lay Eain Kone Village is located in the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community there are five CBO (Community Based Organization) members overseeing a group of 21 village customers (11 males and 10 females). This loan will help group members purchase ducks or ducklings, repair their duck farms, and purchase high-quality feed such as dry prawns. 
Lay Eain Kone Village has over 400 villagers.  Besides duck raising, many villagers farm rice and fruits and vegetables such as bananas, coconuts and betel. For their savings, many households also raise pigs.
Pictured above are the CBO members from Lay Eain Kone Village, named Daw Mar, U Htoo, U Htwe, U Hte and U Zaw. Included in the picture, Daw Mar (in the middle) is 38 years old and married. They have one son who is a secondary student.  Daw Mar looks after their family's 110 ducks, while her husband takes care of their small crop farm. Proximity's loan will help Daw Mar's family purchase more ducks and high-quality feed. If the ducks have good nourishment, they will increase their egg production and warrant higher prices at time of sale. This will boost Daw Mar's income, helping pay for her son's continuing education.

loans.use: To help the Lay Eain Kone Village group members purchase more ducks and high-quality feed.

loans.name: Taumaia

texts.en: Taumaia is 44 years old and married with 4 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. Taumaia needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, a machete and gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2015. Taumaia will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, a machete and gloves.

loans.name: Tuliu

texts.en:
Tuliu is a 60-year-old mother with four children. She owns and operates a small business selling fish 'n' chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Tuliu has requested a loan to buy a sack of potatoes, a frying pan, plastic bags, vegetable oil, and a box of chicken to help her run the business. She will use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. 

Tuliu became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sack of potatoes, a frying pan, plastic bags, vegetable oil, and a box of chicken

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia is 30 years old and unmarried with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Malia needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new boots, a bush knife, a wheelbarrow and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2015. Malia will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new boots, a bush knife, a wheelbarrow and crops

loans.name: Faatiu

texts.en: Faatiu is 22 years old and unmarried with 2 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. Faatiu needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a machete. She has been a member of SPBD since 2015. Faatiu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a machete.

loans.name: Ianeta

texts.en: Ianeta is 26 years old and unmarried with 4 children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. Ianeta needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, seeds, chicken manure, a watering hose and gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2015. Ianeta will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, seeds, chicken manure, a watering hose and gloves.

loans.name: Fialelei

texts.en: Fialelei is a woman of 22 years with 1 child. She owns and operates a small business of selling cabbage, cucumber, and eggplant in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Fialelei has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumber, and eggplant), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to help her with the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. Fialelei joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumber, and eggplant), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Ah Kei Gyi Village Group 2

texts.en:
Located in Ah Kei Gyi Village at Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region, this community includes five CBO members overseeing 18 village customers. This loan will help some of the group purchase both ducks and ducklings that will boost their income from more duck eggs. Some group members will use the funds to buy high quality feed costing $100 for a month's feed and repair the duck farms.  

Ah Kei Gyi Village has over 140 households and a population of 340; most of the villagers focus on crop farming. They also plant seasonal vegetables and fruit such as coconuts and bananas. For additional income, the households also raise livestock, pigs and ducks.

Pictured above are the CBO members  of Ah Kei Gyi  Village Group 2, named Daw Tin, U Aung, Daw Tin A, Daw Ei and  Daw Nwe. Included in the picture, Daw Tin (second from left) is 40 years old and married with four  children who are students. She does the both household chores and looks after the livestock, whereas her husband farms in their five acres of crop farm. 

Proximity's loan will help Daw Tin  to purchase high quality feed for her ducks that will increase her income  from duck eggs sales.

loans.use: to repair their duck farms and purchase high quality feed

loans.name: Gagaifo

texts.en: Gagaifo is 51 years old and married with 4 children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. Gagaifo needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, gloves, a tiller, a pitch fork, seeds and a new wheelbarrrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2015. Gagaifo will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, gloves, a tiller, a pitch fork, seeds and a new wheelbarrrow.

loans.name: Kyar Ga Yat Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Kyar Ga Yat Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region and consists of 21 village customers overseen by five CBO (Community Based Organisation) members.  This loan will help some group members to purchase high-quality feed (costing $30 a week for 100 ducks).  This will help group members raise their income from selling more duck eggs. Other members will use the funds to purchase both ducks and ducklings, also boosting income. 
In addition to ducks, many villagers from Kyar Ga Yat Village are farmers, planting rice and seasonal vegetables and fruits. Many Kyar Ga Yat villagers also raise pigs, chickens, and water buffalo. Pigs are mainly a source of savings, water buffalo are used to cultivate the land, while chickens are used for income generation, similar to ducks.
Pictured above are the CBO members from Kyar Ga Yat Village, known as U Khin, U Than, Daw Yee, Daw Win and U Thant. U Khin (first from left) is 44 years old and married.  He and his wife raise 150 ducks and farm their small crop farm. They have five children, four in school. The eldest child helps on the farm. Proximity's loan will help U Khin purchase high-quality feed that will boost his income by lowering mortality rate, increasing production of duck eggs, and increasing the selling price of full-grown duck.  
This income boost will be put to many uses, one being helping to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: To help Kyar Ga Yat Village customers purchase ducks and high-quality feed

loans.name: Tha Pyae Kan Village Group

texts.en:
This Tha Pyae Kan Village community is located in Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. The group is composed of five CBO (Community Based Organization) members overseeing 20 village customers. This loan will help group members purchase ducks and high-quality feed (costing $28 for six days feeding 100 ducks). These uses will boost villagers' income from selling more duck eggs. 
Hmaw Bi village has a population of over 440.  Besides duck raising, those villagers with arable land cultivate rice and plant seasonal vegetables and fruits such as bananas and coconuts. Villagers also raise pigs for additional income. Some households have a small grocery or dry food store that they operate out of their houses.
Pictured above are the CBO members from Tha Pyae Kan Village Group named Daw Tin, U Aung, U Win, U Myo and Daw Thandar. Included in the picture, Daw Tin (first from right) is 45 years old and married with nine children. Her husband runs their farm and sometimes goes fishing, selling his catch in the town market. Daw Tin takes care of the ducks and plants seasonal foods. Daw Tin will use Proximity loan to purchase high-quality feed for ducks that will boost income of Daw Tin's family.  Daw Tin plans to use part of the additional income to reinvest into their duck business and part for discretionary spending such as her children's education.

loans.use: To help Tha Pyae Kan Village Group purchase high-quality feed for both ducks and ducklings

loans.name: Kywe Chan Su Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located Kywe Chan Su Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 30 village customers.

This loan will help some group members purchase both ducks and ducklings. The remaining group members will use the funds to purchase high quality feed, costing $60 for a month of feed for 100 ducks. These uses will boost villager income from more duck eggs and more revenue from duck sales.

In addition to ducks, many Kywe Chan Su villagers raise pigs, chickens, and water buffalo. Pigs are mainly a source of savings, water buffalo are used to cultivate the land, and chickens are used in a similar way as ducks. Those with arable land cultivate rice paddies and plant seasonal vegetables and fruits such as bananas and coconuts.

Pictured above are CBO members from the Kywe Chan Su Village Group, named U Maung, U Win and U Ko. First from left in the photo, U Maung is 38 years old and married with two children. In addition to his ducks, U Maung farms his crop farm and has two pigs. His wife helps him with all work. Proximity's loan will help U Maung to purchase ducklings and high quality feed that will boost his income from more duck egg production.

loans.use: to purchase ducklings and high quality feed.

loans.name: 030206030003.thiệu Vận Group

texts.en:
Len is 55 years old and she is married with one child. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Len works in agriculture raising cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

In 2003, Len joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 030206030003.Thiệu Vận solidarity group, which consists of five members.

With her business profit, Len hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Hmaw Win Su Village Group

texts.en:
The Hmaw Win Su village community consists of over 1200 villagers and is located in Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy's Delta region. In this community, five CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 19 village customers. This loan will help some group members purchase higher quality feed such as dry prawns, as well as repairing duck farms. These usages will boost their income from more duck eggs.

Besides duck raising, many Hmaw Win Su Villagers are farmers who plant rice and seasonal fruits. As a second business, villagers sometimes go fishing and sell their catches to nearby villages. As a source of savings, some households also raise pigs.  
Pictured above are CBO members from Hmaw Win Su group named U Win, U Kyi, U Thant, U Myo and Daw Shwe. U Win (first from left) is 67 years old and married with one child, a primary student. In addition to their duck farm, U Win's family has a 2-acre crop farm where it growns bananas, coconuts and guavas. Like other fellow members, U Win family will use Proximity's loan to purchase high-quality feed and repair their duck farm. The high-quality feed will increase duck production and raise the selling price of full-grown ducks.  This will be a critical boost to U Win's family income to help support expenditures such as their child's education.

loans.use: To help the Hmaw Win Su Village purchase high-quality feed and repair duck farms

loans.name: Taunese

texts.en:
Taunese is a 41-year-old woman with seven children. She operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living.

Taunese has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei design, containers, and a printing machine to assist her run the business. She has been doing this for more than 3 years. Taunese hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei design, containers, and a printing machine.

loans.name: Nhóm 36- Thôn  Văn Bắc Đông Văn Group

texts.en:
Bình is 46 years old and he is married with two children.

Bình works in agriculture raising poultry. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Bình faces in his business is the lack of capital. He is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2015, Bình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve his business. He has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Bình is the group leader of the Nhóm 36- Thôn Văn Bắc Đông Văn solidarity group, which consists of six members.

With his business profit, Bình hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business, and for his business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Tania

texts.en:
Tania is a 32-year-old mother with three children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living.

Tania has requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage, and plastic bags to assist her in running her business.
