Tania has run her business for more than a year. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and box of sausage.

loans.name: Suia

texts.en:
Suia is a 46-year-old mother with five children. She runs a small business of selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years.

Suia has requested a loan to buy taro roots, banana tubers, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves to help her run her business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs.

Suia became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tubers, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves.

loans.name: 030207040003.thiệu Vận Group

texts.en:
Hồng is 24 years old and she is married with one child. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Hồng works in agriculture raising cattle. She has been involved in this business for two years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hồng is the group leader of the 030207040003.Thiệu Vận solidarity group, which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr: A 57 ans, Dopé est une femme veuve et avec son enfant elle vit dans le quartier de Bè à Lomé. Dopé est une marchande de charbons de bois et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois dans le village de Noussogblé. Elle réalise une très bonne rentabilité avec son activité génératrice de revenu. Dopé nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois pour gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de son enfant.
texts.en:
Dopé, age 57, is a widowed mother of one who lives with her child in the district of Bè, in Lomé. She is a reseller of charcoal; she restocks twice a month in the village of Noussogblé. Her income-generating activity is very profitable. 

Dopé is seeking this loan to stock up on sacks of charcoal. This will help to bolster her profits and to support her child’s academic education.

loans.use: to buy 7 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: 030205040003.thiệu Vận Group

texts.en:
Hòa is 27 years old and she is married with one child. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Hòa works in agriculture raising cattle. Hòa has been involved in this business for two years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

This is Hòa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hòa is the group leader of the 030205040003.Thiệu Vận solidarity group, which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Hòa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 030208090002.thiệu Vận Group

texts.en:
Lan is 41 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Lan works in agriculture raising livestock. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

In 2008, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lan is the group leader of the 030208090002.Thiệu Vận solidarity group, which consists of five members.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Fetalaiga

texts.en:
Fetalaiga is 52 years old and single with one child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Fetalaiga needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a spade, a machete, chemicals, new boots, and a crowbar. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Fetalaiga will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a spade, a machete, chemicals, new boots, and a crowbar.

loans.name: Kyon Paing Village

texts.en:
This community is located in Kyon Paing Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region and consists of twenty-four village customers, of which six are CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members helping lead the loan program in the area.

This loan will help group members to purchase high-quality feed (costing $80 for an amount to feed 100 ducks) that will boost their income from more ducks’ eggs. Kyon Paing Village consists of many farmers planting rice and seasonal fruits or vegetables. For additional income, they raise ducks and pigs as a source of savings.

Pictured above are CBO members from Kyon Paing Village. They are named Daw Aye, U Pyone, U Tin, and U Zaw.

Included in the picture, Daw Aye (second from right), is 46 years old and married with two daughters. She is a housewife and also helps her husband on their farm of six acres. They also plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and bananas and have over 120 ducks. Proximity's loan will help Daw Aye to purchase high-quality feed and imports for the duck farm.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality duck feed and materials for the duck farm.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañado y su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene tres hijos que están estudiando. 

José, es agricultor desde que estaba bajo dominio de sus padres, para generar ingresos para su familia, el lugar donde tiene su cultivo está a treinta minutos de su casa y lo hace de 8:00 de la mañana a 12:00 del mediodía.

José, utilizará el préstamo para reparar el techo de su casa.

Los sueños de José son, mejorar la casa para tener un lugar más seguro para su esposa y sus hijos, así poder brindarles lo necesario para que se superen.
texts.en: Jose is 35 years old. He studied up to second grade. He has a domestic partner and she works doing household chores. He has three children who are in school. Jose has been a farmer since he was with his parents. The place where he has his crops is located thirty minutes from his house. He works in his daily chores from 8:00 in the morning to 12:00 noon. Jose will use the loan to repair the roof of his house. Jose's dreams are to improve the house so he can have a safer place for his wife and children, and be able to offer what is needed for them to move ahead.

loans.use: to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: 030404030002.thiệu Phúc Group

texts.en:
Nga is 20 years old and she is married with one child. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Nga works in agriculture raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for two years. The main hardship that Nga faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

This is Nga's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nga is the group leader of the 030404030002.Thiệu Phúc solidarity group, which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Nga hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr: A 40 ans, Jeannette est une jeune célibataire et vit avec un enfant à Nyékonakpoè dans la ville de Lomé. Bien consciente de son état elle vend des pommes de terre en se promenant dans les quartiers. Elle se procure les marchandises  au marché de Lomé quatre fois par mois et en tire assez de profits. Jeannette désire ce crédit pour acheter des pommes de terre afin de couvrir ses charges quotidiennes et améliorer son niveau de vie.
texts.en: At 40 years old, Jeannette is a young, single woman and lives with a child in Nyékonakpoè in the city of Lomé. Very aware of her circumstances, she sells potatoes while walking through neighborhoods. She obtains the merchandise in the Lomé market four times per month and makes some profit from it. Jeannette wants this loan to buy potatoes in order to cover her daily expenses and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy six cartons of potatoes.

loans.name: Amis De Developpement De Thomonde (Adetho)

texts.en: Clonise is a leader in the community of Thomonde. She manages a rural organization there. with 20 years of experience behind her, she is used to help people through social activities. She actually works as a social worker. Thanks to her leadership, that organization has succeeded in various realizations, including the famous implementation of professional school and food processing workshop. They sell "Chanmchanm, Cremas, Liquour", squash candies, peanut butter, and jam. The loan will help them to buy peanuts and install a grinder machine in order to earn more income. As portrayed, Clonise is placed front left. Francoise is in the front right and Suzette is behind.

loans.use: To purchase 20 barrels of peanuts, one grinder machine and food processing raw materials

loans.name: Nhóm 16 Minh Hùng Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Hoàn is 39 years old and she is married with three children.

Hoàn works in agriculture raising pigs. She has been involved in this business for two years. The main hardship that Hoàn faces in her business is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

This is Hoàn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the leader of a four-member group, the Nhóm 16 Minh Hùng Minh lộc solidarity group.

With her business profit, Hoàn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Yae Pu Wa (Yae) Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Yae Pu Wa Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, five CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of twenty-six village customers. This loan will help purchase high-quality feed for both ducks and ducklings, costing $20 for five days of feeding one hundred ducks. This usage will boost the group members' income from more ducks’ eggs.

Besides ducks, many Yae Pu Wa villagers also raise pigs, chickens, and water buffalo. Pigs are mainly a source of savings, water buffalo are used to cultivate the land, while chickens are used in a similar way as ducks. The villagers mainly focus on farming, planting rice, as well as seasonal vegetables and fruits such as bananas and coconuts.

Pictured above are the CBO members from Yae Pu Wa Village Group. They are named U Zaw, U Zin, U Win, U Min, and U Myint.

U Zaw (first from left, sitting) is thirty-seven years old and married with three children who are students. He farms on his three-acre crop farm and also takes care of 3,300 betel trees. On the other hand, U Zaw's wife looks after the livestock, pigs, ducks and chickens. The Proximity loan will help U Zaw to purchase high-quality feed for both ducks and ducklings.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality feed for both ducks and ducklings.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une femme mariée de 44 ans et mère de quatre enfants qui vivent ensemble à Wonyomé. Etant une femme très entreprenante elle est une  revendeuse de biscuits et gagne un peu de bénéfice pour soutenir les charges de sa famille. Elle s’approvisionne une fois par semaine au grand  marché de Lomé. C’est dans le besoin de commander des cartons de biscuits qu’Abla sollicite ce microcrédit et avoir une rentabilité assez considérable.
texts.en: Abla is a married woman, 44 years old and a mother of four children who live together in Wonyomé. Being a a very resourceful woman, she resells cookies and makes a small profit to support her family responsibilities. She gets her stock once a week from the large market in Lomé. Abla is requesting this loan because she needs to order boxes of cookies as well as to make a rather considerable profit.

loans.use: to buy 30 packages of cookies

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr: Amah est une jeune femme célibataire et âgée de 35 ans qui vit à Gblinkomégan. Elle est une jeune qui subvient personnellement à ses besoins et vend du riz préparé pour avoir le revenu nécessaire. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé deux fois par mois. Amah nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de riz afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses  clients et tirer une rentabilité pour sa survie.
texts.en: Amah is a young, single woman who is 35 years old and lives in Gblinkomégan. She is a young person who provides for her needs and she sells prepared rice in order to make the necessary earnings. She gets her supplies from the large market in Lomé twice a month. Amah needs this loan to buy bags of rice in order to respond favorably to her customers' needs and to make an earning for her own survival.

loans.use: to buy 6 bags of rice

loans.name: Nhóm 09 Minh Hùng Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Ngàn is 52 years old and she is married with two children.

Ngàn works in agriculture raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for eight years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Ngàn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Ngàn is the group leader of the Nhóm 09 Minh Hùng Minh Lộc solidarity group, which consists of four members.

With her business profit, Ngàn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing machines to continue working and help her family

loans.name: Ofa

texts.en: Ofa is a 41-year-old married mother of 10 children. She has a small billiards business. She has four years' experience in this business. Ofa needs a loan to buy a new pool table, new cues, chalk and a new rack. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Ofa joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new pool table, new cues, chalk and a new rack.

loans.name: Sei

texts.en: Sei is a 33-year-old mother of three children. She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Sei has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, and a frying pan to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profits to build a small bakery store in the near future. Sei joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon and a frying pan

loans.name: Manu

texts.en: Manu is a 35 year-old-widow with 4 children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 2 years. Manu has requested a loan to buy paint, a cutter, stencils, wooden carved designs, material, gloves and a pair of scissors. She plans to use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paint, a cutter, stencils, wooden carved designs, material, gloves and a pair of scissors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a corrugated metal sheets, wood, iron, etc. to repair the conditions of her house.

loans.name: Nhóm 41 Minh Hợp Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Hiền has a retail business selling dry tea and pipe tobacco. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry tea and pipe tobacco to resell.

Hiền is 31 years old and is married with three children.
She is the leader of a three-member group, the Nhóm 41 Minh Hợp Minh Lộc solidarity group. 

In 2008, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hiền has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hiền has been involved in her business for eight years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more dry tea and pipe tobacco to resell

loans.name: 020202100001 Thôn 8 _ Hoằng Đông Group

texts.en:
Liễu operates a food stall selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase more meat to resell.

Liễu is 51 years old and is married with three children..
She is the leader of a four-member group, the 020202100001 Thôn 8 _ Hoằng Đông solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Liễu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liễu has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Liễu has been involved in her business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Liễu faces in her business is a lack of capital.

In the future, Liễu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to resell

loans.name: Mercedes Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Dapreydi, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco  hijos, tres mayores de edad y dos de 17 y 12 años, la menor estudia en colegio y los mayores estudian en una universidad en Guayaquil. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Mercedes es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, sale dos o tres veces por semana a ofrecer sus productos y  también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Lleva más de 30 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo que le sirve para darles los estudios a sus hijos que es lo más importante para ella.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, entre otras prendas. Lleva 1 año en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Dapreydi credit group meets in Tosagua every fifteen days. This is a very dynamic area, with the majority of its inhabitants working in farming and raising animals, it being a region with rich vegetation.

Señora Mercedes lives here. She is 53 years old and married. From this relationship she has five children, three grown and two 17 and 12 years old. The youngest is in school, and the older ones study at a university in Guayaquil. Her husband is a farmer.

Doña Mercedes is a woman who likes to work in order to help her husband with the household expenses. She sells clothing of all kinds, door to door. 
She goes out two or three times a week to offer her merchandise. She also sells from her home, where her customers come when they need a particular garment. 

She sells her goods on credit and collects every eight days. For over thirty years she has been working at this, to earn something to contribute to educating her children, which is what matters most to her.

This is a loan to buy pants, shirts, and blouses, along with other garments. She has been with the credit group for a year, and she likes it because the loans are fast. Her dream is that her children will be professionals.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses and other garments.

loans.name: 01 Thôn Bùi Tiến Lộc Group

texts.en:
Lý has a manufacturing business making iron furniture. She is requesting a loan to purchase more metal to make furniture to sell.

Lý is 44 years old and is married with two children.
Lý is the group leader of the01 Thôn Bùi Tiến Lộc solidarity group, which consists of seven members. 

This is Lý's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Lý has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lý hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more metal to make iron furniture to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 4 Thôn 4 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Hà is 31 years old and she is married with two children. She lives with two dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Hà works in agriculture raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hà faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

This is Hà's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hà is the group leader of the Nhóm 4 Thôn 4 Quảng Lưu solidarity group, which consists of five members.

With her business profit, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
Rufino, utilizo el crédito anterior para cubrirlos costos de la elaboración de silos, lo cual le permitió obtener alimento para su ganado, los resultados son positivos ya que el ganado está saludable y también tiene un negocio más productivo. Continua soltero pero con un mejor estilo de vida.
En época de verano necesita de un nuevo crédito para invertir en concentrados para alimentar el ganado y pagara maquinaria para realizar trabajaos en sus cultivos de granos básicos, pretende seguir mejorando su negocio y mantener su buena calificación crediticia.
texts.en:
Rufino used his last loan to cover the costs of making silos to store his cattle feed.  The results were positive, because his cattle are healthy and he also has a more productive business.  He is still single, but now has a better standard of living.  

This summer he needs a new loan to invest in cattle feed for his livestock, and also to pay for equipment to use in his business growing basic grains.  He plans to continue to improve his business and maintain his good credit rating.

loans.use: to invest in cattle feed for his livestock, and also to pay for equipment to use in his business growing basic grains

loans.name: Juana Jessenia

texts.es: Juana Jessenia: Es una mujer alegre, tiene 31 años de edad, casada. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, realizando actividades notariales. Desde hace 2 años estableció su pequeño negocio de venta de productos plásticos y ropa nueva en un tramo en uno de los mercados de Bilwi, generando sus propios ingresos con lo cual aporta económicamente en el hogar. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua más mercadería para ofertar en su negocio: panas, baldes, trastes, platos, vasos, sillas y mesas plásticas, ropa interior, artículos y ropas para bebes, entre otros productos y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos y vender sus productos a precios accesibles a su clientela. Ella sueña con llegar a ser una negociante exitosa, con un negocio grande, próspero y tener una casa bonita.
texts.en:
Juana Jessenia is a happy woman, 31 years old and married. Her husband works informally, doing notary work. Two years ago she set up her little business of selling plastic products and new clothing in a section of a market in Bilwi, generating her own income, with which she contributes economically to the household.

She is applying for financing to purchase more merchandise in Managua to offer in her business, such as basins, bowls, dishes, plates, glasses, plastic tables and chairs, underwear, and items and clothing for babies, among other products, and in this way increase her income and sell her products to her customers at affordable prices.

She dreams of becoming a successful businessperson with a big, prosperous business and having a pretty house.

loans.use: to buy plastic articles and products for domestic use in Managua

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Adzo est une femme mariée de 62 ans et mère de sept enfants à sa charge. Adzo vit à Gbinkomégan et est une commerçante d’arachides embouteillées qu’elle distribue à la commande de ses clients. Elle s’approvisionne au marché d’Adidogomé deux fois par mois et trouve un bon profit. Adzo demande ce prêt pour acheter des sacs d’arachides afin de combler aux  attentes de ses clients et trouver le gain nécessaire pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en: Adzo is a 62 year old married woman and mother to seven children in her care. Adzo lives in Gbinkomégan and sells bottled peanuts that she distributes by order to her clients. She gets her supplies at the Adidogomé market two times per month and makes a good profit. Adzo is asking for this loan to buy sacks of peanuts in order to fulfill the expectations of her clients and to earn enough profit to support her husband in the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 21 bowls of peanuts.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.es: Lázaro: Es un señor agricultor,  amable, de la comunidad Columbus; que se ubica a 95 kilómetros de Puerto Cabezas, equivalente a tres horas. Tiene 71 años de edad, casado con 4 hijos: Un mayor de edad y tres adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Su esposa es comerciante, tiene una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda. Él se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, que comercializa y puede aportar económicamente en el hogar. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar cerdos lechones, para engordarlos y comercializarlos y sembrar maíz y frijoles. Su sueño es tener una finca diversificada y con mayores rendimientos productivos.
texts.en:
Lázaro is a kind farming man, from the community of Columbus, which is 95 kilometers (about 3 hours) away from Puerto Cabezas. He is 71 years old and is married with 4 children: one adult and three adolescents who are in primary and secondary school.

His wife is a shopkeeper, who has a small grocery store in the side veranda of their house. He makes his living raising pigs, which he sells to be able to economically contribute to the household.

He is requesting a loan to buy piglets to fatten and sell, and to sow corn and beans. His dream is to have a diversified farm and more productive yields.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una señora muy amable, ella tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de aproximadamente entre 4 a 21 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá. 

Margarita es una mujer que lucha cada día buscando nuevas opciones para la generación de sus ingresos, ella es profesora en una escuela de su comunidad, pues desde pequeña siempre anhelo ser maestra, pues con el apoyo de sus padres logro hacer realidad su sueño. Le gusta su trabajo porque se siente útil a la comunidad, porque forma parte de la formación de un niño. Con esta actividad genera su economía para que sus hijos tengan lo básico. 

Pues Margarita hace cuatro años  con mucho esfuerzo logro comprar un micro bus que ahora trabaja para transportar personas de un lugar a otro, con el uso que se le ha dado, pues ahora necesita reparar algunas piezas,  pero Margarita no cuenta con dinero para hacerlo, pues para solventar esta necesitad, ella está buscando un prestamo de diez mil quetzales, para realizar los trabajos necesarios  y de esa manera seguirá circulando para generar sus ingresos. 
El prestamo lo pagaría margarita con los ingresos que genera el  micro bus y el anhelo de ella es  que más adelante pueda comprarse otro bus.
texts.en:
Margarita is a very friendly woman. She is 49 years old. She is married, and she has 6 children between the approximate ages of 4 and 21. This family lives in a community of Sololá.

Margarita is a woman who works hard every day seeking options for generating her income. She is a teacher in a school in her community, because since she was a little girl, she always dreamed of being a teacher, and with the support of her parents, she managed to make her dream a reality. She likes her work because she feels useful to the community, because she forms part of the training of a child. With this work she generates her income so that her children have the basics.

Four years ago, with much effort, Margarita managed to buy a micro bus that now works to transport people from one place to another. With the use that she has given it, she now needs to repair some parts, but she doesn't have the money to do it. So to pay for this necessity, she is seeking a loan of ten thousand quetzales to do the necessary work. In this way it will continue circulating to generate her income.

Margarita will pay back the loan with the income that the micro bus generates, and her dream is that in the future she can buy another bus.

loans.use: to buy parts for her bus.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia is 49 years old, is unmarried and wants to strengthen her economy to support her family's success. With that in mind, she opened her own shoes store, where she is in charge of the sales along with a close friend. She dreams to grow her business to one day become an important shoe store in Mexico. Cowboy boots, flats, heels and the most comfortable slippers, Leticia is innovative in the diversity of her products. She is a woman entrepreneur and when she is not in her business, she likes to exercise or to read a new book. Leticia would like a loan of MXN5,000  to improve their products and to expand their catalogue. This is Leticia's first loan with Konfío and she considers herself a very responsible person when managing credits.

loans.use: to increase stock in her shoe store to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr: Agée de 35 ans Denise est une femme mariée et vit à Wonyomé avec son mari et ses deux enfants. Denise vend des friperies pour ainsi contribuer à la vie sociale de sa famille. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Hédzranawoé deux fois par mois. Pour avoir plus de gains, Denise désire ce prêt pour acheter des pantalons, des torchons et des tapis de plus grandes quantités pour vendre et ainsi couvrir les charges quotidiennes et favoriser la scolarité de ses enfants grâce au bénéfice qu’elle trouvera.
texts.en: Aged 35, Denise is a married woman and lives in Wonyomé with her husband and their two children. Denise sells used clothing in order to contribute to her family's social living. She gets her stock from the market in Hédzranawoé twice a month. To make a larger profit, Denise will use this loan to purchase pants, kitchen cloths and rugs in larger quantities in order to sell them.  It will also help her cover daily expenses and support her children's schooling, thanks to the profits that she will earn.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of pants, 10 dozen kitchen cloths and 12 dozen rugs.

loans.name: Déboéyéna

texts.fr: Déboéyéna est une femme mariée de 32 ans et vit à Wonyomé. Mère de deux enfants elle est dynamique et très entreprenante. Déboéyéna est une revendeuse de charbons de bois à son domicile et trouve considérablement une bonne rentabilité dans son activité. Elle s’approvisionne trois fois par mois auprès des détaillants du quartier. C’est pour acheter des charbons de bois pour alimenter son magasin que Déboéyéna demande ce prêt afin d’avoir un profit et soutenir les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Déboéyéna is a married, 32 year old woman and lives in Wonyomé. A mother of two children, she is dynamic and very resourceful. Déboéyéna resells charcoal from her home and makes a considerably good profit from her business. She gets her stock three times a month from the neighborhood retailer. Déboéyéna is requesting this loan to buy charcoal to supply her store, in order to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy 7 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Jeny Alexandra

texts.es:
Ella es Jeny una mujer soltera e independiente la cual forjo un negocio de venta de cereal, bebidas, café, Leche, que vende al por mayor y en unidades.
Su proyección para el negocio no es solo quedarse con lo que tiene, busca generar empleo, abrir nuevos locales, tener un mini mercado y trabaja para ganar clientes fieles,  empresas que le compren constantemente. 
Como es ingeniosa, quiere solicitar un crédito la razón es comprar mercancía nueva para ofrecer un portafolio de servicios más amplio, y buscar ser la proveedora de tiendas, y mini mercados y como es una apuesta ambiciosa necesita capital para tener las existencias disponibles. 
Por tal razón Jeny solicita tu ayuda, para transformar su negocio en algo genial.
texts.en:
This is Jeny, a single, independent woman who has forged a business selling cereal, drinks, coffee, and milk.  She sells in bulk and also by the individual unit.

Her plan for the business isn’t just to stay content with what she has, but rather to seek to generate jobs, open new outlets, have a mini-market, and work to gain loyal customers—businesses who always buy from her.

Being a smart lady, she wants to ask for a loan to buy new merchandise in order to offer a wider range of products.  She is looking to be a supplier to small store and mini-markets.  As this is an ambitious undertaking, she needs capital in order to maintain her stock of supplies.  So, Jeny is asking for your help in order to transform her business into something amazing.

loans.use: to stock her store with cereal, coffee, and drinks

loans.name: Yae Kyaw (Yae) Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located Yae Kyaw Village, Myanmar, Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, five CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 25 village customers. This loan will help some group members purchase both ducks and ducklings. The remaining group members will use the funds to purchase high-quality feed, costing USD 20, for five days of feed for 100 ducks. Additional ducks from more duck eggs will boost their income. 

Besides ducks, many Yae Kyaw villagers raise pigs, chickens, and water buffaloes. Pigs are mainly a source of savings, water buffaloes are used to cultivate the land, while chickens are used in a similar way as ducks. The villagers mainly focus on farming and, on the other hand, they also plant seasonal vegetables and fruits, such as bananas and coconuts.

Pictured above are CBO members from the Yae Kyaw (Yae) Village Group, named Daw Tin, U Kyaw, U Aung and U Thu. 

Daw Tin (second from the right in the photo) is 41 years old and married, with three children, all students. Her husband farms a small family farm and he fishes. Daw Tin looks after the livestock of ducks and pigs. 

Proximity Designs' loan will enable Daw Tin to purchase high-quality feed for ducks that will give a critical boost to the family's income, so they can pay for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase ducklings as well as high-quality feed.

loans.name: Nancy Olivia

texts.es: Nancy is a 29 year old entrepreneur. She is always trying to find a way to support her family by small actions that provide her additional income. She dreams to be part of the fashion world and that's why, in addition to her job as a financial advisor, she decided to start a business in which she buys shoes to resell. After a long time, her efforts have begun to bring her real results and now she has many clients, but she can't always provide the specific products they ask for because she doesn't have funds readily available. Nancy tries to find the way to organize her day in the way that she can always have time to read, to be with her friends but the most important part of her day is to see the smile of one of her clients. She is asking for a loan of MXN7,000 to improve and expand her catalogue of shoes. This is Nancy's first loan with Konfío and considers herself very responsible person when managing credits.

loans.use: to buy shoes in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Grupo Arroyo Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad del estado de Oaxaca, se conformó un grupo de personas con la intención de solicitar un crédito para mejorar sus negocios. El “Grupo Arroyo” está conformado por las siguientes personas: 

Gabriela - Cosméticos 
José, María -Refrescos 
Reyna, Delfina, Marcela -Antojitos 
Victoria -Refrescos Y Dulces 
Juana - Abarrotes 
Irma -Oro Laminado 
Inés – Carpintería

Doña Inés es una señora muy atenta, amable, carismática, todos le conocen como “Juanita” por el gran parecido que tiene con su madre,  doña Inés ha tabajado desde hace 20 años junto con su esposo en la carpintería que tienen, ofreciendo un servicio de calidad y costos accesibles además de cumplir con cada uno de los requerimientos de sus clientes. Las ganancias de la carpintería les han permitido ofrecer a su familia una calidad de vida confortable, tienen 4 hijos uno de ellos es mayor de edad y les apoya en la carpintería los otros tres asisten a la escuela de la comunidad. Además, uno de sus hijos es patrocinado por los programas de World Vision, empresa socia de VisionFund. 

Cada uno de los préstamos otorgados a doña Inés le han permitido invertir en la compra de herramienta diferente para continuar con su carpintería la cual está debajo de un techo y no cuenta con paredes ella argumenta que es por salud, para no respirar el polvo de la madera ni el aroma penetrante del barniz o resina que aplican a los muebles. Esta vez ha solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar dos discos para su cortadora y brochas nuevas para la aplicación del pegamento, barniz y resina.

“Es satisfactorio ver que trabajamos como un gran equipo ahora que mi hijo se ha unido a nosotros, apoyándonos en la carpintería”.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la carpintería donde doña Inés disfruta trabajar. Todos los niños presentes son patrocinados por el World Vision.
texts.en:
In a community in the state of Oaxaca, a group of people formed “Grupo Arroyo” in order to request a loan to improve their businesses.  Grupo Arroyo is composed of the following people:

Gabriela—Cosmetics
José and María—Soft drinks 
Reyna, Delfina, and Marcela—Traditional snacks
Victoria—Soft drinks and sweets
Juana—Groceries
Irma—Gold plating
Inés—Woodworking

Doña Inés is a very thoughtful, friendly, and charismatic lady.  Everyone knows her as “Juanita” because of how strongly she resembles her mother.  Doña Inés has been working with her husband in their woodworking shop for 20 years.  They provide quality service and affordable prices, in addition to fulfilling every one of their customers’ requirements. The earnings from the woodworking shop have allowed them to provide their family with a comfortable life. They have four children; one is grown and helps them in the shop, and the other three attend the community school.  Additionally, one of their children is sponsored by World Vision, a partner company of VisionFund.

Each loan granted to Doña Inés has allowed her to invest in the purchase of different tools in order to continue with her woodworking shop. It has a roof but no walls. This is for health reasons she says, so as not to breathe in the wood dust, or the penetrating aroma of the varnish and resin that they apply to the furniture. This time she has requested a new loan to purchase two disc blades for her woodcutting machine, and new brushes for the application of glue, varnish, and resin.

"It's satisfying to see that we work as a great team, now that my son has joined us, helping us in the woodworking shop", she says.

The photograph was taken in the woodworking shop where Doña Inés enjoys working.  All of the children present are sponsored by World Vision.

loans.use: to purchase two disc blades for the woodcutting machine, and new brushes for applying glue, varnish, and resin.

location.town: ARROYO DE ENMDEDIO ACATLAN DE PEREZ FIGUEROA

loans.name: Mepa

texts.en:
Mepa is a 50 year old mother with 7 children. She owns and operates a small business, selling BBQ in her community to earn a living.

Mepa has requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausages, bottles of mushroom soy sauce, sacks of onions, plates, tomato sauce, aluminum foil, etc to help her run the business.

She has been in this business for more than a year and she hopes to build a small restaurant in the near future using her business profit.

Mepa became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausages, bottles of mushroom soy sauce, sacks of onions, plates, tomato sauce, aluminum foil, etc.

loans.name: Leilani

texts.en:
Leilani is a 30 year old married woman with 4 children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business.

Leilani needs a loan to buy donuts, a new boiler, a coffee jar, bags of sugar, sandwiches, soft drinks and noodles. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

Leilani has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy donuts, a new boiler, a coffee jar, bags of sugar, sandwiches, soft drinks and noodles.

loans.name: Karolina

texts.es:
Instruir y enseñar es algo admirable y honroso. Karolina es una mujer carismática y solidaria quien desde hace 13 años trabaja como maestra de educación primaria. Ella decidió estudiar esta profesión debido a que le gusta aprender y porque observó que en su comunidad las personas tenían muchas dificultades de ortografía. 

Karolina solicita el crédito para poder pagar su título universitario y de esta forma poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos y optar por una maestría. Las metas y planes de esta esforzada mujer son mejorar su casa y seguir estudiando para obtener una maestría. Ser maestra le es satisfactorio puesto que le ha ayudado a superar sus dificultades y corregir y dar una respuesta a las interrogantes a los demás.
texts.en:
To instruct and to teach is something admirable and honnorable. Karolina is a charismatic and caring woman who has worked as a primary school teacher for 13 years. She decided to study for this profession because she loves to learn and she observed that, in her community, many people have difficulty with writing. 

Karolina asks for this loan to be able to pay for her university tuition, and thus be able to improve her economic income and to strive for a master's degree. This hardworking woman's goals and plans are to improve her home and to continue studying for her master's degree. Becoming a teacher satisfies Karolina, because it helps her to overcome her troubles and to correct and answer others' questions.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: La Nueva Unión Los Lobos Group

texts.es:
El grupo "La Nueva Unión Los Lobos" está integrado por siete personas muy amables y trabajadoras; ellos pertenecen a una comunidad donde la mayor producción es la papa. 

Los integrantes escucharon hablar de VisionFund México por sus vecinos y aunque algunos de ellos aún no tienen un negocio, están entusiasmados por esta nueva oportunidad. María invertirá en una tienda de abarrotes, Susana, Carolina, Claudia, María Angélica y Adelina inventirán en borregos.

Doña Rosa es la representante del grupo, es una persona trabajadora y muy amable. Ella tiene 52 años de edad, está casada con el señor Josá Manuel quien trabaja en el campo y tiene siete hijos de los cuales ya solo cuatro dependen de la pareja, tres de ellos aun se encuentran estudiando.

Hace 11 años, Rosa años decidió iniciar con la cría y engorda de borregos para ayudar con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos. Todos los días, desde muy temprano se levanta a atender a su familia para después dedicarse a sus animales. Afortunadamente, hace 5 años, Rosa contó con el apoyo para instalar un invernadero grande en su propia casa donde cutiva jitomate, lechuga, brocoli, cebolla, etc. La apoyaron económicamente con el material y capacitaciones. Actualmente necesita un préstamo para comprar más semillas y hule para su invernadero además de algunos borregos.  

"Estoy muy contenta y agradecida con VisionFund México por la oportunidad de tener un préstamo, estoy segura que será de gran ayuda para hacer crecer mis negocios pero sobretodo mejorar la calidad de vida de mi familia". Esta es la primera vez que Rosa solicita un préstamo, nunca antes había accedido al servicio pero ahora está muy emocionada porque sabe que representa un poco de capital extra para invertir y sobre todo la confianza que han depositado en ella. Rosa está segura de que su invernadero le dará muchas satisfacciones y que podrá hacer realidad su sueño de dar a sus hijos estudios profesionales.

*La fotografia fue tomada en el municipio, la señora Rosa viste una playera roja*
texts.en:
La Nueva Unión Los Lobos Group is made up of seven very friendly and hardworking people from a community where the biggest crop is potatoes.  The members heard about VisionFund Mexico from their neighbors and, although some of them don't yet have a business, they're excited for this new opportunity.  María will invest in a grocery store and Susana, Carolina, Claudia, María Angelica, and Adelina will invest in sheep.

Rosa, the group representative, is a hardworking and very friendly person.  She's 52 years old and married to José Manuel, who works in the fields.  She has seven children, only four of whom are dependent on the couple; three of them are are still in school.

Rosa decided 11 years ago to start raising and fattening sheep to help with the household expenses and the children's education.  Every day she gets up very early to provide for her family and, then, take care of her animals.  Fortunately, five years ago Rosa had help installing a large greenhouse in her own home where she grows tomatoes, lettuce, broccoli, onion, etc.  She received financial support for materials and training.

Currently she needs a loan to buy more seeds and reeds for her greenhouse, as well as some sheep.

"I'm very happy with VisionFund Mexico, and grateful to them for the opportunity to get a loan.  I'm sure it's going to be a big help in growing my businesses, but especially in improving my family's quality of life."  This is the first time Rosa's requesting a loan.  She never took advantage of the service before, but now she's very excited because she knows it represents a bit of extra capital to invest and, above all, the trust they have placed in her.

Rosa's sure that her greenhouse will give her a lot of satisfaction and she'll realize her dream of giving her children a professional education.

The photograph was taken in town; Rosa's wearing a red shirt.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and oilcloth for her greenhouse, as well as a few sheep

location.town: Los Lobos, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Sal Ma Village Group

texts.en:
Located in the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region, Sal Ma Village has a population of over 800. In this community, five CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of thirty one village customers (20 Males, 11 Females). The group members will use the loans to purchase more ducks and high quality feed. This feed will improve duck nourishment, improving duck egg production to boost group members' incomes.

Pictured above are the CBO members from Sel Ma group, named U Min, U Tin, U Sein, U Lin and U Kyaw. U Min (Second from right) is 32 years old, has a small crop farm and 250 ducks. Currently, he sometimes has to go fishing to get by. During these trips, his wife is responsible for looking after their ducks. U Min's family will use Proximity's loan to purchase more ducks and high quality feed. Higher quality feed and more ducks will mean more duck egg production and sales from full-grown ducks, boosting U Min's family income.

loans.use: to purchase more ducks and high quality duck feed.

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr: Odette est une jeune célibataire de 26 ans et vit avec un enfant à Nyekonakpoè dans la ville de Lomé. Pour couvrir ses charges et faire face à ses besoins, Odette vend des articles scolaires et bureautiques dans une boutique de Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois dans un magasin d’articles au grand marché de Lomé. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Odette nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des papiers pour alimenter sa librairie et subvenir à ses besoins fondamentaux.
texts.en: Odette is a young, single, 26 year old woman and lives with her child in Nyekonakpoè in the town of Lomé. In order to cover her costs and cope with her needs, Odette sells school and office supplies in a store in Lomé. She stocks up four times a month at a store at the large market in Lomé. To reach her goals, Odette needs a loan to purchase paper to supply her store and to provide for her basic needs.

loans.use: to buy 21 boxes of paper

loans.name: Guadalupe Chico Group

texts.es:
“Guadalupe Chico” está integrado por siete personas trabajadoras y amables. Viven en una comunidad muy tranquila donde se trabaja la tierra sembrando maíz, haba, frijol, calabaza y nopales. 

Don Samuel es un hombre extraordinario y muy trabajador, siempre al pendiente de su familia, tiene 45 años de edad, está casado con la señora Rosalba y tienen ocho hijos de los cuales ya solo cuatro dependen de ellos. 

Anteriormente, Samuel trabajaba en la Cuidad de México como empleado en una herrería donde aprendió todo lo que ahora pone en práctica en su establecimiento. Mientras trabajaba y adquiría experiencia, ahorró parte de sus ganancias para iniciar su propio negocio. "La necesidad y la falta de un empleo fijo fueron otros motivos por los cuales también inicié mi actividad". Samuel cuenta que cuando no había clientes en la herrería tampoco había sueldo para él. Además estar alejado tanto tiempo de su familia tampoco era algo que pudiera tolerar por tanto tiempo. Ahora, a pesar de no haber recibido ninguna capacitación formal, Samuel es uno de los mejores herreros de su comunidad. 

Cuando inició no contaba con un espacio apto para realizar su trabajo, ocupaba una parte de su casa, pero actualmente tiene un local estable y propio. Cuando tiene mucha carga de trabajo, uno de sus hijos le ayuda para cumplir con sus encargos. Otra dificultad de la actividad de Samuel es la escasez de herramientas más sofisticadas para hacer más puertas y ventanas. 

Esta es la primera vez que Samuel solicita un crédito a VisionFund México y lo ocupará para comprar material necesario para continuar su trabajo. “Nunca me ha gustado tener deudas pero creo que ayudara en la estabilidad de mi negocio, porque en estos momentos no cuento con dinero suficiente para comprar todo el material” comento Don Samuel. Uno de sus sueños es poder hacer crecer su negocio para mejorar su vivienda y seguir dando estudios a sus hijos.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son Carmen, Marcelina, Rosa, Maria Felix y Heriberto ellos invertirán es sus borregos y Rocío en zapatos.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el municipio, en las escaleras del quiosco. Don Samuel viste una chamarra color café*
texts.en:
"Guadalupe Chico" is made of seven hardworking and friendly people. They live in a very tranquil community where they work the land, sowing corn, fava beans, beans, pumpkins, and prickly pears.

Don Samuel is an extraordinary and hardworking man, always looking out for his family. He is 45 years old, married to Señora Rosalba, and has eight children, only four of whom depend on them.

Previously, Samuel worked in a smithy in Mexico City, where he learned everything that he now puts to practice in his own establishment. While he worked and acquired experience, he saved part of his income to start his own business. "The necessity and shortage of permanent employees were other motivations for why I started my business." Samuel says that while he had no clients in his smithy, he didn't have any salary for himself either. Additionally, being cut off from his family was not something he could tolerate for so much time. Today, despite not having received any sort of formal certification, Samuel is one of the best blacksmiths of his community.

When he started, he couldn't count on an appropriate space to begin his business and he worked out of a part of his house. But currently he has his own stable property. When he has a lot of work, one of his children helps him to fulfill his orders. Another difficulty with Samuel's business is the shortage of more sophisticated tools to make more doors and windows.

This is the first time that Samuel is asking for a loan from VisionFund México, and he will use it to buy the material he needs to continue his work. "I have never liked having debts but I believe that it will help me to establish my business, because right now I don't have sufficient funds to buy all the material," Don Samuel comments. One of his dreams is to be able to grow his business to improve his life and to continue giving education to his children.

The other members of the group are Carmen, Marcelina, Rosa, Maria Felix and Heriberto, who will invest in their sheep, and Rocío, who will invest in shoes. 

*The photograph was taken in the municipality, on the stairs of the kiosk. Don Samuel is wearing a coffee-colored jacket*

loans.use: to buy more materials for a blacksmith.

location.town: Guadalupe Chico, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Fuatino

texts.en:
Fuatino is a 46 year old woman with 6 children. She owns and operates a small business selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Fuatino has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers and a printing machine to assist her in running the business.

Fuatino hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine.

loans.name: Fuailelagi

texts.en:
Fuailelagi is a 33 year old married woman with 5 children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business.

Fuailelagi needs a loan to buy a large chest freezer, foam cups, cordials, bags of sugar and Chinese candy. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

Fuailelagi has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy a large chest freezer, foam cups, cordials, bags of sugar and Chinese candy.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is a 65 year old widow with 4 children. She makes and sells Samoan fried chips in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business.

Telesia needs a loan to buy a large pot, cooking oil, bananas, taro, a strainer, a gas oven and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to help with her family's weekly expenses.

Telesia has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy a large pot, cooking oil, bananas, taro, a strainer, a gas oven and plastic bags

loans.name: Nadou

texts.fr: Etant une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants, Nadou âgée de 29 ans vit à Wonyomé dans la ville de Lomé. Nadou vend des chaussures pour homme et femme et se déplace à la demande de ses clients de quartier en quartier. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé trois fois par mois. Nadou veut acheter des chaussures de bonnes qualités et demande ce crédit pour le réaliser afin d’avoir une marge bénéficiaire considérable et couvrir ses  besoins quotidiens.
texts.en: A married woman and the mother of two, Nadou, aged 29, lives in Wonyomé, in the city of Lomé. She sells shoes for men and women, and she goes from district to district according to customer demand. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market of Lomé three time a month. Nadou wants to purchase good quality shoes and is asking for this loan to do so in order to have a significant profit margin and to cover her day-to-day needs.

loans.use: to purchase 3 dozen shoes

loans.name: Aninan

texts.fr: Aninan est une femme mariée qui vit à  Wonyomé et âgée de 28 ans. Elle a un enfant à sa charge et travaille ardemment pour son épanouissement. Aninan est une revendeuse de bouillie préparée à base du maïs à son domicile. Elle s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché d’Adidogomé pour acheter ses ingrédients de préparation. Aninan demande ce prêt pour acheter du sac de maïs afin d‘entretenir sa préparation et mieux satisfaire le goût de ses clients.
texts.en: Aninan, aged 28, is a married woman who lives in Wonyomé. She has one child to support and works ardently for her family to thrive. Aninan sells porridge made with cornmeal out of her home. She gets her supplies twice a month at the Adidogomé market to have the ingredients for making it. She is asking for this loan to purchase a sack of corn to keep making her product and to satisfy her customers’ tastes.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of corn

loans.name: Saumaleula

texts.en:
Saumaleula, a 30-year-old mother of one child, owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her village to earn a living. She has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, vegetable oil, a fry pan, wooden spoon, plastic bags and yeast to help her run the business. 

Saumaleula joined SPBD in 2014. She hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future from her profits.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, vegetable oil, a  fry pan, wooden spoon, plastic bags and yeast

loans.name: Tualagi

texts.en: Tualagi is a 34-year-old married woman with two children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Tualagi needs a loan to buy foam cups, a freezer, Chinese candy, rubber gloves, bags of sugar and cordials. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tualagi has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy foam cups, a freezer, Chinese candy, rubber gloves, bags of sugar and cordials

loans.name: Penetekoso

texts.en:
Penetekoso is a 29 year old married woman with one child. She makes and sells ice-cakes and pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business.

Penetekoso needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, Chinese candy, a cooler and rubber gloves. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

Penetekoso has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, Chinese candy, a cooler and rubber gloves.

loans.name: Laumata

texts.en:
Laumata is 41 years old with 6 children. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years.

Laumata has requested a loan to buy banana tubers, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, water tank, gloves, rake, shovel and chemicals to assist her to run the business.

She joined SPBD in 2010, and hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubers, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, water tank, gloves, rake, shovel and chemicals.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese is a 32 year old woman who is unmarried with 5 children. She runs a bingo business. She has 2 years with this business.

Akenese needs a loan to buy a bingo machine, a new set of balls, bingo bottles, bingo papers and a cash register machine. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

Akenese joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a bingo machine, a new set of balls, bingo bottles, bingo papers and a cash register machine.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera is a 21 year old married woman with 3 children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business.

Sera needs a loan to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

Sera has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more animals and the nutritious foods needed to fatten them.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Agée de 58 ans Ablavi est une femme mariée et  vit à Awatamé avec cinq enfants à sa charge. Consciente de sa situation et cherchant à améliorer son niveau de vie, elle vend des charbons de bois à son domicile. Ablavi s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché d’Asrama pour avoir ses marchandises à des prix avantageux. Ablavi sollicite ce crédit pour la commande des sacs de charbons qu’elle pourra vendre et avoir de bons profits pour aider son mari à scolariser leurs enfants.
texts.en: Ablavi, aged 58, is a married woman who lives in Awatamé with her five children that she supports. Conscious of her situation and seeking to improve her living conditions, she sells charcoal out of her home. Ablavi gets her supplies four times a month at the Asrama market to have merchandise at advantageous prices. She is requesting this loan for special orders of charcoal that she will be able to sell for a good profit, so as to help out her husband providing schooling for their children.

loans.use: to purchase 6 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Jose Nicolas

texts.es:
Jose Nicolas tiene 67 años de edad, es viudo, vive en casa propia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería .

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, realiza esta actividad desde hace 06 años contando con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes dan buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Solicita préstamo para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Jose Nicolas espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le va a generar mayores ingresos y por ende le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose Nicolas is 67 years old and is widowed. He lives in his own house in the rural area of the district Oyotún which is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru. Life in this district is quiet, and the inhabitants mainly work in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

Jose Nicolas makes a living providing transportation services in his motortaxi, and has been doing this activity for 6 years. He has experience in this business and regular customers who give him good personal and work references. He asks for this loan to make repairs and maintain his vehicle which is currently in disrepair. With this Jose Nicolas hopes to offer a better service to his clients which will generate a higher income and therefore will allow for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his vehicle since it is currently in disrepair.

loans.name: Seneuefa

texts.en:
Seneuefa is 66 years old and has six children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years.

Seneuefa has requested a loan to buy banana tube, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals, which she needs in order to run her business. She joined SPBD in 2011 and hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Leticia Annabel

texts.es:
EL sitio Pueblo Nuevo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Grupo De  Crédito Everest. Este es un lugar lleno de vegetación y paisajes hermosos, donde la gente en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, actividad con la cual salen adelante.
En este lugar vive la señora Leticia, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija de 4 años  de edad, la cual está en pre kinder. Su esposo es Ing. Civil y ejerce su profesión.
Doña Leticia es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado ganarse lo suyo para así ayudar a su marido a sacar adelante su hogar, ella  hace 2 año atrás y con la ayuda de uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo surtió en su casa  una pequeña tienda de víveres,  allí vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. Con la ayuda de los créditos ella ha aumentando su negocio ahora también vende helados y artículos de bazar, ella con cada crédito recibido ha ido aumentando la variedad de productos con lo cual le quedan mejores ingresos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo Crédito y le gusta porque los  créditos empezó su negocio. Sus metas son seguir aumentando su tienda cada día más.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days the partners of Grupo de Crédito Everest gather at the site of Pueblo Nuevo in the city of Portoviejo.This is a place full of greenery and beautiful scenery, where the people primarily make a living in agriculture and livestock and come out ahead.

In this place lives 29 year old Leticia, who is married to a working man. From this relationship she has a 4 year old daughter, who is in prekindergarten. 

Doña Leticia is a women who has always liked to make her own so as to help her husband to take care of their home. She made a small grocery store in her home two years ago with the help of one of the loans that she received from the group. Here she sells products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, etc. With the help of the loans she has increased her business. Now she also sells ice cream and articles from the bazaar. With each loan she has receives she has increased the variety of products with which she gets better income.

This loan will be used to supply her store. She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, among other staples. From her start in the Grupo Crédito she has liked it because the loans started her business. Her goals are to continue growing her store every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent and other staple products.

loans.name: Aimalefoa

texts.en:
Aimalefoa is 44 years old with 5 children. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years.

Aimalefoa has requested a loan to buy to buy banana tubers, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, water tank, gloves, rake, shovel and chemicals to assist her to run the business.

She joined SPBD in 2010, and hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubers, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, water tank, gloves, rake, shovel and chemicals.

loans.name: Atu

texts.en:
Atu is a 29 year old mother with 2 children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 3 years.

Atu has requested a loan to buy a freezer, a box of chicken, sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, sacks of rice, boxes of tinned fish, boxes of vegetable oil, boxes of milk, a box of sausage and plastic bags to assist her to run the business.

Atu became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, a box of chicken, sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, sacks of rice, boxes of tinned fish, boxes of vegetable oil, boxes of milk, a box of sausage and plastic bags.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia lives in San Martin, Puebla with her son and husband. Alicia is the owner of a small convenience store located inside her house. She has been making a living selling goods for the last 7 years. Alicia and her husband have built the home they live in little by little. They are very proud of what their work has given them. Alicia is now asking for a loan to buy the materials needed to build a wall outside her house. Even though her home needs some additional work, a proper wall is essential to her because she stores all her inventory inside her house and does not feel safe with the wood fence she has right now. She says that after she addresses this task, she will continue with her house. Given Alicia's age, her low income and the fact that she cannot ask for a mortgage for her house, Alicia has no other institutions to turn to for credit. With this credit she will feel safe and secure her store inventory. Alicia will receive technical training and supervision from certified technicians to make sure that the construction is done and that it meets all safety and quality standards. She is excited and looking forward to building her wall.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a wall outside her home

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth lives in San Martin, Puebla with her husband and kids. She is the owner of a small gift shop. Her parents recently gave her a piece of land where she can start building her own house. She has been saving for the last months so she can start the construction and now she is asking for a loan to complete the money she needs to buy the materials for the foundations and the walls of her new home. Elizabeth is excited to start a dream house and to give her family a house that can last a lifetime. She also feels proud of what her work can contribute to the well being of the people she loves the most. Elizabeth makes around $400 USD a month. Due to her low income and the informality of his job, Elizabeth is not able to ask for a credit from other institutions. With this credit, she will receive technical training and supervision from certified technicians to make sure that the construction is done and that it meets all safety and quality standards. Elizabeth is grateful for this opportunity and the hope of a better life.

loans.use: to start the foundations and walls of her new home

loans.name: Maria Clara

texts.en: Maria Clara lives in San Martin, Puebla. When Maria Clara divorced her husband, she felt that she was going to have a very hard time making a living. Maria Clara soon found a job as a housekeeper and has been working there ever since. She feels very proud of what she has been able to accomplish by herself. Maria Clara has built the house she now lives in. She is now asking for a loan to build a wall along the front. She makes around $400 USD a month. Due to her age, her low income and the informality of her job, Maria Clara is not able to get credit fro other institutions. Maria Clara will receive technical training and supervision from certified technicians to make sure that the construction is done and that it meets all safety and quality standards. Maria Clara is excited about this new step and proud of all her accomplishments.

loans.use: to build a wall for her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sheet metal and iron for the roof of his home.

loans.name: Jose Felipe

texts.en: Jose Felipe lives in San Martin, Puebla with his teenage son. He has been working as a construction worker in the town for the last 15 years. Jose Felipe strives to give his son the life he always dreamed of. He wants him to study and work hard to get to university so he can have more opportunities than he did. Jose Felipe works doing construction tasks for the people in town. He says his life is a paradox- the construction worker does not have a proper home. He is building this room for his son, so he can have his own space. Given the low income and the nature of his work he is not able to get a credit from traditional institutions. Jose Felipe is asking for this credit so he can buy the materials needed to finish the roof, a proper solid roof, for the room. Jose Felipe wished to give his son a house he can be proud of.

loans.use: to buy materials to build roof for the new room

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul lives in San Martin, Puebla with his family. Paul is an entrepreneur, a rare kind in this town. Paul set up an internet cafe hoping to provide the people of San Martin connectivity. Paul still lives with his parents but has been saving to build his own house. His is now asking for a loan to buy the materials needed to build the roof. Paul is not subject to credit from other institutions because he has a low income and no property or house he can use as a guarantee. Paul is an optimistic full of life and new ideas. He says he is building his dream home where one day his dream family will grow. Paul is excited about this opportunity and will receive technical training and supervision from certified technicians to make sure that the construction is done and that it meets all safety and quality standards.

loans.use: to build the roof of his new home

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is a single mom that lives in San Martin, Puebla. Elisa works as a housekeeper for a family in the city. She has been saving to build her own house where her child can have a better life and something they can grow in. Elisa has started the construction process and now she is asking for a credit to build the floor of her new home. There are still some other tasks that need to be addressed but with the floor in place she can start buying some furniture and start creating a home for her son. Elisa makes around $600 USD a month. Due to the informality of her work and her low income, she has no access to credit from any other institution. Elisa is looking forward to continue building her house and hopefully soon move out of her parents home. Elisa will receive technical training and supervision from certified technicians to make sure that the construction is done and that it meets all safety and quality standards.

loans.use: to buy materials to build the floor for her house

loans.name: Monserrath

texts.en: Monserrath lives in San Martin Puebla. Along with her husband, Monserrath has a sewing workshop at home. They have been running the workshop for the last seven years. Monserrath's hard work has given her the opportunity to build a house she feels proud of. Years of work have helped her build what she has today. She is still missing a proper floor so she can replace the dirt floor they have. She knows that once this is replaced, her work and her life will change considerable. Monserrath makes around $800 USD through informal jobs. This gives her no opportunity to go to traditional institutions for finance. She is asking help so she can finance the materials needed to build a cement floor in her house. Monserrath know that this will require more work and effort but is excited to finally complete her home.

loans.use: to build a cement floor in her home

loans.name: Toefuataina

texts.en:
Toefuataina is a 36-year-old married woman with four children. She makes and sells meat pies in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business.

Toefuataina needs a loan to buy bags of flour, large pots, a frying pan, a gas stove, and cooking oil. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Toefuataina has been a member of SPBD since 2015.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, large pots, a frying pan, a gas stove, and cooking oil

loans.name: Seleisa

texts.en:
Seleisa is 41 years old and married with nine children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year.

Seleisa needs a loan to buy sprayers, chemicals, seeds, a watering hose, a tiller, a crowbar, and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2015. She will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy sprayers, chemicals, seeds, a watering hose, a tiller, a crowbar, and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee un salón de belleza desde hace 5 años en su lugar de residencia trabaja, tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face has been blurred is 29 years old and is living in a high risk area.  She runs a beauty salon which she has done for 5 years working out of her home.  She has many customers because of her good work, and with her earnings she is able to meet the costs of her household.  She lives in her own house with her husband and two children.  

She is requesting a loan in order to buy products for her beauty salon, such as: creams, shampoo, hairpins, scissors, and other supplies that she needs.  In this way, she will be able to increase her income which will help her gain greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, hairpins, scissors, and other supplies.

loans.name: Cintya Carolina

texts.es:
CINTYA DE 29 AÑOS DE EDAD, SOLTERA SIN HIJOS ES ORIGINARIA DE  LA ZONA CENTRAL DE LA REGIÓN, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORA, RESPONSABLE CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL., Y LUCHA PARA MANTENER SU NEGOCIO Y ESTABLECER EN  ESTA TEMPORADA COMO DE ÚTILES ESCOLARES.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS PLÁSTICOS COMO: BOLSAS DE DIFERENTES TAMAÑOS, BALDES, PICHELES,  TIENE VEINTE AÑOS DE DEDICARSE A DICHA ACTIVIDAD, EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN, EN LA ACTUALIDAD ESTA LUCHANDO POR ESTABLECER LA VENTA DE ÚTILES ESCOLAR Y APROVECHAR LA ENTRADA A CLASES DE NIÑOS Y JÓVENES UNIVERSITARIOS. ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. CINTYA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
