Evelyn is 48 years old and married. Evelyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items for resale like canned goods, shampoo, soft drinks, etc.

Evelyn has been in this business for ten years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items for resale like canned goods, shampoo, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Helen is 58 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Helen has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish net and other materials for her business.

Helen has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Miguel tiene 39 años de edad y vive con su esposa en casa propia, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora puertas, balcones, rejas, techos  entre otros, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a este negocio y tiene mucha experiencia que le ayuda a mejorar cada día su labor, ya tiene mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, por los precios accesibles pero sobre todo porque siempre realiza el trabajo al gusto del cliente; el solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, hierro, metal, herramienta etc. y asi seguir con su trabajo para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Miguel is 39 years old. He lives with his wife in his own home. He has a metallic structures shop. He makes doors, balconies, bars, roofs and more. He has had this business for 15 years and he has a lot of experience that helps him improve his work every day. He has a lot of customers who seek him out because of the quality of his work, the accessible prices, but above all because he always does the work according to the customer's taste. He is asking INTEGRAL for a loan, which will allow him to buy iron, metal, tools, etc. This way he can continue with his work to have better income.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal, tools, etc.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 26 years old and has one child. She is married and her child attends school.

Genalyn is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Genalyn has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed loans six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Haide is 44 years old. Two of her children are still in school.

Haide has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials for her business.

Haide has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 55 years old and has 3 children. She is married with 1 of her children in school.

Shirley is in the agricultural business in the Philippines raising pigs. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Shirley has been raising pigs for 25 years now, though she also earns additional income from fishing. She has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to help sustain her business.

Shirley would like to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ledilla

texts.en:
Ledilla is a married woman, 62 years old, with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ledilla has a rice farming business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Ledilla has been in this business for six years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mimi

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Mimi works hard to support her family.

She has a rice farming business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Mimi is borrowing PHP 17,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

Mimi has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Dilfuzahon

texts.ru: Дилфузахон, 44 года, замужем, мать 3 детей, они активно помогают по хозяйству. Образование у Дилфузахон среднее, с 1990 года занимается сельским хозяйством, а именно полеводством и животноводством. По характеру Дилфузахон очень трудолюбивая и отзывчивая женщина. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы и 1 овца. Также Дилфузахон выращивает на 0,45 ГА собственной земли картофель, помидоры и чеснок. Совокупный доход семьи составляет около 18,000 (KGS) в месяц. Дилфузахон решила развить свою деятельность. Для этого она обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и минеральных удобрений для обработки почвы. Дилфузахон является участником группы "Отабек", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. На прибыль от кредита Дилфузахон планирует отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Dilfuzahon is 44 years old, married, and the mother of three children who take an active part in the farm work.  Dilfuzahon has a secondary education and she has been involved in agriculture (crop farming and animal husbandry) since 1990.  By nature, she is very hardworking and caring.  She currently has two cows and one sheep on her farm.  She also grows potatoes, tomatoes and garlic on 0.45 hectare of her own land.  The family's total income comes to about 18,000 som (KGS) per month.  Dilfuzahon has decided to expand her activity, and for this reason she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 75,000 som (KGS) to buy calves and mineral fertilizers to prepare her land.  Dilfuzahon is a member of the "Otabek" group which comprises two other members.  She is planning to use the profits she'll make from her loan to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy some calves and to cultivate her land.

loans.name: Dastagul

texts.ru: Дастагул, 38 лет, замужем, 5 детей. У Дастагул средне-специальное образование, она на протяжении 14 лет занимается пошивом на заказ, в основном шьет приданное для невест, занавески. У Дастагул есть одна швейная машинка, материал она покупает оптом, наработаны постоянные клиенты. Дополнительно семья занимается животноводством. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Дастагул обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку ткани для дальнейшего шитья. Доходы от кредита Дастагул планирует направлять в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Dastagul is 38 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  She has a specialized secondary education and for the past 14 years, she has been working as a seamstress from home. She mostly sews dowries for future brides as well as curtains.  Dastagul owns one sewing machine and she buys her fabric in bulk.  She now has some regular customers.  In addition, her family is involved in animal husbandry.  In order to further increase her business, Dastagul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy fabrics for sewing.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase material for sewing.

loans.name: Samneang

texts.en:
Samneang, 38, lives in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has three children who are currently in school. 

To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crop to the local dealers. She has been involved in this type of business since 1990. She is able to make an income of USD 2 per day, on average.  

To accelerate her farming operation, Samneang would like to have a cart to help carry some heavy farm supplies. That is why she is applying for a Kiva loan to pay for it. She hopes the cart will help to save time and energy on her farming process. 

Samneang is thankful to all lenders for their financial support. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a cart.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of different brands of ice cream

loans.name: Daysy

texts.es: Daysy de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 30 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Daysy is 60 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband. She has worked tailoring clothes for the past 30 years. Her tailoring shop is located in her house and she has many clients because of the quality of the clothing she makes. She is asking for a loan to purchase threads, needles, diverse fabrics, buttons, elastics, etc., so that she can continue with her work which generates good profits.

loans.use: To purchase threads, needles, diverse fabrics, buttons, elastics, etc.

loans.name: Gladis Consuelo

texts.es: Gladis de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder tener mejores ganancias y así tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Gladis is 57 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband. She has worked selling clothing for men and women for the past 10 years. Her business is located at the municipal market and she has many clients. With the money obtained from these sales she is able to cover some household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothing wholesale to be able to have better profits, and thus have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing wholesale

loans.name: Doeng

texts.en:
Doeng is a 60-year-old married farmer with four children, and she lives in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. So far, she has been cultivating rice for over 14 years. Her husband is 62 years old and he is also a farmer. Two of the four children are working in the factory. 

Doeng wants to help her children in earning the income to support the family, so she would like to request a loan that she will use to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work and also for the family use. This loan will help her children and the family have better traveling conditions. In the future, she hopes to expand her rice farm.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work

loans.name: María Paula Otilia

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Divino Niño Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Paula, tiene 54 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo el  mismo que ya es mayor de edad y vive en Guayaquil. El marido es electricista. 
Doña Paula es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos por catalogo, actualmente también está vendiendo productos naturales de una marca muy reconocida por lo cual sus productos se venden muy bien, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja tres a cuatro días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Lleva más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, y productos naturales que ella vende. Lleva más de 10 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un carro para realizar sus recorridos.
texts.en:
The loan group "Divino Niño Jesus" [Divine Child Jesus] meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa. This canton is also called 'the Sultan of Coffee,' and is known for its large coffee crop--unparalleled in flavor--for its gastronomy and for the warmth of its people. This is where Paula lives. She is 54 years old and is in a common-law marriage, from which she has one adult son who lives in Guayaquil. Her husband is an electrician.

Paula is a housewife who, in order to obtain resources of her own and so be able to help her husband with the household expenses, works selling clothing and shoes by catalog. Currently she is also selling natural products by a well-known brand, so her products sell quite well. Her method of sale is going door-to-door. She works three or four days a week, two to three hours a day. She sells her products on credit and collects payment every eight days. She has been doing this work for over 10 years and she is faring very well.

This loan is to buy clothing, shoes, and natural products that she sells. She has been part of the loan group for over 10 years, and she likes it because, thanks to one of the loans, she began her business. Her dream is to have a car with which to make her routes.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and natural products

loans.name: Roxana Del Transito

texts.es: Roxana de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, desde hace 7 años posee una carnicería ubicada en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con las ventas que realiza y las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en el hogar, Roxana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas carne por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y poder tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Roxana is 44 years old and lives in her own home with her family.  For the past seven years she has run a butcher shop located in her home.  She has many customers due to her good prices.  With her sales and earnings she is able to pay for household expenses.  Roxana is asking for a loan in order to purchase more meat in bulk so that she can continue with her sales and be able to have more economic stability.

loans.use: To purchase meat in bulk.

loans.name: Flora Lucia

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Divino Niño Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Flora, tiene 69 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores e independientes. Su esposo no trabaja por motivos de salud.
Doña Flora con la intención de ganarse algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar ya que su esposo no trabaja se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, trabaja todos los días ya sea en sus recorridos o en su casa, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene más de 12  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana el sustento diario.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace más de 7 años  y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella sale adelante. Sus sueños es tener salud para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The loan group "Divino Niño Jesus" [Divine Child Jesus] meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa. This canton is also called 'the Sultan of Coffee,' and is known for its large coffee crop, for the unparalleled flavor of its coffee, for its gastronomy and for the warmth of its people. Flora, 69 years old, lives in this canton. She is married and has four independent, adult children. Her husband does not work due to health reasons.

With the intention of making some money herself, and so being able to support her home, since her husband does not work, she started a business. Flora sells all types of clothing. She sells both door-to-door and from her house, where she has a small shop. She works every day, whether making her routes or from home. She sells to her clients on credit and collects payment every 15 days. She has been doing this work for over 12 years, and it is how she puts food on her table.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes. She has been in the loan group for over seven years, and she likes it because thanks to the loans, she can do better for herself. Her dream is for herself and her family to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes

loans.name: Erika Anabella

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Divino Niño Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Erika, tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera de una  hija de 12  años de edad la cual  estudian en un colegio de la localidad. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. 
Doña Erika con la intención de ganar algo  y con esto poder salir adelante ya es padre y madre a la vez se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y queso, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella se desplaza hasta Machalilla en un carro de su propiedad  a vender sus productos a esta ciudad donde tiene muy buenos clientes. Trabaja todos los días y casi todo el día, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra lo que es ropa cada 8 días y el queso vende al contado o si deja en cantidades grandes cobra al otro día. Tiene 17 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a su hija.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa y quesos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
The communal banking group Divine Child Jesus meets every two weeks in the town of Jipijapa, a region known for the name of the coffee sultan and for extensive coffee plantations which offer coffee with an incomparable flavor. Jipijapa is also known for its food and the warmth of its people. 

Erika lives in this town.  She is 35 years old and is a single mother with a 12 year old daughter who studies in a local school.  Erika lives with her daughter in the home of her parents. 

Erika, in the hopes of making a living and thus getting ahead, since she is both mother and father, works in business.  She sells clothing of all kinds as well as cheese.  She works going door to door.  She also travels as far as Machalilla in her own car in order to sell her products in that city, where she has good customers.  She works every day and almost all day.  She sells to her customers on credit and charges for clothing every week and sells cheese for cash.  If she sells large quantities of cheese she collects the next day.  She has been working in this field for 17 years and in this way she is able to help her daughter get ahead.  This loan will be used to purchase clothing and cheese.  Erika has been with the banking group Divine Child Jesus since the group's inception and she likes it because the loans allow her to get ahead.  Her dream is to offer the best to her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and cheese.

loans.name: Rea

texts.en:
Rea is a married woman who is 25 years old. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rea has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rea requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish net and other materials for her fishing business.

Rea has been in this business for three years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net and other materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Sar, 46, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children in total; one is married and two are single. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming process; primarily, she grows cassava and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in the market. So far, she has been in this business for almost 20 years. On average, she is able to make earnings of USD $5.00 a day.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides. She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 56 years old, married and had three children. To gain income, she opened up a small panciteria and sari-sari store (variety store). Alejandra and her husband manage the panciteria, wherein they cook pancit (noodles topped with vegetables and eggs) to sell. 

She wants to continue selling delicious foods, so she is borrowing additional capital of 50,000 PHP. She will buy grocery items, soft drinks, pancit and ingredients to cook and sell. This will help improve her sales and profits as well.

Someday, she hopes to save in a fund for emergency purposes and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, soft drinks, pancit (noodles topped with vegetables and eggs) and ingredients to cook and sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Remedios is 60 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Remedios has a business of buying and selling shrimp and crabs in the Philippines. Remedios requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional shrimp and crabs to sell.

Remedios has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional shrimp and crabs to sell

loans.name: Rolinda

texts.en:
Rolinda is 56 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rolinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, soft drinks, spices, coffee, milk, etc.

Rolinda has been in this business for 15 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, soft drinks, spices, coffee, milk, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Alva

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Divino Niño Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos 18 y 15 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Rosa es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa,  ella sale a recorrer casi  todos los días en sus ratos libres ya que no tiene horario fijo, deja sus productos a  crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permite ganar algo por su cuenta para beneficio de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Lleva más de 5 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: The Credit Group Divino Niño Jesús meets every 15 days at the Canton Jipijapa, a location known as the queen of coffee for its extensive coffee crops with an unrivaled flavor, its gastronomy, and friendly people. Mrs. Rosa lives in this location, she is 41 years old. She is married with two children ages 18 and 15 years old, who are currently studying in high school. Her husband is a merchant. Dona Rosa is a housewife who, to obtain her own income and help her husband with the household expenses, sells all types of clothing and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women.) she sells door to door and also sells from her house. She goes out everyday in her spare time, since she doesn't have a fixed schedule. She leaves her products with her clients and sells on credit, collecting every eight or fifteen days. She has been doing this for the past five years, which allows her to earn something on her own to benefit the family. This loan is to buy perfumes, cremes, cosmetics, and clothing. She has been a member of the Credit Group for over 5 years and she likes it because the loans allow her to finance her business. Her dreams are to give a better education to her children.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, cremes, cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Rin, 63, lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has six children in total; two are single, and four are married. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, grows rice and sells her agriculture product to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this business for forty years. She is able to make an income of USD 2.00 per day, on average.

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated, and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to the lack of funds, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation.

She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funded to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation.

loans.name: Rossana

texts.en:
Rossana is 34 years old and has one child. Rossana is married, and her child is still in school.

Rossana is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rossana has been in the business for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sok Rin

texts.en:
Sok Rin, 27 years old, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children in total who are currently in school. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, grows rice and sells the crops to the local dealers. So far, she has been in this type of business for  more than ten years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD $2.00 a day. 

As supplementary income, she came up with a new business idea. She wants to raise cows for sale. However, her insufficient capital investment doesn't allow her to do so. Therefore, she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy cows. She hopes that this new trade will help to improve her living standards. 

She is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 38 years old and single with one child.

Susan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, sugar, milk, etc.

Susan has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fishing.

Susan aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Adelfa works hard to support her family.

She has a weaving business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending.  Adelfa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her weaving business.

Adelfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Edda Matilde

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Divino Niño Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Edda, tiene 52 años de edad, está separada pero  de esa relación tienen cinco hijos, 4 mayores de edad y el menor de  17 años el cual estudia en colegio y es el que aun vive con ella, al igual que un nieto de 5 años el mismo que está en escuela y que están a su cargo.
Doña Edda con la intención de ganar algo para sacar adelante a sus hijos  se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa interior de damas y niños, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene unas vitrinas,  ella en su casa también todas las tardes instala un pequeño local en el cual vende alas de pollo asadas acompañadas de plátano asado lo cual es de mucho agrado de su variada clientela que a diario pasan por el lugar y se sirven de sus deliciosos alimentos. Tiene más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana el sustento para ella y su familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa interior, alitas de pollo y otros víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños es que nunca le falte nada a su familia.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank, "Divino Niño Jesús", meets every 15 days in the Cantón Jipijapa. This Cantón is known by its nickname, "The Sultana of Coffee", because of its extensive coffee crop, that has an incomparable flavor. This area is also known for its food, and the warmth of its people. 

It is in this place that Sra. Edda lives. She is 50 years old, separated from her spouse, and has five children. Four of them are grown, and the youngest (17 years old) is in school, and is still living with her. Her grandchild (age 5) is also in school, and under her care. 

Edda intends to earn a living so that she and her children can get ahead. She is a merchant who sells ladies' and children's underwear. Edda generates her sales by going door-to-door, She also sells from her home, where she has some display cases. In her home, in the evenings, she also installs a small store, where she sells roasted chicken accompanied by roasted banana. The delicious food she serves is much enjoyed by her varied customers, who daily pass by the place. Edda has been working at this business for more than 4 years, in order to support herself, and her family.  

This loan is going to be used to buy underwear, chicken wings, and other supplies to prepare food. Edda has spent 10 years in the Communal Bank, and enjoys being a member, because of the help that the loans have given her. His dream is that her family never wants for anything.

loans.use: to buy underwear, chicken wings and other supplies.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 58 years old and married with five children. Remedios works very hard to provide for them.

Remedios runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, spices, etc.

Remedios has been in this business for five years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, spices, etc.

loans.name: Ana Casilda

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.
Tiene una farmacia en la que vende todo tipo de medicamentos. Inicio el negocio hace 8 años y ha tenido buena acogida en el sector.
Ella desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser mas prospera. 
El dinero será invertido en la compra de medicamentos variados con los que actualmente no cuenta.
Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de entidades como Interactuar que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Ana is a woman who is charged up and ready to face the world and lead a full life thanks to her efforts. She has a pharmacy where she sells all kinds of medications. She started the business eight years ago and it has been well received in the neighborhood.

She would like to expand her product offerings and improve her sales by injecting capital into her business. This is why she is asking for a loan to give her an opportunity to become more prosperous. The money will be invested in the purchase of a variety of medications that she doesn't currently carry. 

She has great hopes for her business and thinks that her future can improve considerably thanks to the support of organizations such as Interactuar that make it possible for people to dream of a better and more stable life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of medicines that she currently doesn't carry.

loans.name: Thyda

texts.en: Thyda is an 18-year-old single daughter of a family who lives in the Tbong Khmum Province in Cambodia. She is pursuing a Bachelor’s degree, majoring in banking and finance in the first year at a university in the province. Her father is a taxi driver and her mother earns some income from selling porridge and kids’ snack food. Thyda doesn’t have enough finances to pay her tuition fees from the first to the fourth year. Therefore, she would like to take out a loan. This loan will help her in earning a Bachelor’s degree. For her future job after graduation, she wants to work in a bank with a decent salary, so she will be able to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: I

texts.en:
I, 50, lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has seven children in total; six are single and one is married. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, grows rice and sells her agriculture products to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this business for 30 years. She is able to make an income of USD $5.00 per day, on average.  

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living space for the household. Due to the lack of funds, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funding to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Gissela Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Divino Niño Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Gissela, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación  tiene un hijo de 4 meses de nacido el cual es su alegría. El marido es policía. 
Doña Gissela es una mujer que le gusta a base de trabajo ganar lo suyo con la finalidad de ayudar con los gastos del hogar,  ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y a la cría de pollos y aves de corral, tiene una granja en la cual por temporadas mete hasta  300 pollos los mismos que los cría  por espacio de tres meses y luego los entregan a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa, su marido le ayuda con esto cuando él puede, lleva más de 5 años con este negocio el cual le da muchas satisfacciones. 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, pollos, alimentos y medicinas para pollos. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos sigue con su negocio. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su bebé.
texts.en:
The Divino Niño Jesús Credit Group meets every fifteen days in the Jipijapa Canton.  It is known as “La Sultana del Café” for its vast plantations of incomparably flavored coffee, its cuisine, and the warmth of its people.

Señora Gissela lives here.  She is 26, and she is common-law-married with a four-month-old baby, who is her joy. Her husband is a policeman.  

 Doña Gissela likes working in order to earn her own money to help with the household expenses; she sells clothing of all kinds, and she raises chickens and poultry.  She has a barn where she keeps 300 chickens, raising them for a period of three months then selling them to distributors who come to her house.  Her husband helps her with this whenever he can.  She has been in this business for five years, and it has given her great satisfaction.  

This loan is to purchase clothing, chickens, chicken feed, and medications for chickens. She has been in the credit group for four years, and she likes it because the loans help her to keep her business going.

Her dream is to give the best to her baby.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, chickens, chicken feed, and medications for chickens.

loans.name: Seun

texts.en:
Seun, 52, is a married woman from Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two single children. To make a living, she opens a small store in her community to sell pork. So far, she has been involved in her business for five years. She is able to make an income of USD 7.00 per day, on average.  

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to the lack of funds, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funded to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: San

texts.en: San, 28, lives in a rural area of Kampong Chan Province, Cambodia. He has only one child who is currently in school. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business on a small farm, primarily growing rice. He sells his agricultural products to local dealers and customers at the market. So far, he has been in this type of business for more than 10 years. On average, he is able to make an earning of USD 3.00 a day. Currently, he would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow him to have a personal vehicle so that he can experience a convenient way of travelling. He is thankful to all lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Sok Eng

texts.en: Sok Eng, 30, lives in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has only one child who is currently in school. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farm, which is located in her community. So far, she has been in this type of business for more than 10 years. Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: China

texts.en:
China is a single woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. China is 49 years old and two of her children are still in school.

China has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. China requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish and salt for her dried fish making business.

China has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish and salt for her dried fish making business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish, salt and other materials for her dried fish making business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy more fish, salt and other materials for her dried fish making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband with purchasing precious gemstones for resale.

loans.name: Edwin Geovanni

texts.es:
Edwin, de 25 años de edad, estudió bachillerato comercial opción contador, está acompañado y tiene tres hijos, su compañera de vida trabaja en una pastelería.

Edwin, es motorista de una panadería, trabajo que desempeña de lunes a sábado en horarios de 5:00 a.m. a 10:00 a.m. y de 1:00 p.m. a 5:00 p.m. Antes, trabajaba como empleado en un supermercado.

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar una motocicleta, para trasladarse hacia su trabajo, ya que por su horario tiene que entrar muy temprano y salir tarde, es por eso que considera que con el crédito solventará esa necesidad. 

Edwin, en un futuro sueña con construir su propia casa, para darle más bienestar y comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin, 25, graduated with a degree in commercial accounting. He has a partner and three children. His life partner works in a pastry shop.

Edwin is a driver for a bakery. He works Monday through Saturday, from 5:00 a.m. to 10:00 a.m., and 1:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. Previously, he worked for a supermarket.

The loan will be used to buy a motorcycle, for commuting to work. Since his schedule requires him to arrive early and leave late, he believes that the loan will be a solution to this requirement.

In the future, Edwin's dreams of building his own house, to provide for the welfare and comfort of his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Reyes María

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Divino Niño Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos  mayores de edad, uno de ellos  aún viven con ella. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.
Doña María una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y productos Yanbal  (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja tres  días por semana en sus recorridos. Actualmente y con la ayuda de este crédito espera arrendar un local y vender productos lácteos con lo cual espera mejorar sus ingresos, lleva más de 8 años con estas ventas y ahora espera con este nuevo negocio poder cumplir muchos años más. 
Este crédito es  para comprar productos lácteos, yogurt y leche para empezar con la venta de todos estos productos además de perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son que su negocio sea un éxito.
texts.en:
The Divino Niño Jesús Credit Group meets every fifteen days in the Jipijapa Canton, which is known as “La Sultana del Café” because of its extensive plantations of incomparably flavored coffee, its cuisine, and the warmth of its people.

Señora María lives here. She is 60 years old and married, with 4 grown children, one of whom still lives at home.  Her husband is a security guard.

Doña María likes working in order to help her husband with their household expenses. She works selling clothing of all kinds, shoes, and Yanbal products, such as beauty products, cosmetics, and ladies’ perfumes and accessories. She sells door-to-door, working three days a week making her rounds.

With the help of this loan, she hopes to rent a small shop and sell dairy products, by which she hopes to improve her income.  She has been carrying out these sales for 8 years, and now she hopes that she will be able to work many years more in this new business.

This loan is to purchase dairy products such as yogurt and milk, in order to start selling all these items, in addition to perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothing.  She has been in the credit group from the beginning, and she likes it because the loans help her to get ahead.  Her dream is that her business may be a success.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products, yogurt, milk, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Ligia Aurora

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Divino Niño Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Ligia, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es mecánico. 
Doña Ligia es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y con sus ingresos ir mejorando su hogar, ella  tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa donde vende productos   como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, frutas y legumbres, carnes, pescado, entre otras cosas. Ella también compra pollos en pie, los pela y los vende enteros o pro libras lo cual le deja buenas ganancias adicionales a los de su tienda,  trabaja todos los días desde las 06h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, lleva 4 años con su tienda la cual comenzó con el crédito que recibió del grupo.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, pollos y otros víveres. Lleva 4 años en el  Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
The credit group Divino Niño Jesús [Divine Child Jesus] meets every 15 days en the Jipijapa region. The region is called the coffee queen because of its vast coffee plantations of incomparable flavor, its gastronomy, and the quality of its people.

Here lives Ligia, who is 60 years old and married. From her marriage she has 3 adult, independent children. Her husband is a mechanic.

Ligia is a woman who likes to make herself useful, and with her income, she continually makes improvements to her home. She has a supply store in her house where she sells products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergent, fruit, legumes, meat, fish, and other items. She also buys live chickens, which she plucks and sells live or by the pound, giving her good supplemental income in addition to what she gets from her store. She works every day from 6am until 8pm, sometimes even later. She has had the store for 4 years, after starting it with a loan that she received from the credit group.

She will use this loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, chickens, and other supplies. She has been part of the credit group for 4 years, and she likes it because she started her business thanks to the loans. Her dream is to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, chicken, and other supplies

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nelita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of vegetables business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Nelita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell for her buy and sell of vegetables business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Nelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emma is 58 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Emma has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional more fish and salt for her dried fish making business.

Emma has been in this business for 29 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish and salt for her dried fish making business

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 71 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell.

Milagros has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from farming rice.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. Gemma is married and has a buy and sell of dried fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Janita

texts.en:
Janita is 40 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Janita has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of charcoal business for 10 years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Renacer está en su ciclo número 15 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, a través del trabajo en equipo se han comprometido a  trabajar y a realizar actividades   para llegar a los objetivos en común que tienen dentro del  grupo. 
La Sra. Maria se dedica a la venta de ropas y queso, ella está muy contenta por la oportunidad que recibe ya que al formar parte del programa de comités podrá mejorar sus condiciones de vida y poder dar de esa forma un mejor nivel de vida a sus clientes. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora, que se esfuerza día a día por una vida mejor.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas varias, ya que por medio de esto podrá tener una mayor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Renacer [Rebirth] Group is in its fifteenth cycle in the Women's Communal Bank Program, in which all the women work and help each other to get ahead.  By working as a team, they have committed themselves to working and carrying out activities in order to achieve their common goals.  

Señora María sells clothing and cheese.  She is very happy for the opportunity that she is receiving, as being part of the bank program will enable her to improve her living conditions and in this way, provide her customers with a better standard of living.

She is a very enterprising woman with a fighting spirit, who strives everyday for a better life. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of  various garments, as by these means she will be able to have more variety to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase various garments to sell.

loans.name: Jobeth

texts.en:
Jobeth is 37 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

Jobeth is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jennifer works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Jennifer is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, etc. for her food production/food vending business.

Jennifer has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat and spices for her food production business

loans.name: Niet's Group

texts.en: Niet’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang Province in Cambodia. Niet works as a farmer and she also does extra work selling groceries to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lalaine is 51 years old and has one child who is in school.

Lalaine has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lalaine requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Lalaine has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices, and soy sauce for her food production business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fish net for her fishing business.

Mercedes has been in this business for one year. Mercedes earns more income from raising pigs.

Mercedes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish net for her fishing business

loans.name: Lelanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lelanie works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from personal collection. Lelanie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish, salt and other materials for her dried fish making business.

Lelanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish, salt and other materials for her dried fish making business

loans.name: Koévi

texts.fr: Hoévi est une femme veuve âgée de 69 ans et vit à Adamavo. Elle habite avec son enfant et ne se fatigue pas à travailler pour son épanouissement. Hoévi vend des perles qu’elle monte elle-même pour le goût de ses clients. Hoévi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé où elle achète les perles à des coûts favorables. Pour acheter de nouvelles perles et réaliser ses conceptions, Hoevi demande ce crédit pour financer ses achats et tirer une bonne marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en: Hoévi is a 69-year old widow living in Adamavo. She lives with her son and works tirelessly to improve their life. Hoévi sells pearls   she strings herself according to her customer's wishes. Hoévi stocks up twice a month at the main market of Lomé, where she buys pearls at a reasonable price. In order to restock pearls and create her jewelry, Hoevi is requesting this loan to finance her purchases and be able to obtain a good profit margin.

loans.use: to buy seven pouches of pearls and three sets of string.

loans.name: Marina Angela

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Divino Niño Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Marina, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 22, 15 y 10  años de edad, los dos menores  estudian en  colegio y  escuela, todos sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Marina es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a recorrer la ciudad tres a cuatro días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, deja sus productos a  crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Lleva más de 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad con lo cual se gana algo que lo invierte en la educación de sus hijos que para ella es lo más importante.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva más de 9 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The credit group Divino Niño Jesús [Divine Child Jesus] meets every 15 days en the Jipijapa region. The region is called the coffee queen because of its vast coffee plantations of incomparable flavor, its gastronomy, and the quality of its people.

Here lives Marina, who is 36 years old and married. From her marriage she has 3 children who are 22, 15, and 10 years old. The two younger ones are in high school and primary school. All her children still live with her. Her husband is a chauffeur.

Maria is a housewife and, in order to make her own income to use to help her husband cover household expenses, she works selling Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). She sells door-to-door. She heads out to travel the city 3-4 days per week for 2-3 hours a day.

She sells her products on credit and collects every 8 days. She has been in this business for more than 8 years, which lets her earn a little to put toward her children's education, which she considers most important.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, and cosmetics. She has been part of this credit group for over 9 years, and she likes it because one of the loans helped her start her business. Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, and cosmetics

loans.name: Carolina Adriana

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Divino Niño Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Carolina, tiene 70 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos, uno de ellos falleció y 6 son  mayores de edad, uno vive con ellos junto a su familia ya que está comprometido. Su esposo no trabaja por la edad. 
Doña Carolina es una gran madre  que para ganarse el sustento diario para ella y su familia se dedica a la cría de pollos, tiene un lugar adecuado para la cría de sus animalitos los mismos que al venderlos le dejan buenos ingresos que le sirven para salir adelante , tiene hasta  100 pollos por temporada los mismos que cría por espacio de tres mese tiempo adecuado para que tengan un buen peso y luego los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa, de esta forma ella se gana el sustento diario para ella y su querido esposo.
Este crédito es para comprar alimentos y medicinas para los pollos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan  los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The credit group Divino Niño Jesús [Divine Child Jesus] meets every 15 days in the Jipijapa region. The region is called the coffee queen because of its vast coffee plantations of incomparable flavor, its gastronomy, and the quality of its people.

Here lives Carolina, who is 70 years old and married. She has 7 children with her husband. One of them passed away and 6 are adults; one son lives with Carolina and her husband, along with the family he has with his fiance. Her husband doesn't work because of his age.

Carolina is a wonderful mother who raises poultry for a living, to provide for herself and her family. She has a good place where she raises her little animals; they bring her a good price when she sells them, enabling her to make a living. She has up to 100 chickens each season, and she cares for them for three months - enough time for them to become a good weight - and then she sells them to dealers who come to her house. This is how she makes a daily living for herself and her beloved husband.

This loan is to buy food and medicine for the chickens. She has been part of the credit group since its beginning, and she likes it because of the help its loans provide. Her dream is to continue forward successfully and enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy food and medicine for chickens

loans.name: Daryam

texts.en: Daryam is 45 years old, married and has three children. She is managing a food stall while her husband is a government employee. Daryam manages her food stall very well in order to gain a good income for education purposes. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy ingredients, meat and vegetables to cook and sell in her food stall. Someday, she hopes to continue selling delicious meals and gain good profits for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, meat and vegetables to cook and sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 35 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Dina has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of charcoal business for five years and earns additional income from food vending.

Dina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 54 years old and married with three children. Lilia works very hard to provide for them.

Lilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, soap, detergent, soft drinks, coffee, milk, etc.

Lilia has been in this business for 25 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchse more items to sell like shampoo, soap, detergent, soft drinks, coffee and milk

loans.name: Santa Teresita Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Teresita está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan con la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de las integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una persona que se esfuerza por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida día a día es la Sra. Ana, es muy luchadora y trabajadora, todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano, se levanta a hacer las comidas ella misma, y después los sale a vender de manera ambulante por su barrio. Comenta que le va muy bien ya que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella las delicias que prepara.
Ana pide este préstamo para poder surtirse con diversos tipos de productos, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne, hortalizas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que recibe que le permitirá ir mejorando y superando su situación de vida cada día.
texts.en:
The group, Santa Teresita, is in its 5th cycle of the Women’s Communal Bank Program.  The whole group is completing the poverty elimination questionnaire. Two of the members are living below the poverty line, i.e. in extreme poverty. 

One person that strives to improve her day to day life, is Sra. Ana. She is feisty and hardworking. Everyday, she starts working very early. She rises to make the meals herself, and then she goes to sell them as a street vendor, in her neighborhood.

She says that it is going very well, and that she already has many good customers, that always buy the delicacies that she prepares.

Ana requests this loan to be able to stock up with various kinds of products, such as greens, spices, meat, vegetables, and more. In this way, she can continue with her sales as they come. She appreciates the opportunity that she receives, that enables her to keep improving, and overcoming her living situation every day.

loans.use: to buy greens, spices, meat, vegetables, and more.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a married woman with eleven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Luisa is 49 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Luisa has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. Luisa requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish, salt and other materials for her business making dried fish.

Luisa has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish, salt and other materials for her business making dried fish.

loans.name: Lulu

texts.en:
Lulu is 43 years old, married and has four children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Lulu requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers, new seeds, plastic bags, etc.

Lulu has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lulu would like to save enough money to be able to afford afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers, new seeds, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marites is 54 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Marites has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell at her stall.

Marites has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 38 years old and married with four children. With three children still in school, Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like spices, shampoo, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Melanie has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to  puchase additional stock to sell like spices, shampoo, noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more variety of garments for reselling.

loans.name: Dendy

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet Dendy, one of Ruma’s agents. Dendy lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He works as a civil servant and he already joined Ruma a year ago. He wanted to join Ruma because he wanted to learn about how to start up a business, as well as give more contribution to his community. 

As the business grows, Dendy is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Dendy improve his business and accordingly, his community that needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Dendy is the one who is sitting. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 42 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Merlita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Merlita has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Merlita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory for the general store.

loans.name: Metelyn

texts.en:
Metelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell herbal products business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of herbal products to sell. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Metelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of herbal products to sell

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 39 years old and married with three children. With two children still in school, Michelle works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like noodles, canned goods, soap, coffee, milk, sugar, etc. She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as those mentioned. 

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like noodles, canned goods, soap, coffee, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband to purchase used clothing to resell.

loans.name: Nora Jaqueline

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Divino Niño Jesús se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Nora, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad que aún viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Nora es una mujer que le gusta a base de trabajo ganar sus propios ingresos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo negocio que empezó hace poco tiempo, ella también le da parte del crédito a su marido para  que él lo utilice en su negocio, el tiene un negocio de comidas rápidas en el terminal local donde vende hamburguesas, hot dogs y otras comidas rápidas, además de jugos y gaseosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 14h00  hasta las 21h00. Lleva más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual siempre se gano la vida.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, pan, salchichas, carne, gaseosas y otros víveres para las comidas rápidas. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank, "Divino Niño Jesús", meets every 15 days in the Cantón Jipijapa. This cantón is known by its nickname, "The Sultana of Coffee", because of its extensive coffee crop, that has an incomparable flavor. This area is also known for its food, and the warmth of its people.

It is in this place that Sra. Nora lives. She is 52 years old, married, and has four grown children, who still live with her. Her husband is a merchant. Doña Nora is a woman who likes to work to earn her own income. She makes a living by selling clothes, with a catalog business that she started recently. She will also give part of the loan to her husband, for him to use in his business. He has a fast food business in the local terminal, where he sells hamburgers, hot dogs, and other fast foods, as well as juices and soft drinks. He works every day from 10am till 9pm. He has made his living this way for more than 15 years.

This loan will be used to buy clothes, bread, sausages, meat, sodas, and other supplies for making fast food. Nora has been with her Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys being a member, because of the help that the loans have provided. Her dreams are to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, bread, sausage, meat, soft drinks, and other supplies.

loans.name: Yasri

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Yasri.
 
Yasri lives in South Tangerang, located about an hour's drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and 4 children (two daughters and two sons). He owns a stall where every day he sells consumer products, small snacks and drinks, and provides mobile payment services for his community. 

Yasri joined Ruma in 2014 and this is the second time he has applied for a loan through Kiva. His community have always seen him as a trusted mobile service provider, and he has a friendly and responsible personality. 

At the moment, Yasri is becoming the agent of Ruma’s product called Mapan. Mapan is an e-commerce facility for lower communities. By offering Mapan to his customers, Yasri will be able to receive orders from customers who want to buy products that have been listed in Ruma's Mapan catalogue. When a customer orders, Yasri will simply send an SMS in a special format to the SMS center, and then the customer will pay to him. After this, Ruma’s agent will come to him to collect the money and within 3-5 days, the product will be delivered right to the customer's door. 

As the business grows, Yasri is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community. 

Your loan will be very useful and important to Yasri, as it will help him to improve his business and subsequently his community, who need access to such services.

In the photo, Yasri is standing in his own small stall. He will be very thankful for your support.

loans.use: To provide more mobile payment services for his community

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

Rosalie would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to assist her husband in purchasing a variety of gents shoes to resell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila works hard to support her family. Mila is widowed and has a dried fish business in the Philippines. Mila has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

Mila has requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase polythene sheets and color plotters for printing

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 3 years to 13 years. She describes herself as hardworking. 

She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are regular ones. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate finances. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of ingredients to prepare food to sell. 

Her business goal is to have a hotel within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a better life. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is a 36-year-old, married woman with four children who are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Olivia has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish, salt and other materials for her business. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish, salt and other materials for her dried fish making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy printing paper for her husband's retail business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to replace the auto rickshaw body.

loans.name: Doraliza

texts.es:
